This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually. With the requested money she will buy more ingredients for the preparation of her delicious dishes as well as modernize her restaurant in order to increase the number of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Amélie

texts.fr: Née le 09 Septembre 1966, A. Amélie réside depuis sept ans au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Amélie est mariée à ANADI Dominique, un professeur de sport, et vit ensemble avec lui. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant. Le mari de Amélie assure surtout les charges de la famille ; mais Amélie lui vient parfois en aide grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Il y a environs 4 ans que Amélie s’est lancée dans la vente de charbon et de fagots de bois à son domicile. Amélie vend également des œufs, ce qui lui permet de diversifier ses sources de revenus. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Amélie s’approvisionne. Amélie a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. La clientèle de Amélie s’accroît au jour le jour ; et Amélie n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose sont faibles. C’est la raison pour laquelle Amélie sollicite un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Born on September 9, 1966, Amélie A. has lived for the past seven years in the Zogbo district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Dominique Anadi, a PE teacher, and lives with him. They do not have any children. Amélie's husband usually takes care of their household expenses, but Amélie helps out sometimes with the money she makes from her business. Approximately four years ago, Amélie started selling coal and bundles of firewood at her home. She also sells eggs, which has given her an additional source of income. She buys her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has already received one loan through Alidé, which she repaid in full. Her customer base is growing day by day and Amélie is unable to keep up with demand because she does not have the financial means to do so. This is why she is requesting a second loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase trays of eggs.

loans.name: Elva Maria

texts.es:
Elva María R. D. C., es una mujer activa que a sus 70 años vive y goza del Carnaval en su barrio Buenos Aires, donD. para esta época se respira el ambiente pintoresco D. las fiestas patrimonio más importantes D. la ciudad  y una D. las mas alegres del Colombia; esta es, el carnaval D. Barranquilla, que con su estilo popular y  libertario, refleja el espíritu jovial y creativo del Barranquillero y afirma su pertenencia al Caribe. 

DesD. que finalizan las fiestas naviD.ñas, Elva María con su hija disponen su mente, organizan su negocio y su casa con típicos adornos alusivos a esta tradición, donD. tiene presencia el mestizaje en todas sus manifestaciones populares, como si quisieran  recordar el origen remoto del Carnaval, que vino a América desD. España y que continua su espíritu D. renovación y cambio similar al que animó estas fiestas en Europa. 

Elva María además D. ser alegre, es una mujer emprendedora que elabora alimentos entre los cuales están los frituras, derivados D. la harina, arepas, caribañolas-amasijos D. yuca  y papa rellenos con carne y verduras-, que venD. en tiendas y también  D. manera individual a sus vecinos del barrio; ella tiene en su casa una miscelánea surtida D. productos D. papelería y accesorios variados que adornan a mujeres y niñas D. acuerdo a cada temporada del año. 

Su primer negocio nació D. la tradición D. su madre en la preparación D. estos mismos productos que ella ahora venD. y a los que ha agregado  la elaboración D.  los mas deliciosos postres, pues le encanta el arte D. la culinaria, actividad que nunca ha dejado D. realizar; ella también vendía Sancochos o sopas,  pero notó que muchas personas al verla prosperar, empezaron a a hacer lo mismo y decidió suspenderlo provisionalmente y abrir una miscelánea que organizó en su casa. Cuando se inició como negociante,  su esposo Joaquín C. viajaba mucho trabajando en una empresa Naviera  y el negocio la ayudaba a no sentirse sola; él ahora  está pensionado y disfruta  en su compañía D. una vida tranquila y feliz.
  
Elva, ha recibido tres créditos a través D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y los ha reembolsado oportunamente, porque los ha invertido en la compra D. mercancías para la miscelánea  e insumos para la preparación D. alimentos que en cada época le sugiere el mercado: la naviD.ña, carnavalera, Semana Santa etc. Con las utilidades producidas por el negocio ha logrado hacer reparaciones y adecuaciones en su vivienda; porque su esposo con el dinero D. la pensión por tiempo laboral concluido, asume los gastos por alimentación y servicios; la  unión D. ambos ingresos ha generado su éxito en el negocio. Su próximo crédito por valor D. $$2.000.000, lo utilizará en comprar mercancías para surtir la miscelánea con útiles escolares, planea  además vender refrescantes, exquisitos y saludables bolis- jugos congelados, elaborados con leche y frutas frescas, empacadas en bolsas plásticas-, estas serán las delicias que próximamente degustarán sus clientes para aliviar el calor corporal que genera  temperatura ambiente D. la Costa.

Su meta  familiar  a mediano plazo, es comprar un local en un sitio D. mas salida  comercial, pues en su casa debe sacar las vitrinas para  que la mercancía sea vista por los clientes; su meta a corto plazo es comprar  un  tricicarro D. perros calientes-triciclo con carpa, vaporera para panes y salchichas; insertos con tapa corrediza para cebolla, queso, papas, etc.; cubetas para las salsas, en acero inoxidable; con cava en poliestireno expandido forrada en acero inoxidable, y espacio interior para guardar el pan- el cual será instalado en la entrada D. su negocio ya reconocido por la venta D. alimentos y por hacer la fiesta D. disfraces mas esperada por los vecinos D. su barrio,  el famoso Lunes D. carnaval, tercer día D. estas fiestas, caracterizado porque desD. muy temprano suena el gran  PICK-UP, -amplia caja D. sonidos, con 6 bafles entre bajo y medio, 2 columnas, 3 maquinas D. 8 transistores,  un ecualizador, un modulo D. 3 CD, dos columnas para brillo- y el  grupo D. millo para animar esta reunión con música folclórica del Caribe. En este sector D. Barranquilla la ya reconocida “fiesta donD. los  Cuetos”,  apellido D. esta familia,   es el lugar D. encuentro D. sus vecinos  todos los años; ellos solo pagan el consumo D. alimentos y bebidas que Elva María ofrece a las familias que allí se congregan para hacer su gran rumba carnavalera y ella a su vez gana su dinerito y se goza su fiesta.
texts.en:
At 70 years of age, Elva María R. D. C. is an active woman who lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires. She enjoys Carnival season, the time of year when a picturesque atmosphere sets the background for the most important cultural festival in the city. The Carnival of Barranquilla is also one of the happiest occasions in Colombia. Its popular and carefree style reflects the youthful spirit and creativity of the people of Barranquilla, making it an essential part of the Caribbean.

Once the Christmas holidays are over, Elva María and her daughter begin organizing her home business with all the decorations pertaining to Carnival, a mixture of the modern with the more traditional type that reflects the event’s origins. The tradition of Carnival was brought to the Americas from Spain and continues to promote the spirit of renewal and change that inspired this holiday season in Europe.

In addition to being known for her cheerful personality, Elva María is an enterprising woman who prepares snacks such as fried foods maD. of flour, arepas (flatbread served with various fillings or toppings), and caribañolas (dumplings maD. of cassava and potato dough, stuffed with meat and vegetables). She sells these snacks to stores and individually to neighbors in her area. Elva María also has a retail shop in her home that is stocked with stationery and various seasonal accessories worn by women and girls.

Her snack business was a tradition passed on to her by her mother, who also prepared these same products for sale. Elva María has added the most delicious desserts to her offerings, as she loves the art of cooking. She also sells sancocho (a traditional soup), but she noticed that many people in the neighborhood started prospering, so she suspended selling food temporarily so that she could open and organize the retail shop in her home. When this business started, her husband Joaquin C. traveled frequently for work since he was employed by a shipping company. Running a home business helped to make her feel that she was not alone. Today, her husband is retired and enjoys a peaceful and happy life.

Elva María has received three previous loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and has repaid them all on time. She used the proceeds to purchase miscellaneous goods and supplies for preparing food at different times of the year: Christmas, Carnival season, Easter, etc. With the profits generated by her business, she has managed to make repairs and modifications to her home because her husband’s pension was used to pay for the completion of the work. This freed up her income to devote on other expenses such as food and services. Their joint incomes have also contributed to the success of her business. Her next loan in the amount of 2,000,000 COP will be used to stock her store with school supplies. She also plans to sell drinks, such as delicious and healthy juices, and popsicles maD. with milk and fruit and packed in plastic bags. Her customers will soon be able to taste these delightful treats in order to cool down from the high temperatures experienced on the Coast.

Elva María’s goal for her family in the midterm is to acquire a place at a commercial site so that she can use her home for storing the display cases that hold the merchandise displayed before customers. Her short-term goal is to buy a hot dog cart with a canopy; a bread and sausage steamer; inserts with lids for keeping onions, cheese, and potatoes; stainless steel containers for holding sauces; and an interior cupboard for storing bread. These items will be installed at the entrance of her business, which is already known for selling food and hosting the most anticipated costume party for the residents of the neighborhood, the famous “Lunes D. Carnaval” that occurs on the third day of Carnival season. The party starts with the appearance of a large pick-up truck equipped with a sound box, six loudspeakers, two columns, three machines, eight transistors, an equalizer, and a three CD disk changer. The group “El Millo” begins the festivities with traditional Caribbean folk music. In this district of Barranquilla, this annual neighborhood tradition is now known as “the Party with the Cuetos”, named after Elva María’s family. The attendees of this great rumba festival only pay for the food and beverages offered by Elva María, so she is able to enjoy the party and still earn a little money.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase refreshments & restock her store with school supplies

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 37 years old and married with four children, ages 9, 7, 5 and 1. Three of the children are currently attending school. He operates a mixed farm just outside Kitale, Kenya, in the western region of the country where he primarily sells tomatoes and other vegetables. He also earns income from running a small barbershop in his town. Wycliffe currently employs two other men to assist him on his farm and he says that his main challenges now are the unpredictable climate and high prices of drugs for his tomato crops.

Wycliffe has completed two previous loans with Juhudi Kilimo for Kes 25,000 and Kes. 40,000 and has now requested this loan for Kes. 80,000 to purchase a posho mill. A posho mill is a machine that grinds maize for easier consumption and packaging for sale. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him cover all of his children's school fees throughout their education. In the future, Wycliffe wants to become a large-scale dealer in tomatoes, buying produce from other surrounding farms and becoming a main supplier to the local markets.

Wycliffe said that Juhudi Kilimo has been an eye-opener for him and he is now working harder than ever before to secure a better future for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy a posho mill

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus O. has been a farmer since 2006 after he quit selling clothes due to its low profit. He does his business in Buhayo Central and lives with his wife and their nine children in Musoma Busia District. He is 36 years old.

Titus buys his supplies from Nambale center twice a year. He wishes to upgrade his farm with modern equipment that will enable him to increase his production. It is for this reason he wishes to get a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings. This will ensure more produce; hence, more income that will enable him to educate his children for a better future.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment

loans.name: Honey Fe

texts.en:
Honey Fe G. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Honey Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as snack food, canned goods, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Honey Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Honey Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: God Knows Us Group

texts.en: Moses J. is the leader of this group five borrowers called God Knows Us. In the photo, he is the one holding the sign. He is 57 years old, married, and has five children ranging in age from 21 to 37. He could not continue his education through 3rd grade due to financial problems. For five years, Moses has been selling foodstuffs such as rice and oil at Gbengar Town in Paynesville, Liberia. He says that when he sells, he always keeps sweets (candies) for his customers' children which keeps them returning. But he feels that he faces a problem in that, if he gets ill, his business will not go on. Moses started selling with money from his retirement savings. He plans to use his portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase a wheelbarrow in order to transport his rice to far places for sales, and to be able to buy and transport additional rice. Moses’ hopes and dreams are to build a house and improve his family's living conditions. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase a wheelbarrow for the transport of rice

loans.name: Patience Akou

texts.fr: En 2004, cette dame a commencé le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  sacs de riz, des cartons d’huile « NIOTO », des cartons de biscuits et divers produits d’alimentation générale.. Elle a déjà obtenu  de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé
texts.en:
In 2004 this lady began a general food products business. She gets her supplies in Lomé. She is experiencing a decline in her stock of goods and for this reason is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase sacks of rice, cartons of "NIOTO" oil, boxes of biscuits and various other general food products. She has already had one loan from WAGES which she repaid correctly.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Helen's Group

texts.en:
Helen M. is from the town of Sto. Domingo, Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. She is the leader of a ten-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Helen M. group.
Helen is 30 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a fishing business, catching and selling freshwater fish to the market. Helen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Kiev's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of eighteen people. It is located in Preak Anchang Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Kiev L. is 52 years old. She was selected by the members to be the village bank president. Each member of this loan group will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Kiev L. sells fruit. She can earn a small income to support her family. Mrs. Kiev L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more mangoes to sell. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's standard of living. Mrs. Kiev L. is a widow with four children. Two of her children are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Enkhtuya is 43 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a small house on their own land. Her husband operates taxi business. Her daugther, Oyun, is 16 years old and attends a local secondary school. Her son, Munkhjargal, is 2 years old. 

Enkhtuya currently operates a construction material trade business out of a rented stall at the largest market in Ulaanbaatar. Since Enkhtuya started her business, her family's living conditions have improved. With her earnings, she has been providing money for family expenses and paying her daughter's education fees. Recently, in 2010, Enkhtuya and her husband purchased a new car. She is an open and very hard-working person. She is requesting a loan to purchase current assets.

loans.use: to purchase current assets

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married with two children; one attends school and the other one is still young. He is a technician by profession, operating his business of selling and repairing electronics in a shop. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan, he wants to purchase spare parts for mobile-phone repairs. George has been in the business for the last three years, being a tutor for electronics long before he ventured into cereals sales as his other source of income.

Potential customers are his neighboring community members. He faces the challenge of theft, as he does not have enough security. George hopes to open up a big shop in the future and serve many clients in his town. He owns a home with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent and the electricity bill.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for mobile-phone repairs

loans.name: Mario Vinicio

texts.es:
Mario Vinicio L. O. tiene 26 años.  Es casado y vive con su esposa e hija, Evelin (9 meses), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Mario es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Mario trabaja en la agricultura, desde los 14 años, siembra mora, trigo y cebada. Tiene cerdos y gallinos también y un Disco Móvil. Realiza sus compras en Guaranda y vende sus productos cada semana en Guaranda también. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para  cultivar moras. Piensa que el crédito le ayudara a la siembra de  moras. Su sueño es tener una casa propia. Faltan vías de comunicación para ayudarlos a ir a Guaranda hacer ventas y compras.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Mario Vinicio L. O. is a 26-year-old man who lives with his wife and daughter, Evelin (9 months), in the Guaranda canton of the Bolívar province.

Mario is a member of the Patrón San Juan rural microfinance institute, located a half an hour from Guaranda. There is a total of 16 members in the group, the majority of whom cultivate corn and potatoes. This is the group's first loan from the San José cooperative.

Mario has been working in agriculture for the last 14 years. He grows berries, wheat, and barley. He also raises pigs and chickens, and offers disc jockey services. He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells his products there every week.

He is requesting this loan in order to purchase supplies to cultivate berries. He thinks that this loan will help him with berry cultivation. His dream is to own a house. There is a lack of roads to help them go to Guaranda to buy and sell.

He likes to listen to music.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for berry cultivation

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta tiene 41años, por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que ha sido un gran avance para su actividad. La actividad económica es una pulpería, en donde ofrecer una gran variedad de productos como granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, jugos y otros productos para el consumo del hogar. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es muy visitada por sus diferentes clientes, ya que además les ofrece la mejora atención. El destino del financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo necesaria para la materia prima de su establecimiento. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Modesta is 41 years old and has worked with Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time. She operates a grocery store and has made great strides in her business. Modesta offers a wide variety of products such as basic grains, candy, natural sodas, bread, juices, and other items for household consumption. She has been in business for more than 22 years and has several different customers who come by to shop since she offers the best service.

The loan she is requesting will be used as needed operating capital to buy merchandise for her establishment. She dreams of expanding her business and increasing her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Mr. Nam T. (pictured) is 58 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokhoeun Te, is 43. They have been married since 1991 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of them is a construction worker and the other two attend school. Besides his children, he also has his elderly mother living with him. They are living in a small village along National Road Number Four about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

T. has been a mason for four years. His wife stays at home and does housework. He is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to help finance his brother to purchase construction materials to build rooms for renting.

loans.use: To help finance his brother to purchase construction materials to build rooms for renting

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 32 years old. Estrella is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Estrella owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Estrella joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Estrella from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo vive en la zona  Chojñacollo, Provincia  los Andes, del Departamento La Paz, junto a su  esposa y  uno de sus hijos el cual se encuentra en edad escolar, sus otros hijos son mayores de dad y cada uno formó su propio hogar lejos de la comunidad. Guillermo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche). El crédito es para la compra de ganado.  Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Guillermo lives in the neighbourhood of Chojñacollo, Los Andes province, La Paz department, together with his wife and their one child who still goes to school. Their other children are grown up and have their own homes a long way from the community. Guillermo earns his living by raising cows and selling the milk to PIL Andina, an industrial milk plant. The loan will be used to buy more cows. This is his first loan with both Impro and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Najma Liaqat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Najma is a resident of Borewala, a small city in Pakistan that is known for its shrines. She owns and operates an embroidery business from her home. She started making embroidered clothes for her neighbors three years ago and now she receives regular orders from them due to her good work. She is an expert in her art and knows different embroidery techniques, and this helps her to attract more customers. She does this work to supplement her family's income.
Her husband, L. A., is a driver by trade and drives a rickshaw that he rents. He provides transport facilities and charges according to the distance of the journey. At the end of the day, he has to pay half of his earnings to the rickshaw owner. For this reason he is unable to meet the financial expenses of his family. Therefore, Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. With the loan, her husband will buy a rickshaw. This will enable him to improve his earnings. By owning his own rickshaw, L. A. will be able to drive it for long hours without the tension of paying rental costs and having to return it at the end of the day.
Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Najma.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el anexo Santa Rosa, una zona que pertenece al caserío Lagunas y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte). El ofrece su servicio en su caserío y en los caseríos aledaños. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de artículos fabricados en plástico para lo cual también se vale de su vehículo. Con estos ingresos el se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con los gastos familiares.

José desea realizar algunas reparaciones y brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi ya que esta ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas producto del excesivo uso y del mal estado de los caminos del lugar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

José es una persona bastante responsable y tranquila. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para ayudar a su familia a obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 22 years of age, single and lives with his parents in Santa Rosa, a settlement which belongs to the hamlet of Lagunas in the district of Mórrope, an agricultural area which is part of Lambayeque province, one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

José offers a transport service for goods and passengers in a mototaxi, a motorised vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached. He offers this service both in his hamlet and in the surrounding hamlets. Additionally, he works selling goods made from plastic which he also uses his vehicle for. With this income he is able to cover his personal costs and help his family with the costs of living.

José would like to make some repairs on his mototaxi and put it in for maintenance as it already beginning to break down from excessive use and the bad state of the roads in his area. For this reason he has decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

José is a very peaceful and responsible person. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman to help his family and work towards a better quality of life.

loans.use: Mototaxi repair and maintenance

location.town: Anexo Santa Rosa - Lagunas - Mórrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Rosebell

texts.en: Rosebell is a 45-year-old woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a single mother of two children. She lives in a family of seven people in her own house. Her family dream is to have her children well educated so that they can have a better future. She has a retail shop and a restaurant as her business lines of activities. She has been operating them for the last seven years. She says, though, that her dream is to go wholesale in the near future so that she can reap big in term of profits. Rosebell intends to use the loan funds to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Yaquelin

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Yaquelin; tiene 27 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y aceite, el socio atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner is a member of the Reyna de los Angeles community bank. The bank is in the Urubamba district in the Urubamba province, department of Cusco. The partner is 27 year old Yaquelin, who is single and has one child. 

This partner alternates her domestic activities with her small general store, where she sells goods such as rice, sugar, and oil. She is open from 5:00 am to 11:00 pm and wants to expand the business. 

She is requesting the loan to buy stock for her store. She is thankful for the loan and is committed to making payments as scheduled.

loans.use: The partner requests the loan to buy merchandise for her small general store

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda F. is from the village of Carugmanan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 58 years old. Minda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Minda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling clothing, shoe, sandals, lotions, and cosmetics from Natasha and Avon in the local community. Minda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Minda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Minda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Minda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki M. is a 28 year-old married woman. She has operated a food kiosk for the past year at Kijiwetanga in Malindi town.

Riziki was introduced to KADET LIMITED by another client of the company, and this will be her second loan. The loan amounts is KES 15,000, and she is planning to use it to add stock to her kiosk as well as repair the business structure. 

Riziki wishes to use the anticipated profit from the loan to continue expanding the business. She also hopes to buy a plot of land so that she can later own a well-established hotel. Her dream is to ensure that her family is healthy and her children are well-educated.

loans.use: to help sustain and grow a food kiosk

loans.name: Tara

texts.en: This is 22-year-old Tara B.. She is married and has two children, aged 4 and 1. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm. In the future, Tara plans to raise the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. Over 70 percent of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI (microfinance institution), Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates by joining the BPW Kiva lending team.

loans.use: To buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
KANOU est un groupe de l’association SINDJIYA de TENE qui regroupe 10 femmes  toutes mariées ayant en moyenne  41 ans, 7  enfants et vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles dans la préfecture de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali).
Elles  mènent différentes activités  telles la vente de beignet et de gâteau. Elles sont dans le créneau depuis plusieurs années. Les femmes du groupe sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle en nette croissance, le groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Il est  à son premier prêt de groupe. 
Oumou C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de farine, 2 bidons d’huile alimentaires de 20 litres chacun et les accessoires qui sont le sel la levure et le sucre.  Elle s’approvisionne à SAN  et vend à TENE au bord du goudron tous les jours de 07 h du matin à  22 h le soir. 
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité. 
NB/  SOTHE D. est absente de la photo pour des raisons de maternité
texts.en:
Kanou is a group within the Sindjiya de Tene group and it is made up of 10 women members who are all married and have an average age of 41 years. They each have 7 children and they live in large traditional families in the city of San (Region of Segou in the Republic of Mali). 

They all have different businesses, including the sale of donuts and cakes. Their group has been together for many years. The women of the group have businesses that are highly solicited. They all know each other through family and as neighbors. With the goal of satisfying the demands of their growing clientele, they formed a group and approached Soro Yiriwaso for a loan. This is their first group loan. 

Oumou C. will use her loan to purchase 3 sacks of flour, two 20-litre tubs of cooking oil, and other ingredients such as salt, yeast, and sugar. She purchases her ingredients in San and she sells her products in Tene along the Goudron every day from 7 in the morning until 10 at night. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 15000 FCFA. With her income she will be able to repay her loan and to reinvest back into her business.

Note: Sothe D. is absent from this photo because she recently had a baby.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to bake cakes.

loans.name: Jeonel

texts.en:
Jeonel L. is from the village of Quiling. He is 38 years old. Jeonel is married and has two school-aged children.

Jeonel owns and operates a business raising crops, with the main source of income coming primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 23 years and earns approximately 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Jeonel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 24000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Wanka Walashmika ("hombres Valerosos") Group

texts.es:
Mauricia P. C., 25 años de edad, conviviente, 02 hijos en edad escolar.
Mauricia pertenece al grupo comunal "Wanka Walashmika" (Hombres valerosos) que ella preside.
Mauricia desde muy joven aprendiò a cocinar al lado de su madre; quièn le enseñò todos los secretos en el arte culinario que aprendiò de su abuela. 
Mauricia actualmente se dedica a la preparaciòn de platos tìpicos de la regiòn donde vive.
El prèstamo solicitado lo invertirà en la compra de mesas y sillas de su negocio de comidas.
(En la fotografia, Mauricia viste de pantalon color verde y chompra color fuscia o rosado,, y es la segunda empezando la derecha)
texts.en:
Mauricia P. C. is 25 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 school-age children.  She belongs to the "Wanka Walashmika" (Brave Men) community bank and she is the bank's president.

Maruicia learned to cook alongside her mother from a very early age.  Her mother taught her all the secrets of the culinary art that she learned from her grandmother.  Mauricia currently prepares dishes that are typical of her region.  She will invest her loan in buying tables and chairs for her meal business.  (In the photograph, Mauricia is wearing green pants and a fuchsia-colored cardigan.  She is the second person from the right).

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Ella pudo estudiar la secundaria pero no la concluyó. 
Hace cuatro años viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su  préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio, lo cual consiste en la venta de ropas de vestir como, chompas y pantalones en polar todo para niños. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 600.00 nuevo soles,  comprará tres docenas de pantalones de polar y una docena de chompa.
 Su sueño es mejorar en su negocio  y tener una casa en Ilave.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es lo que gana su ahorro.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito-Juli province, in Puno department.  She is 30 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She studied at high school but didn't finish her studies.

Justina has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she used that money to increase her business stock.  Her business is selling clothes such as children's sweaters and fleece pants.  Her husband works as a farmer.

Justina will use this loan for 600 Peruvian soles to buy three dozen pairs of fleece pants and a dozen sweaters.  Her dreams are to improve her home and to own a house in Ilave.  What she most likes about her community bank is the money she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy three dozen pairs of fleece pants and a dozen sweaters

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia, de 48 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus dos hijos mayores que trabajan y se mantienen; juntos luchan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 14 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica al alquiler de dos puestos en un mercado de su zona. Dice que se los compró con un dinero que recibió por la venta de un terreno  y desde entonces ha aprovechado muy bien la zona comercial. Pero es consciente con los jóvenes inquilinos y por esta razón no les cobra mucho, pues como ella, así empezó como comerciante y sabe como es el tipo de negocio. Paralelamente también se dedica a la venta de productos energizantes (Herbalife) y le pagan no solo por el volumen de sus ventas sino también por captar a nuevas vendedoras. Ella tiene planeado instalar una tienda amplia de venta de productos energizantes, donde pueda realizar sus reuniones de vendedoras. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Patricia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la refacción de uno de sus puestos, pues esta algo deteriorado  y también quiere comprar algunos productos energizantes para tenerlos en stock, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Patricia, 48, lives in her own house with her two adult children who work and support themselves; together they struggle to get ahead.

For the last 14 years this enterprising woman has leased out two stands in a local market.  She says she bought them with money she got from the sale of a piece of property and since then she’s taken good advantage of the commercial zone.  But she’s conscious of her young tenants and for this reason doesn’t charge them too much because, like her, this is how she started as a merchant and she knows what this type of business is like.

At the same time, she sells energizing products (Herbalife).  She is paid not only for the volume of sales she makes but also for the number of new saleswomen she can recruit.  She plans to set up a roomier store to sell her energizing products where she can hold her meetings with her sales team.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to repay on time because she doesn’t want to disappoint the people who made the loan possible that will allow her to say in business in search of progress.

Patricia plans to use the requested loan to refurbish one of her stands because it’s a bit deteriorated and she also wants to buy some of the energizing products to have in stock to get ahead this way.

loans.use: To refurbish her stands and to buy energizing products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her business

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en:
Liliane is 36 years old and is married with five children aged between one and a half and 12 years old.  She takes care of two relatives who are 3 and 6 years old.  Liliane owns and operates a small business selling various styles of children`s and women`s clothes. Her business is well organized. and she has been running her business for one year. 

She has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing an additional various clothes to sell such as: more children`s clothes and women`s clothes. This loan will allow her to attract more customers, which will help her to earn more profit and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more children's and women`s clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a cow to be slaughtered for his business as a butcher

loans.name: Mkwalila Group

texts.en:
Maulid K. is in his late fifties and is married with children.  He has been running a general store since 2001.  He works from 7.00am to 8.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Maulid's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans increase the shop stock and bought a motorcycle.  He has paid back his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy another motorcycle for transport business. His dream is to one day own a hardware shop.

Maulid will share this loan with his loan group "Mkwalila" which has a total of 20 members.  The members of the group will hold each accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture Maulid is the middle, back row, wearing a brown T-shirt. (In the photo, there is a lady facing back, on the right side, who is not part of the Mkwalila group).

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flour to make bread

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Renee; el tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también trabaja en construcción civil, y el negocio de tienda de abarrotes lo realiza su esposa y él hace trabajos de construcción como casas y edificios, el socio quiere ampliar la tienda de abarrotes y mejorar en su trabajo de construcción. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche y golosinas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Renee belongs to the Munay Tika Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Renee, age 30, has a life partner and five children.  He alternates his daily activities with his grocery store business.  He also works in the building industry.  His wife runs the grocery store, and he does his construction work such as working on houses and buildings.

He wants to expand the grocery store and improve his construction work.  He is requesting the loan to buy products like rice, sugar, milk, and sweets for his grocery store.

He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, milk, and sweets for his grocery store.

loans.name: Chanly

texts.en:
Chanly, age 29, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She weaves traditional silk, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of $6 per day. 

Chanly is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for family use. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Hermitania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; el Banco Comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hermitania; la socia tiene 46 años de edad y es casada, la socia tiene 5 hijos de los cuales el mayor es independiente y los otros 4 hijos son de 22, 20, 18, 12 años de edad aun están bajo su cuidado y estudiando la superior y en el colegio;  la socia tiene una pequeña picantería en el barrio tradicional de Urubamba llamado "Pintacha", la socia en su picantería ofrece diferentes platos típicos como trucha al horno con ensalada y papa doradas, rocoto relleno y otros, la socia también vende la famosa bebida de los incas la chicha a base de maíz amarillo, la socia requiere en esta ocasión invertir el préstamo en la compra de maíz amarillo para la elaboración de la chicha y comprar algunos utensilios de cocina que ya requiere el cambio así como ollas, platos y otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz amarillo y de algunos utensilios de cocina.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgara y se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas de manera disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Hermitania is a member of the Communal Bank “Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca”.  This Communal Bank is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 46 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is grown and independent, and the other four are aged 22, 20, 18, and 12 and are still under her care and studying at school.  Ermitania has a small restaurant in the traditional neighborhood of Pintacha in Urubamba.  She offers traditional dishes such as baked trout with salad and golden potatoes, stuffed bell peppers, and other specialties.  Ermitania also sells the famous drink of the Incas known as “chicha”, which is made from yellow corn.  On this occasion, she is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of yellow corn for making “chicha” as well as some cooking utensils.  She has pots, dishes, and other items that need to be replaced.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of yellow corn and cooking utensils.    

Ermitania is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase yellow corn and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Alba Roxana

texts.es: Alba Roxana de treinta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería y pupuseria la cual es muy famosa en el lugar, pues prepara las pupusas más ricas de la localidad y sus tortillas las vende calientitas al gusto del cliente además que tiene los precios más accesibles. Alba Roxana es una mujer emprendedora y muy positiva para ella el punto de partida para una vida mejor es el trabajo constante, es por eso que le solicita INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material como queso, chicharrón, frijoles, maíz. Así podrá mantener  a flote su negocio. Alba Roxana tiene la confianza que con su trabajo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida con el apoyo que este crédito le dará
texts.en:
Alba Roxana, 39, lives with her common-law husband and two children in their own house.  She has a stand where she makes tortillas and pupusas (stuffed tortillas), and she is famous in her town for making the tastiest pupusas around.  Her tortillas are served warm, made to order for the customers, and her prices are reasonable.

Alba Roxana is an enterprising, positive woman.  In her mind the starting point toward a better life is constant work.  Therefore she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL to buy ingredients such as cheese, pork rind, beans and corn.  This will help keep her business running.  Alba Roxana is confident that through her work she will be able to give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy cheese, pork rinds, beans and corn.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. 

Hayat has been a tailor since 2000; she makes and repairs women's clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumers, a lot of experience, and is well known in her area. 

She is requesting a $2000 loan to buy three tailoring machines. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family's quality life.

loans.use: To buy three tailoring machines.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Chhoeun (in the photo) is 40 years old and her husband Hean is 50 years old. They live in a village along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children - two sons and three daughters. Two work for a restaurant, one is a construction worker and the other two are in school.  

Chhoeun stays at home and does house work. The main source of income is from her children and husband’s salary. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Noe

texts.en:
A single mother of four children, all of whom are in school, Noe lives in Uganda in a rented home that has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

For the past 10 years, Noe has had an enterprise selling charcoal from home. She has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Noe's main business challenges are transportation and seasonality, and her goals are to become a wholesaler and to own a delivery van.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Yolanda Pastora

texts.es:
Yolanda, tiene cincuenta y dos años de edad, es casada y con dos  hijos pero solo uno depende actualmente de ella y este se encuentra en edad escolar.
Yolanda acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para el mejoramiento de  su vivienda, por lo  que este préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción como es: zinc, cuartones de madera y clavos para reparar el techo de su casa de habitación. 
Todo esto es para que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de una vivienda.
texts.en: Yolanda is 52 years old, married and has two children but just one of them still depends on her and is school age.  Yolanda calls upon Ceprodel’s office to request a home improvement loan.  The loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies like: zinc metal sheets, wood beams and nails to repair her roof.  All of this is so that her family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Yosephat

texts.en:
Yosephat wants a loan to buy alcohol for resale. He is a Ugandan male aged 38 living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a banana grower and also distills alcohol for a living.

He got his initial capital from the money he saved as a hawker. His dream is to have an educated family and to sell alcohol in the different districts of the country.

loans.use: to distill alcohol for resale

loans.name: Bahriddin

texts.ru: Бахриддин житель района Пяндж. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него 8 детей. Он более года предоставляет услугу, такси. Бахриддин развозит людей по району. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины. Он хочет обновить салон своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Bahriddin lives in the Pyandj district.  He is 27 years old, married and has 8 children.  He has been providing a taxi service for over one year.  Bahriddin transports people across the district.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car.  Bahriddin wants to update his car interior.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima, a 41-year-old mother of two sons and two daughters, all of whom attend school, is married to a driver who provides transport services to his customers.

A seamstress by profession, Halima learned the art of sewing from her mother before marriage and now earns regular income from her five-year-old business through orders from her neighboring clients. A caring housewife and mother, Halima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine to replace her old one. The new machine will enable her to complete orders on time and increase her profits.

Known amongst her clients for the good quality of her work, Halima is confident that the loan will result in more profits and help her family to live better lives.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Halima.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata est âgée  de 66 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal  et s’active dans le commerce depuis plusieurs années. Elle est mariée  et mère de 6 enfants majeurs. Elle pratique la vente de vaisselles et de produits divers régulièrement utilisés par les femmes dans les ménages. Elle et sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2001. Elle sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de vaisselles a revendre. Son souhait est de développer son activité et accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Aminata is 66 years old.  She lives in Senegal and has been working in commerce for several years.  She is married and has six grown-up children.  She sells dishes and other products which are regularly used by women doing their housework.  Aminata has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's offices since August 2001.  She is requesting this loan for 350,000 francs to buy dishes to re-sell.  She would like to develop her business activity and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy dishes to re-sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 62 years old, a married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Mariam is requesting a loan of 400 JD to do maintenance for her home, specially the kitchen. Mariam is hoping to start a home-based project to increase her family income.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home, especially the kitchen.

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr:
Messan est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié å une  coiffeuse et ensemble ils ont 02 enfants. Un va à l’école. Le premier a 06ans et le dernier 02ans.
Messan travaille comme éleveur de poules depuis 2010. Il sert ses clients à la maison et n’ a aucune difficulté dans l’exercice de son activité.
Messan a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des nourriture pour pondeuse. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Messan voudrait élargir son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit de prendre soin de la famille.
texts.en:
Messan is a 32-year-old man. He is married to a hairdresser and together they have two children. One goes to school. The children are six and two years old.

Messan has been working as a poultry farmer since 2010. He serves his customers from his home and has no problems managing his business.

Messan is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy chicken feed for laying hens. He wants to reinvest in the business.

In coming years, Messan would like to expand his business. He states that with the profits he intends to take care of his family.

loans.use: Buy chicken feed for laying hens

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.en: Prudencio  is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.  Prudencio has a shop that sells electronic loads from several networks. He is also engaging in a networking business called UNIGOSYO.  He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stock of electronic loads.  Prudencio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Prudencio  hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads

loans.name: Gladis Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Gladis tiene 41 años y vive en el Barrio Lempira en el municipio de Tela. Vive en unión libre con su pareja Sergio, lo cual es albañil. Gladis tiene 4 hijos, una muchacha de 23 y 3 varones de 17, 15, y 9 años de edad. Dos de ellos están estudiando. 

Hace 3 años, había un grupo de mujeres buscando integrantes con el fin de solicitar un préstamo grupal. Los hijos de Gladis le dieron la idea de poner una chiclera y ella se unió al grupo. La chiclera dio resultado por lo que siguió ampliando hasta tener una pulpería. Los créditos que ha sacado (6 en total) se ha permitido dejar su negocio ambulante y poner una pulpería fija dentro de sus casa. Vende granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar y harina, embutidos, lácteos, refrescos, confitería, jugos, jabón y pan. Hoy en día trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana atendiendo a su clientela. 

Solicitó este crédito de L8450 para surtir la pulpería con la compra de insumos, granos básicos, lácteos y embutidos. Su meta es seguir trabajando y que el negocio siga creciendo y así terminar de darle el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Gladis is 41 years old and lives in the Lempira neighborhood of the Tela municipality.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner Sergio, who works in construction.  Gladis has four children; a daughter aged 23, and 3 sons aged 17, 15 and 9 years old.  Two of them are still in school.

Three years ago, a group of women was seeking members with the goal of requesting a group loan.  Gladis' children gave her the idea of opening a business selling candy, and she joined the group.  She has continued growing her candy business, so that it is now a convenience store.  The loans that she has taken (six in total) have allowed her to leave off doing business as a street vendor, and to open a permanent convenience store inside her home.  She sells basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar and flour, sausages, dairy products, sodas, candy, juice, soap and bread.  She currently works everyday from 6 in the morning serving her customers.

She requested this loan of L8,450 to stock up her convenience store by purchasing supplies, basic grains, dairy products, and sausages.  Her goal is to continue working and for her business to continue growing, so that she can finish paying for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, basic grains, dairy products and sausages.

loans.name: La Fe 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Renold is the coordinator of his group La Fe ("Faith") 1, 3 and 4. This group is located in a batey (a sugarcane company town) in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy and most of the people are Haitian immigrants. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable). 

He is excited to be taking out his third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. Renold plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying rice, beans, sugar, canned food, vegetables, etc., He is running a colmado, a small grocery store. 

Renold makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and three children. He has had his business for almost three years, starting with a small amount of savings. 

He says that his most difficult challenge is to buy a pick up to transport his merchandise. In the meantime he plans to continue to enjoy doing business. He will use his profits to invest in his business. His future plan is to have a house for his children.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, canned food, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josephine is 41 years old and she sells chips to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business in her region. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to see her business grow into a restaurant in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy potatoes.

loans.use: To buy potatoes.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en: Alfonsa, 77 years old, is a widow with six children. She resides in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. Alfonsa used her last loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She's now taking out a new loan which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alfonsa hopes to reap more during the harvest to sustain the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Faustino Aparicio

texts.es:
Faustino es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Faustino no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de educación, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones su esposa cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Faustino trabaja en su mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
Faustino se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poder hacer la construcción de los servicios higiénicos de su hogar; de esta manera Faustino contará con su vivienda en mejores condiciones, más adecuadas y seguras para su él y su familia, así pues Faustino  desea seguir esforzándose para logara sus metas y su sueño de tener su propia empresa de servis.
texts.en:
Faustino is a 48-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica with his wife and three children whom he loves and who are his main focus in life.  Faustino is a very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, puts all his efforts into getting his family ahead in life.  Unfortunately, Faustino was not able to study for a teaching degree but he would very much have liked to have done so.  In his free time, he enjoys continuing to work and sometimes his wife cooks delicious 'tallarines rojos' (red spaghetti) to share with their family. 

Faustino works with a lot of effort and dedication every day in his motorcycle taxi, providing transport services.  Every day, from early in the morning, he drives round the streets of the city looking for passengers.  He can work approximately 10 hours a day and he believes that he is doing well because he treats his customers in a friendly and respectful way.

Faustino is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to improve his home.  He would like to be able to build a bathroom for his household.  This will improve the conditions in Faustino's home and it will become safer for both him and his family.  Faustino would like to continue working hard to achieve his goals.  His dream is to have his own company.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in his home

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 37 years old and married to the Head Teacher of a certain primary school. She has eight children and one orphan who go school. She owns a grocery store selling assorted items such as sugar, soap, cooking oil and she wants this loan to buy assorted groceries to attract more customers in her compound. Flora started this business to be able to pay school fees for her children and invest more in her farming.

With all profits generated she wants to satisfy her family's basic needs and to start building a good iron-roofed house for her family. She also plans to employ someone to assist her in every day farming operations. Before she started her business she was unable to support her family and now she has managed to pay school fees for her children. Flora believes that the training she received on business management will help her to achieve what she wants in her life.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries.

loans.name: Misericorde Divine Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISÉRICORDE DIVINE est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Medesse Aimée est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Medesse Aimée est mariée à un électricien du nom de Gaétan . Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Medesse Aimée vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Medesse Aimée vend depuis huit ans du maïs, du charbon de bois et du gari (farine de manioc). Medesse Aimée s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Medesse Aimée ensemble avec les membres du groupe MISÉRICORDE DIVINE sollicite un premier crédit.

loans.use: Acheter du gari, du charbon de bois et du maïs.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Loreta dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
kwero Evalyn has been an active member of Life in Africa since 2005. She is employed as a bracelet maker in the Invisible Children Bracelet project. She has three children and she lives in the Acholi quarter which is a camp for displaced persons from the north.

She and her family were forced to flee their home in the north because of the war. They settled in the camp as did most Acholis who fled to Kampala and she earned what little money she could by selling bananas. She would tie her baby on her back, carry a basket of bananas on her head, and she would walk all day trying to sell enough to make ends meet. She barely earned enough to pay the rent and feed them so school was just not possible. Since coming to LiA, their lives have greatly improved. Now she has no problem paying the rent, her children are not hungry and they even go to school.

The King of Buganda has great sympathy for the Acholi and has donated land to them. She has acquired a plot of this land and she now wishes to build a two roomed house for her family that will be permanent and safe. For this she is seeking a loan in the amount of 600,000. She will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

below is her break down:

3000 bricks @ 45shs = 135000/=

10 bags of cement @ 18000shs = 180000/=

15 pieces of iron sheets @ 10000shs 150000/=

16 pieces of poles @ 1000shs = 16000/=

Labour =100000/=

Nails 5 kgs @ 150 = 7500/=

Total = 588500/=

Evalyn's loan has been reviewed and guaranteed by her peers at the Life in Africa WE Center community in Kampala. She has designated the 25% community impact portion of the interest on her loan to support Life in Africa's Talent Discovery team. For more about Evalyn, her life and her worldview, visit http://lifeinafrica.com/4/akweroevalyn

loans.use: Building Family House

loans.name: Vodu

texts.en: An ardent livestock keeper, Vodu K. raises ducks and chickens for sale. She sells them for a livelihood as well as using some for domestic consumption. This has improved the nutritional status of her family especially the granchildren who live with her. She has also been trained in the skills lending method called TEACH. The strategy being used by Kraban Support Foundation to reduce poverty in the communities we operate in Ghana.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum V. is 35 and works in a garment factory on the outskirts of Phnom Penh earning $2-3/day. Her husband is a mototaxi and earns close to $5/day. Chum V. has 4 children who all work--1 in a printing shop, and 3 that pack incense to be used at Buddhist ceremonies.

With this loan Chum V. and her husband will buy a motorbike for their daughters to get to and from work. It will save them money on transportation, and they would like to help their children since they all contribute to the household income. In the future, Chum and her husband need to build up the land around the home in order to escape from flooding during the rainy season. She also hopes to start her own tailoring business so she can provide jobs for her daughters once they are finished with school.

loans.use: To purchase one motorbike for her daughters to go to and from work.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela lives in her own home on Jaimes Freyre Avenue, in the zone Tembladerani in the city La Paz. She is 74 years old and ever since she was very young, she has sold vehicle lubricants, such as oils and other fluids. When her husband passed away, she needed to continue the business in order to support her children and she still continues to work in order to support herself. The loan will be used to purchase oils and other fluids that she stocks. Her previous business history with Impro demonstrates she is a good customer and can responsably take on another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Graciela vive en casa propia en la Av. Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 74 años de edad y desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de lubricantes (Aceites y fluidos para vehículos motorizados). A la muerte del esposo ella tuvo que seguir con el negocio para mantener a sus hijos y actualmente ella continua con la actividad para mantener su subsistencia. El crédito que ella solicita es para compra de aceite y otros fluidos que son sus productos. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como buen cliente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase oils and other fluids.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria and her husband have had a small store in their home for 13 years. With effort, they succeeded in saving a little capital in order to sell food products from the coast and the mountains, such as rice, sugar, meats, oil, tuna, various legumes, and others. With a previous loan from Kiva, Maria was also able to begin selling cosmetics and other general store items (such as stationery and toys). They work in the store every day of the week, serving customers from 6 AM to 10 PM.

Maria is requesting her new loan so she may continue to improve her secondary business. She wants to invest in perfumes, clothing accessories like bracelets and earrings, and other types of gifts. She hopes that she will also be able to slowly start improving the appearance of her business.

Maria is married. She is 36 years old. She does not have children, but three years ago the son she had adopted when he was 1 day old died at the age of 10. Her husband supports her in everything; they are responsible people. Her desire with the loan is to generate higher earnings which will allow her to continue making improvements to her home and give her more security since it is located in a dangerous area.

loans.use: Continue investing in her new line of products

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Business Description

Mrs. Janeth is dedicated to the sale of items for the home by credit and for cash, she began this business when she arrived in the city five years ago. Her husband and children actually help her with her business.

Loan Use

She needs credit to buy more wholesale merchandise and, in this way, increase her profits.

Personal Information

She is 39 years old and has four children, all of whom study to have a cement house and her goal is to succeed in her business in order to help her husband in educating their children.
