So L. is asking for a loan to buy two cows to be used in her farming business.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Solidario Las Trabajadoras De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
Las Trabajadoras D. Sumpango

María Luisa, Nancy,Y Elsa integran el grupo D. las trabajadoras Sumpangueras,ellas reciden en  Un pueblo que se encuentra muy cerca D. la ciudad Capital. Doña Luisa se dedica a la venta D. comida en una fabrica textilera que se encuentra aproximadamente a 10 km del pueblo, al igual que Nancy Y Elsa (hija y nuera) pues ellas tienen el mismo oficio, ellas preparan alrededor D. 200 almuerzos diarios algo que no es suficiente ya que tienen mas demanda D. almuerzos pero el capital no les alcanza es por eso que solicitan un crédito a Fape para tener mas capital  Para comprar productos comestibles para elavorar comida y así preparar mas almuerzos ellas han trabajado por mucho tiempo con Fape y han sido muy puntuales en cuanto a los pagos, es por eso que ellas estarían muy agradecidas si les otorgara un crédito ya que así podrían ampliar sus negocios y tener una mejor calidad D. vida
texts.en:
The Working Women of Sumpango

María Luisa, Nancy, and Elsa form the group called, The Working Women of Sumpango.  They live in a village very near the capital city.  Luisa sells food in a textile factory located about 10 km from the village.  Nancy and Elsa (daughter and daughter in law) work in the same business.  They prepare about 200 lunches daily, but this does not meet the demand.  They don’t have the necessary working capital to expand, so they are requesting this loan through Fape to be able to buy ingredients to increase production.  They have been working with Fape for a long time and have always been on time with their payments.  They would be very grateful for this loan and it would help them improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 28 years old and is single. Jean Baptiste has been operating his pub for the past year. This business is well organized and clear. He employs 3 people to help him. Jean Baptiste works from 6am until 10pm every day. He realizes that he lacks equipment to use in his pub that would improve his service.

Jean Baptiste has requested his first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a to expand his business by buying more stock such as beer like primus, amuster and so on. With that expansion, Jean Baptiste hopes to make more profit so that he will be able to buy his own house and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more beer for his pub.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan S., 43, is a married woman and the mother of six children, three of whom are married and living independently while the other three are enrolled in school. Her husband is S. Sim, 48, a local rice farmer and he also feeds a lot of fish in a pond behind his house for extra income. 

Phan S. makes a living by growing various crops and bean crops. She is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to feed all her children since they were very young. Phan S. wants to sow a new bean crop, but lacks funds. Phan S. is applying for this loan as an advance to buy bean seed so that she can start to plant, and also to buy fish-feed for their fish growing.

loans.use: to buy bean seed for planting and to buy fish-feed for her fish growing.

loans.name: Kuña Arandu Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres integrantes de este comité lo formaron con el objeto de realizar diversas actividades que las ayude a obtener ingresos, comprometiéndose en la cooperación dentro del grupo, trabajando mutuamente para que las tareas se vuelvan más fáciles de realizar.
La Sra. Rosa es una mujer humilde que solicita el crédito para poder adquirir ropas en general para su posterior venta, obteniendo así dinero que la ayuden a solventar sus gastos diarios y colaborando con la familia en la manutención del hogar.
Ellas son mujeres muy capaces y trabajadoras, han contado anteriormente con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva y se han destacado por su excelente cumplimiento, por ello desean poder contar nuevamente con esta ayuda crediticia.
texts.en: The women who make up this committee formed it with the intent of performing diverse activities that can help them obtain an income.  Comitted to cooperation within the group and working hand-in-hand so that tasks become easier to accomplish.  Rosa is a humble person who solicits the loan to purchase general clothing to later resell and this way help her supplement her daily expenses and help the family with the upkepp of the home.  They are all very capable and hard working women.  They have previously counted on Kiva investors and have distinguished themselves for excellent fulfillment; this is why they wish to count on the credit assistance again.

loans.use: to purchase T-shirts, pants, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago, es un agricultor, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos, él cultiva maíz y frijol, tiene 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, aprendió de su padre el proceso agrícola, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
El está iniciando el proceso de la siembra de maíz, por lo que solicita un préstamo para adquirir abono, fertilizantes y tratamientos para plagas, esta compra le ayudara a tener desde el inicio todo lo necesario para el proceso de la siembra.
Santiago, trabaja fuertemente por su familia, ya que esta es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Santiago is a farmer living with his wife; they do not have children.  He grows corn and beans.  He’s been in this occupation for 25 years.  He learned farming from his father.  He works every day from 6am until 3pm.

He is starting the corn planting season so is asking for a loan to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.  This purchase will help him have everything he needs for the planting from the very beginning.

Santiago works hard for his family since this is the source of income he relies on to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is married with one child. Marife is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Marife is a farmer and raises crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for her crops.

Marife has been a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Higidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Higidia; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taller de confecciones, ella confeccionan pantalones, blusas y ternos a pedido del público en general, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de taller de confecciones. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para confeccionar como tela, hilos y cierres.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Higidia, 40, is a member of the “Cristo Asención de Rumichaca” communal bank which is located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She is married and has three children. She alternates her daily chores with a dressmaking shop.   She makes pants, blouses and three-piece suits to order for the general public.  She works from 8am until 6pm and earnings from the business allow her to support her children.  She wants to expand the workshop and is asking for a loan to buy supplies like fabric, thread and closures.

She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús de 42 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su compañero de vida, dos hijos y una hija.  Denys, Lourdes y Fátima de 19,15 y 14 años de edad respectivamente, los cuales se encuentran estudiando y uno de ellos ya logró empezar la Universidad. Su sueño es verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales y con mejores condiciones a las que ella ha tenido. Para Teresa sus hijos lo son todo y trabaja duramente para sacarlos adelantes. Ella  se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña tiendita que ha logrado establecer en su hogar de residencia. Es una mujer confiable y con mucha amabilidad que ha logrado ganarse la confianza de todo su vecindario, los cuales la prefieren,  ya que  siempre cuenta con lo que ellos necesitan y sobre todo reciben un buen trato. Últimamente ha pensado mucho en cómo hacer crecer su negocio y ha decidido abastecer su tienda con variedad de productos que sean atractivos para los clientes. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar los  principales insumos como: bebidas, arroz, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, papel, pan dulce, café,  etc. Que le permitan atraer a más clientes y lograr cumplir su sueño de dar a sus hijos mejores oportunidades.
texts.en: Teresa de Jesus is 42 years old and she lives in her own home together with her life partner, and their two sons and a daughter. They are Denys, Lourdes, and Fatima, aged 19, 15, and 14 years old respectively. They are in school and one of them has started going to university. Her dream is to see them become successful professionals and to enjoy better living conditions to what she has had. For Teresa her children are everything and she works very hard to support them. She sells every day consumer goods from a small store that she has managed to establish in her own home. She is a trustworthy woman and she is very kind. This has helped her to earn the trust of her entire neighborhood. They prefer to buy from her because she always has whatever they need and above all they receive good customer service. Lately she has been going a lot of thinking on how to make her business grow. She has decided to stock her store with a variety of products that would be attractive to clients. Fro this reason she requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). She will purchase the goods which are in highest demand: drinks, rice, beans, cooking oil, snacks, bathroom tissue, pastries, coffee, etc. This will help her to attract more clients and it will help her achieve her dream of providing her children with better opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase basic consumer goods, such as drinks, rice, beans, cooking oil, snacks, paper products, pastries, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is married. She is 45 years old and lives in Manukan. She sells different kinds of products to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work.

Beverly has requested a loan of 14,900 Php to purchase additional stock for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a 32 years old, married and has earned a living for the last four years by selling fruits and vegetables at a rural market called Uthiru. He is applying for a loan for KES. 50,000 which he plans to use to buy more items to sell to his customers. With the additional profits made possible by this loan, he hopes to expand his business to new locations.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and lives in Musunda in Kakamega town. She is married to Richard and they have two children.

ELizabeth has a retail shop that she has been running for the past six years, and she has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to buy more stock.

She hopes to see her business expand and be a supermarket.

loans.use: To add stock to her business.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua el señor Carlos Arturo se dedica arduamente a laborar como electricista en  una empresa de esta cuidad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 13  años .con un núcleo familiar de  5 personas a los cuales tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que ha tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora de su vivienda . es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, , perlines .para iniciar la  mejora de la vivienda realizando el cambio de techo y agradece a ceprodel la oportunidad  
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Carlos Arturo works hard as an electrician in a company in this city. He has worked as an electrician for 13 years. He has a nuclear family of 5 and provides them with the necessary conditions for their development.

One of the needs he has nowadays is to improve the condition of his home because it has been in bad shape. Because of this, he made the wise decision to start work to improve his home. This is why he comes to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of building materials like zinc and purlines. This will allow him to start improving his home by replacing the roof.

He is grateful to Ceprodel for this opportunity. It is important to emphasize that by completing this work, he will provide his family with a decent roof to live under and with the necessary conditions.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye  habite au Sénégal.  Elle habite au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis des années.  Elle pratique la vente de tissus et d’accessoires de femmes.  Elle a choisi son activité  par amour.  Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs dans le but de payer  la commande de marchandises qu’elle avait passé  en vue d’augmenter son stock et développer son activité de commerce. Elle envisage accroitre ses revenus et bénéfices pour mieux soutenir sa famille et prendre en charge leurs besoins sociaux.
texts.en: Ndeye lives in Senegal. She has been a retailer for several years and sells fabrics and accessories for women, a job she loves. She is a member of a branch of the UIMCEC and is requesting a loan of 150 000 francs, so that she has the money to cover an order she has placed which will enable her to restock and develop her business activities. She expects to raise her revenues and profits and will use the extra income to contribute more to her family's social needs and expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and accessories for her female clientele.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en: Mr.Sergelen is a 45-year-old father of three children. He lives in a Mongolian ger (a nomadic tent) which is cold during the winter. He has been driving a company car for six years and is one of the best drivers at the company. His wife works at home as a tailor taking orders from customers. She has been doing this business for many years. This is Mr. Sergelen's third loan request and he has repaid all previous loans successfully. As he said the Mongolian ger is very cold during the winter and he is worried about his family's health and comfort. The loan he requested will be used to buy a warm roof for the ger and repair his vehicle for better service.

loans.use: To buy a warm roof for the ger and repair his vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Marifi

texts.en:
To be successful in life is a main goal of every individual.  Marifi is a responsible housewife who helps her husband to manage their rice farming business.  She is blessed with six children and they live happily in a village.  Due to high cost of school fees and commodities, she and her husband need to earn more income to satisfy their basic needs and finance the education of their children. 

Marifi and her husband aimed to increase their yields so that they could earn a higher income.  However, due to financial difficulty, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay the labor costs required for planting rice.  Marifi and her husband believe that through patience and hard work, they will have a plentiful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pay the labor costs required for planting rice

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 56 años, es una mujer humilde y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 06 queridos hijos  y lo que más desea es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, para lo cual esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar Julia, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida que lleva 40 años realizando en el cultivo de sus productos. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao y palillo dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. En tiempo de cosecha necesita el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes le ayudan en las extracciones de los productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve crecidos y considera que lo más difícil, es llevar lo cosechado desde su chacra hasta el centro poblado de Rosario donde habita para poder vender a los centros de acopio que vienen al mismo pueblo a recoger la cosecha que produce. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo a futuro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono natural y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cosecha de cacao y palillo.
texts.en:
Julia, age 56, is a humble and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her six beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. For this reason, she is willing to work very hard. Through effort and dedication, Julia has been able to cultivate the crops that have helped her progress through life for the past 40 years. Every morning she begins her work in the fields since she knows that the quality of her cacao and turmeric crops depends on how much care she provides. At harvest time, she needs the help of workers to gather her crops. What she enjoys most about her job is caring for her crops because she feels happy when she sees them grow. She considers the most difficult part to be carrying her harvested crops from the fields to the central village of Rosario where they are sold at the collection centers. The people from her same town come to buy what she produces.

This will be her first loan with MFP. Julia knows that she must pay on time in order to access another loan in the future more easily and not create complications for her Communal Bank. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sacks of natural compost and fertilizers so that she can improve her cacao and turmeric crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Byambaa, 54, is responsible for a public toilet  in a bazaar called “Da-Khuree”. She has been running her business since 2007 and owns 3 toilets in other places within the bazaar. She lives with her son and husband in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Her home furniture has been used for many years and she still has not been able to replace it with new furniture. All of it has became old and damaged. Therefore she decided to buy new Korea and Western furniture for her home. She needed over MNT 2,200,000 to purchase it. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase the new furniture for her home.

loans.use: To purchase some new furniture for her home.

loans.name: Leonza Marina

texts.es: Leonza Marina tiene 59 años, ella tiene un negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general pues su negocio es de manera ambulante de esta forma obtiene nuevos clientes para su negocio. Hace más de 14 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, sin embargo ha sido poco a poco que ha comprado una variedad de productos para ofrecer la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan variedad con sus productos, buscando de esta manera como incrementar sus ingresos. Es por eso que este crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, polvos, lápiz labial, cremas, tratamientos entre otros. Su sueño siempre ha sido agrandar más su negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Leonza Marina is 59 years old and has a business selling general merchandise. She works as a traveling merchant so that she can obtain new customers for her business. Leonza has worked in her own business for more than 14 years. Gradually over time, she has been able to buy a variety of products to offer to most of her customers since they are requesting different items. Working in this manner helps her to increase her earnings.

For this reason, Leonza is requesting a loan to buy trousers, shirts, powders, lip pencils, crèmes, treatments, and other products. Her dream has always been to expand her business even more so that she provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, powders, lip pencils, crèmes, treatments, and other products.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children.

Ramil has a shop that makes and sells bamboo sun breakers, which are for creating a shield to avoid direct sunlight. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy materials needed for making bamboo sun breakers.

Ramil has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ramil hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making bamboo sun breakers

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has six school-aged children. Leonila's husband is a fisherman.

Leonila has had a sari-sari (convenience) store for six years. She sells various items like noodles, canned goods and soap. Leonila earns 6,000 PHP a month from her business. 

She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and rice. Leonila hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and rice.

loans.name: Abdukholik

texts.ru: Абдухолик житель района Джиликул. Возраст, 31 год. Женат. Имеет шестерых детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Сам Абдухолик имеет среднее образование. Он занимается скотоводством и растениеводством. Кредит берет для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Abdulkholik is a resident of the Djilikul district. He is 31 years old, married and has six children. His children are going to school. He has a high school education. He is engaged in raising livestock and growing crops. Abdulkholik is taking a loan for planting winter wheat.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: La Fe 2, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group La Fe 2,5 & 6 (The Faith). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most important challenges are to educate her children and to support all of their needs. She is selling miscellaneous products;  she sells most of the basic products like clothing, shoes, cosmetics and others. 

Marie is excited to be taking out her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for three years. She plans to use this loan to purchase some clothing like blue jeans, shirts, some women's shoes, and cosmetics products. She will use the profits to reinvest in the business, because she wants to increase her sales, and she will have the opportunity to have good sales for all the Christmas season and to sells toys in January (In Dominican Republic, the kids receive toys in January).

This group is compounded by Haitian citizen who have been living in the Dominican Republic for years and working in the sugarcane fields from La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Philp

texts.en:
Philip is 46 years old.  He is married to Nyawira and together they have two children.  He has been running a private school for the last four years and earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

He is requesting his fifth loan through KADET in the amount of 65,000 KES, which he will use to buy stationery for the school.  With the anticipated profit, he plans to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to transform his school into a leading private school.

loans.use: to buy stationery for his private school.

loans.name: Severo

texts.en:
Severo is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Severo has a field to sell corn grains that will be harvested in due time. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos to buy fertilizers for the corn field.

Severo is a member of HSPFI. In the future, Severo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn field.

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à un même groupe d’amis au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Yvonne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un certain Epiphane. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont trois restent à leur charge. Yvonne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Yvonne a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Il y a très longtemps que Yvonne mène comme activité la vente des charbons de bois, des fagots et des conserves dans un quartier du Bénin pour parvenir à ses diverses charges. Yvonne exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Yvonne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Yvonne sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Jesukpego is a group of 4 people, all part of a group of friends in Benin. The representative of the group, Yvonne (with her hand raised in the photo) is 29 years old, and married to a man named Epiphane. The couple has four children, three of whom are still in their care.

Yvonne and her husband live with their children and together provide for the their different needs. Yvonne stopped her education in elementary school. For a long time, she has been engaged in the business of selling charcoal, bundles of wood, and canned food in a neighborhood of Benin to be able to provide for these varied needs.

Yvonne conducts her business with a passion, which allows her to provide for both her needs and those of her children. She stocks up in a market in Benin and in a region in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers, Yvonne is requesting her first loan with the other members of the Jesukpego group. This loan will allow them to better respond to their customers' needs and to generate more profit.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, bundles of wood, and canned food

loans.name: Yormat

texts.ru: Житель района Яван, 57 лет его зовут Ермат. Он женат и имеет детей. Ермат любит животных, и поэтому он занимается животноводством. Ермат занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота 20 лет. Он покупает молодых телят и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродает их на скотном рынке. Ермат быстро освоил все навыки животноводческую деятельность. Он обратился за кредитом, чтоб расширить свою деятельность. Ермат за счет денег купить несколько молодых телят. Этот кредит поможет ему достичь своих целей и улучшить условий жизни его семьи.

loans.use: Для расширения животноводческой деятельности и купли телят

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
I am 42 years old, married with three children. I am the treasurer of a self help group called Konguini Thayu Women Group. Our major activity is savings and credit done by all members of the group.I have been the treasurer of this group since 2003.

I started my business in 1998 and have been able to construct a small shop and bought a dairy cow. Having a big space and on a strategic position at the centre of town coupled with the demand for soft drinks in this part of town, i believe it will be a good venture. This will bring in more income which wilgive me the opportunity to give my children better education and improve my standard of living.

loans.use: I would like to start selling sodas.I have been selling other packed juices but of recent i acquired a big space and the number of clients for sodas have been increasing day by day.This money will help me buy fifty crates of sodas which i anticipate to sell in about two weeks.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is married with two children. He lives in the Mbagala area, Temeke District of Dar es Salaam. He owns four outlets where he sells different kinds of bags, but mostly travelling bags. He has located his outlets near railway stations and bus terminals - places where most of his customers are. The businesses have a high turnover which means he frequently runs out of stock. Arnold is planning to add a larger stock of bags to do away with stockouts.

Arnold also owns a wholesale shop in Mbagala, selling mainly sugar, maize flour, beans, rice and other cereals. He has developed a healthy relationship with his customers. Most of his customers are retailers. They depend on his shop because they would otherwise have to travel to town, about 25 miles away, to buy the items. Arnold is planning to add other non-food items like plastic home materials and clothes.

The two businesses need a capital boost of USD 1100.

loans.use: Opening another outlet

loans.name: Noor Jahan

texts.en: Noor Jahan, daughter of Niam-U-Din, is 45 years old. She is married, has 8 family members, and right now lives in district 8 of Kabul City. She has a tailoring business and wants to take a loan for that. She is an uneducated woman because her family didn’t give her permission to study. However, she wanted to do something for her family, especially after her marriage, and that is why she started her tailoring business. She makes clothes and sells them in bazaar. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough money. Therefore, her production was small, and she made little money. Then she heard about the loan process through AFSG from one of her friends, and she decided to start taking loans. Up to now she has taken 3 loan cycles from AFSG and wants to take a 4th cycle. Now her business has expanded, and she is making more clothes. As a result, her income has increased.

loans.use: Buying fabrics, string, etc.

loans.name: Bella

texts.es:
Mrs. Bella owns a café which is located in a school. She has 5 years of experience running it. She tends the café from 7am until 10pm from Mondays through Fridays. She sells are sorts of sweets, hot dogs, fries, hamburgers and beverages. She began this business because she helped her sister in a restaurant. With the experience she gained, she decided to open her own café with money that was lent to her.

Mrs. Bella wishes to buy ice cream and beverages because of their high demand. She also would like to expand the sales of lunches that she is starting with.

Mrs. Bella is 41 years old. She and her husband separated more than 10 years ago. She has an 18-year-old son who helps her occasionally running the business. She owns a two-story house made of concrete that she inherited from her parents. It is now undergoing improvements. She wishes to work and grow with us in all aspects to better her quality of life.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Bella es propietaria de una bar. El negocio esta ubicado en un colegio. Ella lleva 5 años de experiencia. Atiende su negocio desde las 7am hasta 10pm. De lunes a viernes Vende todo tipo confiterías, salchipapas, hamburguesas, jugos, colas. Su negocio lo inicio porque ella ayudaba en un restaurante a una hermana y con la experiencia que adquirió decidió poner su propio negocio con un dinero que le prestaron.

Doña Bella desea comprar lo que es helados y mas productos como cacitos, helados, jugos, colas etc. Ya que tiene bastante demanda de estos productos. Además de ampliar la venta de almuerzos que lo esta iniciando.

La señora Bella tiene 41 años. Se separo de su esposo hace mas de 10 años. Tiene un hijo de 18 años quien le ayuda en ciertas ocasiones en el negocio. La casa en la que vive es propia, herencia de sus padres es de 2 pisos de cemento, el 2do piso lo esta adecuando. Ella desea trabajar y crecer en todos los aspectos con nosotros y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Invest in ice cream and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothes selling business

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Business Description

Evelin has 3 years of work experience. Luckily, her mother, whom she met in another country, gave her $200 to start her own business. Together with her grandmother, she has been able to continue her business. Also, she travels to sell brand name cosmetics in one of the most reputable markets in the country. She works everyday of the week from 8AM to 9PM.

Use of Loan

The loan will be used to invest in more inventory since the busy season is coming. In addition, she wishes to stock up for her cosmetics business.

Personal Details

Evelin is single and 20 years old. She lives with her brother and grandmother. She lives in a cement home. She wishes to be able to grow and expand her business to other parts of the city. She hopes to attain her dreams with the investment she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Evelin tiene una experiencia de 3 años con su actividad. Se inicio gracias a su mama que se encuentra en otro país la cual le ayudo con un capital de 200 dólares para iniciar su negocio. Ha logrado mantenerlo trabajando junto a su abuela. Ha logrado surtir su local con regalos, juguetes. También ella recorre donde conocidos vendiendo cosméticos de una marca conocida en el país. Trabaja todo los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en mercadería para surtir su negocio. Ya que se viene la temporada buena y tiene pedidos de muchos artículos. Además de surtir su negocio de venta de cosméticos.

Información Personal

Evelin es soltera. Tiene 20 años y vive con su hermano y su abuela. Su casita es de cemento. Su deseo es poder expandirse a otros sectores de la urbe con sus productos. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder lograrlo.

loans.use: to invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn B. is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a restaurant were she cooks food. She lives in Benin City in Edo State. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a refrigerator and foodstuffs. This she said will help her serve customers better.

loans.use: To buy more food items and ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy K. wants to increase her stock of general merchandise so that she can be able to meet her needs. She also wants to buy a landline telephone so she can use it as a pay phone for customers.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase stock and purchase phone

loans.name: Fayiza

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of three children, Mrs. Fayiza A. lives in Tékponou (in the Vo prefecture). Aged 25, she runs a small business buying and selling smoked, dried and other types of small fish. A lack of funds means she is often unable to meet the needs of her customers. She is requesting funding of $200 to create a permanent stock in order to avoid shortages and establish customer loyalty. This will increase her profit margin so she can better support the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame A. Fayiza vie à Tékponou (P/Vo). Agée de 25 ans, elle exerce son petit commerce de petits poissons fumés, séchés et divers. Le manque de moyens financiers lui impose souvent l’incapacité de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un financement de $200 pour faire un stock permanent afin d’éviter les ruptures de stock et de fidéliser sa clientèle. Ceci augmentera sa marge bénéficiaire en vue de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell smoked fish

loans.name: Ni Nengah Juni Astut

texts.id:
Since getting married to Putu Purnawa, 4 years ago, Ni Nengah Juni Astut started a small food kiosk in front of her home. She chose this business since her village is quite isolated from urban areas, therefore, the villagers have hard time obtaining daily household needs. She sells daily needs like rice, spices, soap and various snacks. She opens her kiosk at 7 am and closes it at 6om. She earns about $4 each day. As her business grow, her clients are requesting that she carries more merchandise, such as kerosene and farm feeds. Ni Nengah Juni Astuti wants to fulfill these requests and grow her business. Hoerver she does not have sufficient capital. So she applied for a $330 loan from DINARI. With this additional funding, Ni Nengah Juni Astuti plans to increase her merchandise offering and renovate her kiosk. She is optimistic that her business will grow significantly.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Setelah menikah dengan Putu Purnawa 4 tahun yang lalu, Ni Nengah Juni Astuti mulai membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya.Usaha ini dipilih Ni Nengah Juni Astuti karena di dusun tempat tinggalnya, merupakan salah satu dusun yang sangat terpencil yang jauh dari perkotaan sehingga masyarakat di tempat ini sangat sulit untuk membeli barang- barang kebutuhan sehari-hari. Barang yang dijual adalah segala kebutuhan rumah tangga seperti beras, bumbu dapur, deterjen, sabun mandi dan aneka makanan kecil. Mulai pukul 07.00 pagi Ni Nengah Juni Astuti membuka warungnya dan tutup pada pukul 18.00 sore. Keuntungan rata rata yang di peroleh per harinya sebesar Rp. 35.000.- Seiring dengan perkembangan dan juga banyaknya permintaan dari pelanggan akan keperluan yang lain seperti minyak tanah dan pakan ternak khususnya ternak babi , Ni Nengah Juni Astuti bermaksud mengembangkan lagi usaha warungnya. Namun karena dana yang di miliki tidak cukup, Ni Nengah juni Astuti mencari pinjaman ke Dinari sebesar Rp 3.000.000,- .Dengan tambahan modal ini Ni Nengah Juni Astuti akan menambah barang daganganya dan memperbaiki kondisi warungnya agar lebih baik lagi. Ni Nengah Juni Astuti optimis usahanya akan berkembang pesat.

loans.use: Purchase goods to be sold and renovate kiosk

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba A. runs a small shop in a metro station entrance. She rents it from the metro department as a venue for selling souvenirs. She was a part-time teacher of literature in high school and her salary was low. So she decided to make a first step closer to becoming a business woman.

Now she runs this shop that mostly Muslim women visit. At the moment there’s a big demand for perfume that does not contain alcohol because Islam prohibits alcohol. Mahbuba needs this loan to purchase non-alcohol perfume and resell it. She is also planning to employ her friend who does handicrafts and will be making small souvenirs right in the shop, so clients can see how the product is made.

loans.use: Purchase of alcohol-free perfume for re-sale

loans.name: Zenon Ignacio

texts.es:
Zenon is a designer and embroiderer, and designs wedding gowns as well as gowns for events such as weddings, quinceañeras (15th birthday parties for girls) and others.

Zenon has a sewing workshop where he makes his dresses. He is a very stable and responsible worker, and he has made his loan payments punctually to date.

Now he would like to invest in construction materials for his home, which he has been able to build little by little. With much effort, the house is now in the final phase of construction.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Zenon C., es costurero bordador, diseña vestidos para novias y damas para eventos como matrimonios, fiestas de quinceaños y otros.

Don Zenon posee un taller de costura donde hace sus vestidos, es un trabajador muy constante y reponsable, hasta la fecha ha cumplido puntualmente con las cuotas de su crédito.

Ahora Él quiere invertir en material de construcion para su casa, que a venido construyendo poco a poco, y con mucho esfuerzo se encuentra en la etapa final de su construcion.

loans.use: Invest in construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru:
Inoyat Qurbonoba lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 51 year old widow with 4 children. She is the sole person responsible for maintaining and supporting her household. But she is not giving up. Currently, she works as an elementary school teacher. She would like to obtain a loan to purchase an additional cow for her children. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 15 months.

While her children will be looking after the cow, she will be able to obtain milk and use it in for her family and sell the extras.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонова Иноят живет в городе Вахдат. Возраст 51 год , вдова и имеет 4 детей. Весь груз по обеспечению и воспитанию ее детей лежит только на ней. Но она не унывает . Сейчас работает учителем начальных классов в средней школе. Хочет получит кредит , чтобы купить еще одну корову для своих детей. Погашать кредит сможет в течении 15 месяцев . А смотрет за коровой будут ее дети. Получаемое молоко сможет продавать и использовать в хозяйстве.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim N., 46, is a widow and the mother of two children, both of whom are employed by a garment factory. Sim has a business selling groceries to support the family. Since she first heard about Credit who provide loans to help poor entrepreneurs she has wanted to get a loan to earn extra profit. So now she will use the loan along with her savings to purchase a small truck. She will hire it out to earn an extra profit.

loans.use: Sim would like to purchase a small truck to rent out.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is a mother of 7 school-age children who need her support to be able to successfully complete their primary school education. As such, Alejandrina and her spouse eagerly have dedicated themselves to their bakery for more than 20 years. Their work helps cover their household expenses. It’s also a service to their neighbors, seeing Alejandrina distributes bread in bulk to the bodegas (small grocery and sundries stores) in the area.

Because of the higher cost of flour, the bakery has entered a difficult period. For this reason Alejandrina is requesting a loan to purchase needed flour and to continue making and distributing the bakery’s delicious bread. Alejandrina also plans to purchase machinery to facilitate her work in the bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Alejandrina es una madre de 7 hijos los cuales son escolares y requieren de apoyo para lograr concluir con éxito su preparación, es así que Alejandrina y su pareja trabajan con ahínco y dedicación en su panadería hace más de 20 años, esta labor ayuda a satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar y es un servicio para sus vecinos, puesto que Alejandrina distribuye panes al por mayor para las bodegas.

Por el costo elevado de la harina su panadería está pasando por momentos muy difíciles, por ello solicita un préstamo para adquirir la harina que le hace falta y seguir preparando y distribuyendo sus riquísimos panes, como también comprar algunas maquinarias que faciliten su trabajo dentro de su panadería.

loans.use: Purchase of flour and machinery for improved operation of her bakery

loans.name: Beauty

texts.fr: Née en 1938 à Agomé-Tomégbé, veuve et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame Y. Beauty a abandonné ses études primaires par manque de support. Elle s’est lancée très tôt dans les activités du commerce d’huile de palme qui lui permettent de subvenir au besoin minimum de sa famille. Très brave et courageuse, elle sollicite un financement afin de pouvoir renforcer son commerce d’huile de palme et de facto ses revenus. Cela lui permettra alors d’assurer convenablement les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1938 in Agomé-Tomégbé, Mrs. Beauty Y. is a widow and the mother of three children. She left her studies in primary school, as she lacked support, and began early on with her palm oil business, which has allowed her to provide for her family. Very brave and courageous, she is asking for a loan to strengthen her palm oil business and, thereby, her revenues. This will allow her to meet her family’s needs reasonably well.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Palm oil business

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es: La señora Alberta, es una persona muy sencilla. Trabaja hace muchos años en el rubro, con lo cual, ayuda a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar necesarios para sobrevivir. Es una Señora muy trabajadora y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, muy dedicada a su familia y gracias a  su trabajo está sacando adelante a sus dos pequeños hijos,a quienes trara con mucho amor. Vive en una casa muy humilde, que no cuenta con los servicios básicos de sanidad.
texts.en:
Doña Alberta is a very modest person. She has been selling home products for many years supporting her husband in covering the necessary household expenses in order to survive. She is a very hard-working lady and responsible in covering her payments, she is very dedicated to her family and thanks to her work she is helping her two young children to get ahead treating them with love. She lives in a humble house without basic sanitation services.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Luz Angélica, socia del Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, Centro Poblado Menor de La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y salchipapas; las gaseosas  y frugos los vende en su casa y por las tardes sale a vender, en su carrito salchiparero, en una de las calles céntricas del caserío y en las fiestas que hay en la localidad. Se inicia en el negocio porque tenía la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para solventar los gastos de sus hijos, sobre todo los gastos escolares.  

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará agua mineral, gaseosas de diferentes marcas y de tamaño personal, mediano y familiar, frugos de diferentes marcas, así como también los productos para la preparación de salchipapas como papas, cremas (mayonesa, ketchup, mostaza) y  pollos  que los compra de manera diaria. 

Luz Angélica tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 02 de sus 04 hijos. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Más adelante desea comprar un toldo para tener una buena ubicación y sobre todo para asegurar su lugar en caso de lluvia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Angelica is a member of the group "La Libertad," (Freedom) and she lives in the Region San Martin and in the province and district of Bellavista, Centro Poblado Menor de La Libertad. She sells sodas and "salchipapas," ( pan-fried hot dogs or sausages mixed together with french fries). She sells the sodas and juices from her home and in the afternoon she leaves to sell her products in town in her fast-food cart, mainly in the center streets of town or at festivals that are held in the neighborhood.She began her business because she needed to earn more money in order to support her childrens' expenses, first and foremost their school costs. With this loan of $500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase mineral water, different sodas and various juices from various different brand names, as well as products she needs to make her snack foods, like potatoes, sauces (mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard) and chickens that she purchases on a daily basis. Luz Angelica is 39 years old and lives with her husband, and two of her four children. She is a persistent and responsible woman, who would like to give her children all the opportunities available to them. In the future, she would like to purchase a canopy so that she can better place her business. Above all, she would like to be able to protect her home from the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mineral water, sodas, juices, potatoes, sauces and chickens.

loans.name: Geraidina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Geraidina Mwambo from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of four and 15 years old. Additionally, she supports one dependent orphan. Geraidina has been running a clothes business since 1993. She sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is an expressive textile: the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Geraidina works at the business for eight hours per day,five days per week. Geraidina currently earns about 325 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500 USD in order to buy more clothes to sell. In the future, she plans to expand the business. Geraidina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Evelio Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. L. soltero, de 43 años de edad, Ingeniero Agronomo, trabaja en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como responsable de Desarrollo Rural Integral desde hace 8 años, tiene 2 hijas estudiando una el 4to año de secundaria y la otra el 2do año de universidad, su esposa no trabaja esta como ama de casa al cuido de sus hijas y del hogar.    Esta solicitando su 2do credito el que utilizara para poner 15 mts cuadrados de ceramica, pues tiene piso embaldozado y ademas hacer una division de playsen y madera que servira de dormitorio para sus hijas; su primer credito lo cancelo en su fecha establecida con responsabilidad, es una persona con mucho espiritu de superacion, honesto y muy respetado por sus compañeros de trabajo, manifiesta que su casa es grande y que solo a una parte pondra la ceramica, que con futuros creditos terminara la obra que inició con el credito anterior hasta cumplir el sueño de su familia y de él de tener una vivienda digna y confortable.
texts.en:
Sr. L., 43, is an agricultural engineer and works in the township of Juigalpa. He has managed the Comprehensive Rural Development program for 8 years. He has 2 daughters, one in high school and one at college. His wife works at home, caring for the couple's daughters and the house. Sr. L. is applying for a 2nd loan that he will use to lay 15 square-meters of tiled flooring and create a separate space in the house with "playsen" [no translation] and wood that will be used as a bedroom for his daughters. His first loan was paid on time. He's someone with a will to overcome, honest and respected by his co-workers. He points out that his house is large and that only a part of it is tiled. He hopes to finish the work with future loans so that he can fulfill the dream that he and his family have to live in a decent, comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flooring and other renovations.

loans.name: Margarita Gaudiosa

texts.es:
La señora Margarita  Gaudiosa D.  D. A. tiene 65 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Libertad 495 del Puerto Marítimo D. Salaverry en la provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió la especialidad D. Educación,  pero nunca ejerció su profesión.
Es casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos separados del ceno del hogar.
Margarita venD. comidas al paso, pollo a la parrilla, pollo frito, churrasco, etc. Es muy conocida en su medio y sus clientes la prefieren porque cocina muy bien, sus actividades las realiza en su casa.
El primer crédito fue D. 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas, todo el préstamo fue invertido en insumos para su negocio.
Con este crédito D. 1700 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará todo lo que sea necesario para sus comidas al paso, pues por acercarse las fiestas D. fin D. año el negocio aumenta.
Margarita desea viajar constantemente, es su pasión.
texts.en:
Margarita Gaudiosa D. D. A. is 65 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Las Emprendedoras II and lives on 495 Libertad Street in Puerto Marítimo D. Salaverry in the province of Trujillo in the state of La Libertad, Perú. She studied Education, but never practiced her profession. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom have left home. Margarita sells fast food, such as rotisserie chicken, fried chicken, churrasco [barbecued meat], etc. She is well-known in her environment, and her clients prefer her because she cooks very well. She performs her activities in her house. The first loan she received was 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 installments. All of this loan was invested in consumables for her business. With this loan of 1700 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments, she will buy all that may be necessary for her fast food business. So, as the end-of-year holidays approach her business will grow. Margarita wishes to travel constantly. This is her passion.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the necessary products for her fast food business for the end-of-year festivities

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan tiene un minibús el cual trabaja su hijo, además trabaja en una construcción con lo que se cubre la manutención de la familia la esposa también trabaja en una construcción vive en casa propia en la zona Puerto Mejillones de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinara para el pago de ingreso a la ESBAPOL (Escuela  Básica Policial) así colaborara a su hijo Nemo M. para que pueda estudiar y tener una profesión en la vida. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Juan has a minibus which he son drives, and he also works in construction. With this money, he covers the expenses of providing for his family. His wife also works in construction. He lives in a house of his own in the Puerto Mejillones section of the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to pay for a deposit to the ESBAPOL (Basic Police School) so his son Nemo M. can study and have a professional career. This is his first loan with Impro, and an evaluation has been conducted which qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his son's studies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. earns a living selling provisions and drinks to retail customers. She would like to expand her inventory. She therefore needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

Mary is 45 years old. She is married with 5 children. Her husband is a commercial driver.

She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 44 años, siempre soñó con formar una familia, ahora tiene tres hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro y junto a su esposo lograron adquirir una casa donde pudieron brindarles seguridad y estabilidad a sus pequeños. Su afán de progresar la llevó a desempeñarse en múltiples actividades en el trascurso de su vida, optando por ejercer el oficio de cosmetóloga hace 2 años, pues fue una de las actividades que mayores ingresos le producía, ya que solo invertía en la compra de productos, pues su capacidad y creatividad como estilista era lo suficiente para hacer de ella una persona competente. En el trascurso de los meses viendo la gran demanda que tenia, tuvo la iniciativa de instalar un salón de belleza, pero no contaba con los recursos suficientes, más su pareja realizó su sueño, pues ambientó el primer piso de su casa para el salón de belleza que requería y desde entonces las cosas han mejorado, ya que ahora Martha presta sus servicios muy alegremente durante todo el día. Sin embargo, ahora desea incrementar algunas máquinas de última tecnología para realizar su trabajo con mayor eficiencia. Ella está iniciando su primer préstamo con MFP, y el recibimiento dentro del grupo fue muy ameno y acogedor, Martha espera seguir formando parte de este equipo. El dinero que solicita será Martha invertido en la compra de insumos; tales como tintes, líquidos para peinar, entre otros productos que requiere para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha is 44 years old and had always dreamt of starting her own family. She now has three children who are her greatest treasure. She and her husband managed to obtain a house in which they could offer their young ones safety and stability. Her thirst for progress drove her to partake in several business activities throughout her life, finally settling on cosmetology 2 years ago. This was one of the businesses that brought in the most profits for her because she only invested in purchasing products, and her skills and creativity as a hairstylist were enough to make her a competent person. After a few months passed and she realized that her services were in demand, she took the initiative to set up a beauty salon, but she did not have enough funds to do so. Nevertheless, her husband materialized her dream by converting the first floor of their home into the beauty salon that she needed. Since then, things have improved because Martha now gladly offers her services all day long. However, she now needs to increase her number of cutting-edge equipment in order to work more efficiently. This is her very first loan with MFP, and she received a warm welcome from the group. Martha hopes to continue being a part of this team. The money that Martha is requesting will be invested in purchasing supplies such as dyes, hair products, and other things that she needs to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana C. is 30 years old, single, and the mother of two kids who are currently in school. She is a trader and has been selling jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers, dressing bags, and cloth for the past three years. Joana says her working capital was provided by herself, but is not adequate for her business. She is not able to purchase high quality products.

She believes the loan will help her to purchase good quality and large quantity to scale up sales. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, ladies' wear, cloth, and slippers to increase her inventory. Joana mostly sells through hawking that is house-to-house selling. She believes that your support will enrich the success of her business. She belongs to a village bank called Maranatha.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies' wear, cloth, and slippers, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 38 años es una madre muy querida por sus hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Elías de 41 años y sus 2 hijos Willy 20 y Javier 15, a quienes desea darles una buena educación superior. Elena camina todos los días por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, junto a su carretilla de helados buscando clientes que desean saborear sus deliciosos productos, es muy alegre y siempre atiende a las personas con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la cara de felicidad de los niños cuando sus padres les compran el helado que tanto deseaban, pero lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, lo que le causa mucho cansancio. Lleva 14 años en esta actividad y espera hacer crecer su negocio y poder comprarse su propia carretilla de helados, porque la que usa actualmente la alquila de la empresa, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poco a poco acercarse más a sus metas. Este es el quinto préstamo de Elena con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus primeros pagos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus socias, ya que es muy responsable. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más helado para vender más durante sus jornadas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Elena is a 38-year-old beloved mother who lives in her parents' home with her 41-year old husband Elias and her two sons: Willy, age 20 and Javier, age 15. Elena hopes to provide her children with a good post-secondary education. She walks with her ice cream cart every day in the streets of Juliaca, looking for clients who would like to enjoy her delicious products. She is a very happy person and always serves her customers with a smile on her lips. What she likes most about her job is seeing the happy faces of children whose parents have bought them the ice cream they wanted so much. The hardest part of her job, however, is having to walk all day under the harsh sun, which makes her extremely worn out. Elena has spent 14 years doing this job, and she hopes to be able to improve her business, and purchase her own ice cream cart, as the one she currently uses is rented from the company. Owning her own cart would allow her to increase her income and gradually get closer to her goals. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She has been very punctual with her prior payments and hopes to be so this time as well. In her village bank she is much appreciated by the other members, as she is very responsible. With the money requested, she will buy more ice cream in order to sell more in her workday.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Мухаммад мужчина в возрасте 43 лет, женат имеет 3 детей. Мастер по ремонту и обделке квартир. Также он мастер штукатурщик. Кроме своего дохода он имеет дополнительный доход с бизнеса откорма и продажи скота. Сейчас у него дома две коровы и маленький телёнок.Жена Мухаммада занимается продажей молока , которое даёт их корова.Для увеличения голов скота Мухаммад решил получить кредит.
texts.en:
Muhammad A. is a 43-year-old man, who is married and has three children. Muhammad is a master craftsman, specializing in apartment remodeling and repair. He also does plaster work. In addition to that income, he earns money raising and selling cattle. At home, he presently has two cows and one young calf. Muhammad's wife sells the milk, which their cow gives. Muhammad decided to take out a loan to increase the size of their herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa M. is a 55 year old widowed with five children. She is a very experienced mother who demonstrates motherhood with a sense of responsibility.

For five years, she has been selling Kenkey. Kenkey is a favorite food of many Ghanaian. It is tasty and so satisfying. It is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish.

Adwoa will use the loan to purchase raw materials such as maize, vegetable oil, vegetables and firewood in bulk. This will help her avoid constant price hikes resulting from the current food crisis in the country. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: Buy raw materials such as maize, vegetable oil, vegetables and firewood in bulk.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
Los señores antes mensionados son  integrantes del grupo  "GENESIS" ubicado en la Comunidad  de la Redonda El Aguila Jamastran de la ciudad de Danli, ellos se conocen muy bien, siempre han trabajado juntos y gracias a este credito que estan solicitando podran seguir mejorando sus negocios y por consiguiente sus condiciones de vida 

a continuacion se detalla las actividades de cada uno:

SANTOS CRISTINA L. R.
desde hace 6 años atras ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, venta de repuestos de bicicletas y molino para maiz.
estos negocios le generan ingresos para suplir las necesidades personales y de su hija, de esta manera le es de gran apoyo a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia siendo estos dos rubros  los que impulsan el desarrollo de la comunidad.
 
NOHEMIU DSEL CARMEN R.   
ella tiene mas de 2 años de vender cosmeticos, ahora ha ido adquiriendo experiencia en el manejo del negocio,  compra mas productos y obtiene mejores ganancias las que le ayudan a mejorar las  condiciones de su vida y la de su familia.

SANTOS JULIAN LOPES R.  
el tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad es la compra y venta de maiz y frijoles, esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante y domiciliar esta soltero y en lo poco que puede ayuda a sus padres, es un joven admirado en la comunidad por su espiritu de superacion y buena conducta moral.
el necesita invertir en su negocio para obtener mayores ventas mejores ganancias

KAREN YESSENIA O. 
ella tiene 1 año de dedicarse al comercio ella compra y vende ropa nueva americana y tambien calzado,  es madre soltera tiene una hija de un año.  sus ventas las realiza de contado y credito 
de manera domiciliar y ambulante, Ella desea invertir mas en su negocio ya que tiene la clientela y muchas de las veces tiene que ir y venir otra vez a la ciudad a comprar mas mercaderia y esto le incrementa los gastos de tranporte.
texts.en:
The people listed are members of the Genesis group, which is located in the Redonda El Aguila Jamastran community in the city of Danli. They know each other very well. They have always worked together. Thanks to this loan that they are asking for, they will be able to improve their businesses and, in turn, their life conditions. Details of the businesses are as follows: Santos Cristina L. R. For six years she has been selling popular consumer products, bicycle replacement parts, and she has a mill to grind corn. These businesses have generated income to cover the personal necessities for her and her daughter. This helps her husband with the household expenses. Her husband works in agriculture and is a farmer. Agriculture and farming drive the development of the community. Nohemiu del Carmen R. She has been selling cosmetics for over two years. She has now gained experience in managing the business. She buys more products and gets better earnings, which help improve living conditions for her and her family. Santo Julian L. R. For over five years he has been buying and selling corn and beans. He does this on foot, going to customers and their households. He is single, and he helps his parents the little that he can. The community admires him for his spirit of self-improvement and his fine, moral behavior. He needs to invest in his business to make greater sales and improved earnings. Karen Yessenia O. She has been buying and selling new American clothes and footwear for one year. She is a single mother, and she has a one year old daughter. She makes her sales for cash and on credit. She sells on foot, going to customers and their households. She wants to invest more in her business. She now has customers. Many times she goes to the city and then has to return back again to buy more merchandise. That increases her transportation expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, corn, bicyle parts, cosmetics, new clothes

loans.name: Siva

texts.en: Siva N., 27, is married with 3 children.  She has experience in the banana chip business.  She sells to the public 5 days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Siva expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~ 110USD).  SPBD loans are Siva’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, plastic bag, veges oil, frying pan, banana etc

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
H. Hoàng Thị (1721080956) is a 28-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children.

H. owns and operates a manufacturing business, primarily manufacturing and selling mattresses to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. La Si Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, which consists of twelve members, is located in Kampong Trea village in Kandal province. They plan to use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. La S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school and the youngest is too young to work or study. She is a hard working woman who has been hired by the villagers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Chork Cheng, is a fisherman. With his fishing, he can earn a little income to support his family living.  In order to improve the living, Mrs. La S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets to improve her husband's fishing.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's fishing.

loans.name: Magda Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Magda Venessa A. y su esposo el señor Rogelio Guajardo tienen dos pequeños hijos quienes están estudiando, pero en esté años no cuentan con el dinero necesario para pagar las inscripciones y comprar los uniformes, los útiles escolares para que los niños puedan entras a estudiar.  
Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo y planean pagar el crédito con los ingresos que generan sus empleos. Doña Magda trabaja en una guardería en el aria de limpieza y el señor Rogelio de vigilante de guardia de una compañía.
texts.en:
Sra. Magda Vanessa A. and her husband, Sr. Rogelio Guajardo, have two small children who are studying. This year they do not have the money to pay for the registration fees, uniforms, and school supplies that their children need for their classes.

They are requesting a loan and plan to repay it with the money they earn from their jobs. Doña Magda is a janitor at a nursery school while Sr. Rogelio works for a company as a security guard.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for registration fees, uniforms, and school supplies

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a resident of Barangay Palao, Solana, Cagayan. He is 46 years old and married to Marriam. They are blessed with four children: Marvin, 12 years old; Marjorie, 11 years old; Melchore, 6 years old and Marnely, 2 years old. Among their four children, three of them are already enrolled in the primary school which is located in their village.

Mario is a snack vendor inside and outside their village. He makes rice cakes and sells his products to earn a living and meet the daily needs of his family. He works very hard to give his children their educational needs.

With this, Mario wanted to request a loan of PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders as additional business capital. His food snack vending started last 2007 and he is thankful that the business is doing well. He hopes that, through having the loan, his business will become a success for the betterment of his family.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Puth

texts.en: Puth H., 48, is married and resides with her husband and their 16-year-old child in Kompong Cham province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business selling Cambodian traditional cakes. She also raises pigs at her home in the village, earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband is involved in the agriculture sector as rice field farmer in the flooding area of his farmlands, earning an income of US $2 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they start these businesses. H. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase pig feed. By doing so, her pigs will grow up efficiently and she will then be able to sell the pigs at a good price.

loans.use: To buy pig feed.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel J. is currently in the business of selling onions and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell.  Noel is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a nurse. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school and provide them with school uniforms.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Nakitto

texts.en:
M. is 25 years old and married with four children between the ages of 3 and 8 years old. All of her children go to school. She resides and owns a two-room house, where she is staying with five people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. M. takes care of additional family members as well.  

M. sells charcoal in Nalukolongo and doesn’t pay for transport costs to and from shopping because she buys from her home. On average, she receives three customers a day. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business ten years and has been with MCDT two years servicing her fifth loan, working with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and buying medication. Her challenges include defaulters and thieves. 

M. wants to use this loan to buy more bags/sacks of charcoal  She is aspiring to see her business grow stronger and to be able to start buying charcoal directly from producers, as well as to build a self sustained restaurant.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Tolik

texts.en:
Tolik H. is 30 years old. He is married with three children. He has been in the business of raising and selling cattle since he was young, which is why he has a lot of experience. It is necessary to point out that Tolik has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by his wife. 

Today Tolik has come to AqroInvest Credit Union, a Kiva partner, for a loan, which will allow him to purchase young cattle to raise and sell. It is his biggest dream to improve the conditions of his business in order to then improve the conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase three calves

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
28-year-old Analou is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has two kids and the oldest is sixteen years old.

Analou is into rice farming and has been doing it for quite some time now. Based on her experience, at times when she lacked finances, her harvest was small. So she joined CEVI in the hope of obtaining its financial services. She became a member in January and has been able to earn an income from her farm since.

Now Analou is requesting a loan of Php 9,000. She will use this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs she needs at her farm. Hopefully, Analou’s yield could double at the next harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Edith Elena

texts.es:
