Nuestra socia EDITH tiene 38 años, es casada, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia es coordinadora del programa social de Vaso de Leche en la municipalidad del Cusco. La socia tiene una hija llamada Maedy que estudia en la universidad la carrera profesional de Economía.  
 
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de ropa. Nuestra socia viaja a la frontera entre el país de Perú y el país de Bolivia donde compra ropa como pantalones, casacas blusas y muchas cosas más. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como casacas y pantalones para estas fiestas navideñas.              
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Edith is 38 years old, married, and was born in the city of Cusco. She belongs to the Ricchary Cusco Community Bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. Edith is the coordinator of the social program ‘Vaso de Leche’ in Cusco. (The program provides milk products to low-income families.) She has a daughter called Maedy who is studying economics at university. As well as looking after the home, Edith sells clothing. She travels to the border between Peru and Bolivia where she buys clothing such as pants, jackets, blouses, and many other things. She’s been doing this for several years, and the business has done well thanks to all her hard work. Edith is hardworking, enterprising, and is raising her family well. She needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as jackets and pants for the upcoming Christmas season. She is grateful for the opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to make repayments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as jackets and pants

loans.name: Agapito Leandro

texts.es:
Agapito tiene 35 años de edad, es casado, y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el caserío Cruz del Médano, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años se desempeña como tripulante de una embarcación pesquera que se hace a la mar durante los meses de Abril, Junio y Octubre. Durante los meses en que no se encuentra pescando trabaja en una fábrica de sal. La necesidad de seguir trabajando para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida ha hecho que también se dedique a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Agapito cría chanchos, pavos y gallinas para luego venderlos a los negociantes que usualmente visitan su caserío.

Debido a la proximidad de la temporada de verano, que trae consigo fuertes lluvias en la zona donde vive, Agapito se encuentra haciendo mejoras en su casa, pero el dinero con el que dispone no es suficiente para realizar esta acción, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Agapito planea instalar una bodega en su casa con la cual el sustento de su familia quede asegurado. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución, demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Agapito, 35, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Cruz del Médano settlement, Mórrope district, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years he has worked as a crewman on a fishing vessel that sets out to sea during April, June and October. On the months when he isn't out fishing, he works at a salt factory. The need to continue working to offer his family better living conditions has motivated him to also work raising small farm animals. Agapito raises pigs, turkeys and chickens for sale to merchants that come to his settlement. Given the nearness of Summer and the heavy rains that are usual during this season in his area, Agapito needs to make some improvements to his house. However, his available funds are insufficient to do the job. He needs 1000 new soles in financing from Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to set up a store in his house so that his family's support will be guaranteed. He has worked with our institution in the past and has demonstrated responsibility and puncutality with regard to his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve home's infrastructure.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo B. is from the village of Guinsiliban in the Camiguin Province. He is 51 years old and married and with 10 school-age children. To make a living, Reynaldo owns and operates a business providing motorcycle taxi service in his local community. He's been in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Reynaldo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Reynaldo is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer, tong machine and salon chemicals.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 5 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of her group la Nueva Esperanza (The New Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the poor, rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Yolanda is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fried foods such as fried chicken and empanadas. She will use the loan capital to invest in flour, cooking oil, meats and cheese. She will use the profits to invest in the education of her children and to repair the roof on her house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase flour, meats, cheese and oil

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a ellos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Este distrito en considerado como el segundo distrito mas poblado de la región, pero también es considerado el distrito más pobre.

Consuelo posee una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros)  con la cual se gana la vida. El vehículo es manejado por su hijo mayor el cual cubre carreras dentro de su distrito y en sus anexos. El continuo uso del vehículo hace que sea necesario otorgarle mantenimiento constante, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Con el dinero del préstamo comprará además forros para los asientos y anillos para el motor. Su anhelo es poder juntar el dinero que le permita comprarse otra mototaxi de segunda mano.

Ella es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia, sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen bastante estima y la consideran una mujer luchadora que siempre trata de salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades
texts.en:
Consuelo, 38, is a single mother of two children. She lives with them in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, which is 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. This district is considered to be the second-most populated in the region but is is also considered to be the poorest. Consuelo has a mototaxi (motorized, three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) which is her source of income. Her oldest son is the mototaxi driver; he covers routes within her district and in outlying areas. The continuous use of the vehicle requires that it be serviced often. This is the reason behind her requesting, for the first time, funds in the amount of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She will use the funds to buy new seat covers and piston rings. Her dream is to be able to save enough money to buy another used mototaxi. She is a woman that is quite dedicated to her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances all hold her in high regard and consider her to be a hard-working woman who always does her best to get ahead despite any difficulty that arises.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For mototaxi repair and service.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old and married with 3 children. Her eldest child is 17 years old while the youngest is six years old. Her children still attend school and she hopes to give them all a quality education.

Mary sells bags of charcoal at retail prices to her customers in Ibadan, Oyo state. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She is also happy because during the rainy season her sales of charcoal will increase. She hopes to be a major distributor of bags of charcoal in her community in the future. Mary is requesting for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en:
Imelda S. is from the village of Barangay 1 in San Mateo, Rizal. She is 46 years old. Imelda is the leader of a 8-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repay back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Imelda S.'s Group.

Imelda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a restaurant where she sells local foods to customers in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a week from these activities.

In 2007, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This will be Imelda's fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Yolanda (29) y su pequeño hijo.
Este trabajador hombre aprendió desde muy joven las técnicas necesarias para la agricultura, en la actualidad siembra plátanos y frutos cítricos en sus chacras propias. Aunque dice que el trabajo es algo sacrificado, por el cuidado que requiere la siembra, siente que su sacrificio tiene recompensa cuando inicia la venta de su producción a los comerciantes mayoristas, pues le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten mantener a su familia. 
A Roberto le gusta el cultivo de frutas, ya que puede sembrar y cosechar solo y cuando la producción aumenta, contrata operarios que le ayudan en el trabajo. Para más adelante tiene planeado aumentar su producción de frutas y sembrar variedad de ellas.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero del crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Además dice que está muy satisfecho con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues todos han demostrado ser muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Roberto tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantas de frutas, abono y fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Robert is 30 years old and lives in his own house with his wife Yolanda (age 29) and their young son.

This hardworking gentleman learned at a young age the techniques needed for farming. He currently grows bananas and citrus fruits in his own fields. Although he says the work requires sacrifice in order to care for his crops, Roberto feels the reward is worthwhile when is able to sell his products to the wholesalers and generate a good income to support his family. He enjoys growing fruit because he can plant and harvest by himself. When production increases, he hires laborers to help with the work. In the future, he plans to increase production by planting a variety of fruits.

This is his third loan with MFP. Roberto is very grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that he can continue working. He says that he is very satisfied with the work of his Communal Bank and that everyone has demonstrated that they are responsible with their payments. Roberto plans to invest the funds he requested in the purchase of fruit plants, compost, and fertilizers to maintain his land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit plants, compost, and fertilizer

loans.name: Chhauy

texts.en: Mr. S., 40, fishes in and around the river in his community. He earns his daily profit by fishing. Also, he provides the fish he catches to his wife to sell at retail at the market. By doing that, this couple is able to generate of about $7 per day to help be responsible for their family. S. wants to accrue the fishing tool and is asking for a loan to purchase bamboo to produce materials to use for his fishing. S. is hopeful that the loan will allow him to increase the quantity of fish he catches. The family has four children; three are single and the other one is now married. To help solve the family crisis, two of the children are employed in the garment factory. (S. was busy when the photo was taken so his wife is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase bamboo to produce materials used for fishing.

loans.name: Tt50-1 Group

texts.en:
Thanh T. K. D. was born in 1983. She lives in Dong Anh town, Ha Noi. She is married and has a 6-year-old daughter. Mrs Thanh is a farmer. Her husband is a builder. Her family has a monthly income of about 5.000.000 vietnamdong (VND). She has a participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. She is the leader of a 2-member group loan in SEDA. The other member in her group loved and believed her. Last cycle, she borrowed 3.000.000 VND. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to breed pigs.

 About the other borrower in her group :
Phich T. N. was born in 1958. She lives in Dong Anh town with her husband and her son. Her son is 28 years old. He has a job and has a monthly income. Her husband is a bricklayer. Her family has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has a participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. She wants to repair her kitchen and prepare for her son to marry. So, in this loan cycle, she needs 6.322.000 VND.

loans.use: to breed pigs

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda T. owns and operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 41 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Mohon. Luzminda has been in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Luzminda is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Puit De Jacob Plus Group

texts.en:
Espé M., age 30 and unmarried, is the president of the Community Bank “Puit de Jacob Plus,” which is composed of 21 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Espé started her business in 2000. She sells fresh and salted fish at the market located east of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to diversify her business by purchasing some sacks of manioc to make shikwanges, which are a main food in Kinshasa, and resell them with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $50.

Her ambition is to open a cold storage facility.

loans.use: diversifying her business by buying some sacks of manioc to make shikwanges and resell them at profit

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en: Yolanda A. is from the village of Bolinsong Bonifacio. She is 52 years old. Yolanda is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by GDMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Yolanda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Yolanda raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Roca 4 Group

texts.en:
Marinelly is the coordinator of her group, Jehova es mi roca 4 (The Lord is my rock).  She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children.  Being a single mom children, she says her most difficult challenges are to improve her business and to own a home.  Marinelly plans to continue to study and would like to travel.

Marinelly is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business.  She has had her business for over six years.  Marinelly plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy bracelets, rings, watch, chains and others silver jewelry. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to build her house.
 
-----------------------------------------
This Esperanza associate began with us because she believe in Esperanza program, which come into community and give hope to those whose need help to do their business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for Baseball players and sugar cane industries, the main economic activity is Free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Buy items to sell.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy T. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. He is 39 years old. Randy is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Randy owns & operates a bakeshop, selling a variety of confectioneries such cookies and cakes, in the local community. Randy has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Randy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Randy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. Randy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase baking equipment. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Randy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baking equipment.

loans.name: Turikumwe Group

texts.fr:
N. Francine, elle appartient dans un groupe solidaire appele TURIKUMWE qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  tous commerçants et ils se garantissent mutuellement, et elle est née à Cyangugu.   l’Ouest du pays, Elle est marié, elle a 3enfants, le plus âgée a7ans, le moins âgée a 3.5ans et son niveau d’éducation est primaire. Elle vit avec sa famille à kicukiro kagarama. Un enfant va a l’école. Francine avec son mari travaillent pour faire vivre et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle fait le commerce des produits aliments dans le marché de Nyabugogo. 
FRANCINE et son groupe travaillent pour stabiliser leur capacité financière. En fait, le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter, chacun des membres les articles de leur commerce et les revendre, une partie du profit est  réinvesti pour maintenir et augmenter leurs chiffres d’affaire du groupe et épargner afin de préparer pour un bon futur des membres et des familles.
N.B:N. Francine est à l'extreme droite portant un enfant
texts.en:
Francine N. was born in Cyangugu, belongs to the solidarity group Turikumwe, whose members are all merchants and guarantee each other financially. She was born in the eastern part of the country. She is married and has 3 children, of whom the eldest is 7 years old and the youngest is 3.5 months. She completed primary school and lives with her family in Kicukiro Kagarama. One of her children attends school. Francine and her husband work to support themselves and improve their family's living conditions. She sells food products at the market in Nyabugogo. Francine and her group work to stabilize their financial capacity. In fact, the group has obtained a loan through Amasezerano Community Banking to buy the items that each of them re-sells. A portion of the profits will be reinvested to maintain and increase their sales, and the rest saved in order to prepare themselves and their families for a better future. N.B. In the photo, Francine N. is at the extreme right, carrying a child.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas, potatoes, beans, rice, avocadoes, etc. for resale

loans.name: Maria Betty

texts.es: La Señora Betty tiene su librería - bazar, donde atiende también con su fotocopiadora en el dia y venta de salchipapas y hot dog, por las noches, su tienda esta en la zona de Pampahasi al frente de un colegio de la zona, por esto tiene mucha venta, es una cliente antigua y muy responsable, trabaja desde el año 2006 con nuestra institución, vive en la misma zona con su esposo que tiene su trailer con el que viaja constantemente llevando carga y constantemente esta fuera de la ciudad, tiene una pequeña hijita. El crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar material de escritorio y juguetes para el bazar ya que como esta al frente del colegio, tiene pedidos de estos productos, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Betty has a bookstore-general store where she also offers photocopying services during the daytime and at night she sells salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausages). Her store is located in the Pampahasi neighborhood in front of an area school so her sales are good. She is a longstanding, very responsible client who has collaborated with our institution since 2006. She lives in the same neighborhood with her husband who owns a truck that he uses constantly to haul cargo so he’s often out of town. She has a young daughter. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy office supplies and toys for the store because, since it’s in front of a school, she has pending orders for these kinds of items. She is very grateful to the institution for the support given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and toys.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 44 years old and married with 6 school-aged children. All the children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya where she has been farming for 20 years. Her mixed farm produces tea, maize, and milk which she sells locally.

She has requested this loan of 40,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her banana farming and start a cereals business. The extra income from this loan will be used to pay school fees for her children. She faces the challenge of lack of finance to purchase enough farm supplies like fertilizer and animal feed. In future, she would like to expand her dairy farming by increasing the number of her dairy cows from the current three to five.

loans.use: To expand her banana farming and start a cereals business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn T. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 55 years old, married, and has 7 children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting, and selling rice. She has been engaged in her business for over 26 years.

Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm essentials. This will be Evelyn’s seventh loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm essentials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is 49 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has two children and her children go to school. 

Mary is currently in the business of selling beans and charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a charcoal store.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. COYLLORITTI D. CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Corao, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Manuela; ella tiene 67 años D. edad y es viuda y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. picantería donD. venD. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz) y también algunos platos D. comida, ella atienD. desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio cambiando el ambiente D. la picantería (es como un restaurant mas tradicional). La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar para la picantería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Manuela is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor D. Coylloritti D. Ccorao”, which is located in the District of Corao, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 67 years old, widowed, and has six children. Manuela divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business where she sells “chicha” (a beverage maD. of corn) and a few food items. She manages her business between 8am and 5pm. Manuela wants to improve her business by changing the ambience of her restaurant (since it has more traditional décor). She is requesting a loan to buy products for cooking to use in her restaurant.

Manuela is grateful to those who helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely R., 57, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has four children. To make a living, Fely raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Fely also grows hogs and runs a sari-sari store. She also sometimes cooks food which she sells at her store.

Fely joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Fely is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar:
حسن فس عمر 40 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والاستهلاكية (ميني ماركت) حسن متزوج ليس له اولاد له في الميني ماركت حوالي 10 سنوات استطاع حسن بجده ونشاطه ان يجعل المحل له فهو يريد دائما التطور والمثابرة في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد غذائية جديدة وبضائع متنوعة للميني ماركت
له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة ومشجع انه يلقى دعم دائم من محيطه زبائنه من جيرانه ومحيطه
texts.en: Hassan, 40, is married with no children. He has been working at a mini-market selling foodstuffs and other consumables for 10 years. With his hard work and perseverance, Hassan managed to buy the mini-market. In his work, Hassan is resolute, with a passion for development. Hassan wants a loan from Al Majmoua to buy new foodstuffs and sundry goods for his mini-market. Hassan has a good, promising credit history with Al Majmoua. He always enjoys the support of his clients, who are mainly his neighbours and other people he knows.

loans.use: Buy foodstuffs and various goods for his mini-market

loans.name: Bruna

texts.en:
Bruna G. is from the village of Panghiawan, Catarman, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Bruna is widowed and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Bruna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like torta & caro in the local community. Bruna has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bruna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bruna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Bruna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand thebusiness. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Josias

texts.es: Josias, de 72 años,  esta separado de su  esposa hace 10 años y vive en su casa que es propia en el distrito de Quimbiri junto a su joven hijo Josias.Desde hace 20 años, se dedica al alquiler de cuartos que brinda en su vivienda y tiene varios inquilinos y esta muy satisfecho pues obtiene regulares ganancias de sus rentas. Gracias a su esfuerzo construyó su casa de tres  pisos en su distrito, donde ofrece veinte cuartos, que constantemente alquila y cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo. Le gusta administrar su vivienda y que sus usuarios se sientan cómodos, es por esta razón que constantemente las refacciona y los fines de semana no son de su agrado porque los ocupantes de los distintos cuartos organizan reuniones  y  la mayor parte de la noche pasa desvelado. Para el futuro tiene muchos planes de salir adelante y espera emprender nuevos negocios.Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete seguir trabajando con el mismo compromiso y aportar sus cuotas  puntualmente, ya que para él es muy importante contar con los  créditos posteriores, para lograr el progreso.Josias tiene planeado invertir los  1,000 soles en refraccionar la fachada de su vivienda y de esta manera espera  brindar una buena hospitalidad a sus usuarios.
texts.en:
Josias is 72 years old.  He separated from his wife 10 years ago and lives in his own home in Quimbiri district with his young son Josias.  For 20 years, Josias has been renting out rooms in his home.  He has several tenants and is very satisfied since he earns regular profits from his rentals.

Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to build a three-storey building in his district where he offers twenty rooms which are constantly rented out.  He has the support of his son.  Josias likes running his building and for his tenants to feel comfortable.  For this reason, he is constantly refurbishing his rooms.  He does not, however, enjoy weekends because the occupants of his rooms organize meetings and he spends most of the night awake.  He has many plans for the future and he hopes to start new businesses.

This is Josias' ninth loan with MFP and he pledges to continue working with the same pledge and to make his loan repayments on time since it is very important for him to have access to further loans so that he can make progress.  Josias plans to invest his 1,000 Peruvian soles in doing work on the front of his building and, in this way, he hopes to provide good hospitality to his tenants.

loans.use: To buy materials to refurbish his building

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for hospital expenses

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Bayarmagnai G., 41, is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Tuv province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

Her husband is self-employed. Her older daughter goes to college and her younger daughter attends a local high school. 

Bayarmagnai graduated from vocational school in 1991 and worked as a tailor and quality control specialist in the garment industry between 1997 and 2007. 

In 2006 she opened her own tailoring shop. She wants to expand her business and start manufacturing clothes. Bayarmnagnai's future dream is to open her own garment factory. She is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase more materials.

loans.use: To purchase more materials

loans.name: Par Cisse Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de PAR CISSE est créé le 04 décembre 2007 (jour de son inauguration). Il est composé de 23 membres qui sont du même village et se fréquentent depuis plus d'une décennie. Avant même leur adhésion à CAURIE-MF elles avaient initié des activités génératrices de revenus, des tontines et tant d'autres activités qui ne faisaient que renforcer la cohésion au sein du groupe. 

Madame NGONE SAER S. (debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo, enroulée avec une écharpe rose) est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge d'un neveu 

Elle fait de l'embouche est activité principale et parallèlement elle fait du petit commerce de fruits et légumes. Elle va au marché de la ville la plus proche pour y acheter la marchandise et revendre dans son village. 

Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes et subvenir aux besoins de la famille tout en soutenant son mari dans les taches courantes de la maison
texts.en:
The Par Cisse  Banc Villageois was created on December 4, 2007 (the day it was inaugurated). Its 23 members are all from the same village and have been friends for more than ten years. Even before joining CAURIE-MF, they had started revenue-producing activities. such as savings groups ("tontines") and many other activities that only made the group stronger.
Mrs. Ngone Saer S. (standing on the far right of the photo, in a pink wrap) is the group's leader. She is 40 years old, married, and  the mother of 7 children. She is also responsible for a nephew. Her main business activity is fattening livestock but she also sells fruits and vegetables. She buys produce at the market in the nearest town and re-sells in her village. Her goal is to strengthen her savings and meet her family's needs as well as helping her husband in household tasks.

loans.use: To buy sheep, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Adahamjon's Group

texts.en:
Adahamjon A., a the member of this group, is 24 and lives in Nookat, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 8000 soms, Adahamjon started a business providing video services (shooting and editing). He currently earns 30000 soms per month from this venture. To fill the the large volume of his current orders in a timely manner, Adahamjon hopes to obtain a loan to purchase more video cassettes. In the future he wants to buy a new updated video camera.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase video cassettes

loans.name: Chineta

texts.en:
Chineta is  married with 4 children and lives in the island of Cebu, Philippines. She earns her living by operating a general store and a scrapping (recycling) business. Her husband Nerio, who is 48 years old, works as a driver to earn his living.  

Chineta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Chineta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy stock for the store and additional capital for buying and selling scrap so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Chineta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Roberto; él tiene 60 años de edad, casado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias transportando carga a las distintas provincias de Cusco como Urubamba, Calca,Pisaq y Ollantaytambo el tiene un chofer para este negocio, a la vez el socio cuenta con otro carrito el cual brinda el servicio de taxi el trabaja todos los días por las mañanas y tardes siendo estas sus actividades que realiza para sacar a su familia adelante, el socio desea continuar así y espera poder agrandar mas su negocio.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su camión en el cambio de aceite y frenos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Roberto is a member of the "Los Líderes" (The Leaders) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Roberto is 60 years old, married, and has 3 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business transporting cargo to the different provinces of Cusco such as Urubamba, Calca, Pisaq and Ollantaytambo.  He has a driver for this business.  Roberto also has a small car that he uses to provide a taxi service.  He works every day, morning and afternoon.  These are the businesses which he carries out in order to get his family ahead in life.  He would like to continue in these businesses and hopes to be able to expand them.

Roberto is requesting this loan so that he can have some maintenance work done on his truck.  It needs its oil and brakes changing.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on his truck (changing the oil and brakes)

loans.name: Kemara

texts.en: Kemara is currently in a business selling rice and millet. She is 32 years old, married with six children — all of them in school. Kemara took out a loan to stock more rice and millet to sell. She hopes to open a shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more rice and millet to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamzungu

texts.en:
Mwanamzungu is a married woman with two school going children. She lives at her own house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For over one year, she has operated a cloth selling business (Kikoi’s) selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  Mwanamzungu faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of Kikoi’s from Tanzania for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of Kikoi's for resale.

loans.name: El Limón # 2 (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El limón en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las 13 socias y 1 socio  del Banco Comunal El limón. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general o prestar servicios como cabinas telefónicas, salones de belleza. Todo el grupo unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer crédito y esperan seguir por mucho tiempo en el Banco Comunal.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido  se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella es una muy buena ama de que para ayudarse y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a lavar ropa ajena, aunque en la actualidad ella está pensando poner un  negocio de venta de ropa, espera utilizar el crédito que le ha sido otorgado por la fundación para viajara a Guayaquil a comprar todo tipo de ropa y poco a poco crecer su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, camisetas, ropa de niños, blusas, entre otras prendas. Este es su primer ciclo al igual que  el Banco Comunal y espera estar por muchos ciclos más.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran almacén y fuerzas para seguir adelante dia a dia.

La foto pequeña adjunta a la foto del grupo es de la Señora Silvia quien no pudo asistir a la reunión por motivos de su trabajo y por tal motivo fué tomada otro día.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 13 women and 1 man who make up the El Limón community bank meet in El Limón sector, in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  They all work in different business activities such as farming, commerce or providing services such as telephone services or a beauty salon.  Everybody in the group works together to access the benefits provided by Fundación Espoir.  This is their first loan and they hope to continue in their community bank for a long time.

Here we meet 57 year-old Gloria who is married and has two grown-up children.  One of her children still lives at home.  Her husband is a farmer.

Gloria is a very good homemaker who, in order to help herself and to help her husband with their household expenses, washes other people's clothes.  She is currently planning to set up a business selling clothes.  She hopes to use the loan that she has been granted by Fundación Espoir to travel to Guayaquil to buy all kinds of clothes and gradually grow her business.

Gloria's dreams are to own a large store and to continue to have the strength necessary to get ahead every day.

The lady in the small photo attached to the main group photo is Silvia, who couldn't attend the meeting for work reasons.  Her photo was taken on another day.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
Walter, es un carpintero, vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos de 18, 20 y 22 años de edad, él trabaja en la carpintería, su forma de trabajo en a través de contratos, porque de esta manera se asegura mejor de las ventas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar madera de diferentes tipos, pega y formica, así tener materia prima para continuar con la fabricación de los muebles.
Su proyecto a futuro es comprarse un camión para transportar la madera y los productos que elabora.
texts.en:
Walter is a carpenter and lives with his family. He has three children who are 18, 20, and 22 years old. He does his carpentry jobs by contract so that he can better ensure his sales.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy different types of wood, glue and formica in order to have the raw material to continue making furniture.

His future project is to buy a truck to transport the wood and products he makes.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue and formica.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 46-year-old lady, married to Zainal, who is a 56-year-old man. They are blessed with ten children, namely: Faisal and Fahnan, both of whom are married; Farid, who is graduated from senior high school; Fajrin, who is working in a private company; Adi, who is working in Jakarta; Fahrul, who is in the third level of senior high school; Fadly, who is in the second level of junior high school; and Fauziah, Fikri and Fadillah, who are still in elementary school.

Fatima has a food stall business. She has been engaged with this business for three years. Prior to running the food stall business, Fatima used to run a kitchen equipment business. She ran her business door to door. One day, she decided to stop that business and initiated a food stall business. Fatima loves her current business because she feels that the food stall business helps her in generating income quicker than her previous business. Moreover, currently she has many customers who always come to buy food from her. Fatima employs two workers to help her in serving the customers.  

Fatima and her husband are aware that they are still responsible for financing six children, both in education as well as their living needs. Fatima desires to improve her business by adding more items and to sell, for example, various cakes and beverages. Fatima thinks that the more options of food that she offers, the more customers would like to come to her food stall.  Fatima also wants to buy a motorbike in installments to help her in buying foodstuff at the market. Therefore, Fatima is requesting a loan amounting to 10,000,000 IDR from TLM. She is hoping that TLM will assist her in making her dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuff and a motorbike in installments.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Calca en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; la socia tiene 29 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 1 hijo de 15 años La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia compra al por mayor maíz blanco y tara, la tara es una planta medicinal para las afecciones en la garganta, la socia compra al por mayor y los vende en el mercado de Calca ella tiene su stand , la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de maíz al por mayor y de tara para la venta al menor en su stand.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Vilma, 29, is a member of the “Señor de Huanca” communal bank located in Calca District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is married and has a 15-year-old son.  She is a retailer.  She buys white corn and "tara" (a medicinal plant used to treat throat infections) at wholesale.  She buys them at wholesale and then sells them at her stand in the Calca market.  She wants to invest the loan in purchasing corn and "tara" at wholesale for subsequent resale at retail in her stand.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is married, with two adult children. She’s 44 years old and lives in her own house in a rural area in Capellan, a developing area of Ilagan, Isabela. Leticia lives in a community that’s known for being a hospitable area.  Her main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. Leticia has been in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month.

Leticia has successfully repaid her previous loan from ASKI, which was used to invest in expanding the business. Leticia is requesting a new loan of PHP 15,000, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock and hog feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock and hog feeds

loans.name: Batu Alam Group

texts.en:
Ratna is married with three children. She is 33 years old. Her business is selling perfume. She start this business in 2008 and the business is running well. This is the second loan Ratna has taken out from VisionFund Indonesia, and she is asking for 1,500,000 Indonesian Rupiah to pay for perfume. From this business Ratna can send her children to school. She hopes she can continue sending her children until university. 

Ratna plans to have a good store in a strategic place, so that she can attract more people to be her customers.

loans.use: to pay for perfume

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. A 41-year-old mother of five school-going children, she is married to Jackson.

Agnes was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends, and this will be her first loan which she plans to use to purchase seeds and fertilizer for planting. She will later sell her produce at the local market. In the future, Agnes hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been operating her salon business for the last eighteen years in Kenyatta market, Nairobi city. She is 40 years old and married to Morris. They have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She has requested KES.50,000.  She intends to use the loan to buy shampoo, hair relaxer and hair extensions.  In the future, Beatrice hopes to expand her business and open another salon.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, hair relaxer and hair pieces.

loans.name: Yamilet Del Socorro

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua  la  señora  yamilet del socorro  se dedica  laborar como secretaria  en una empresa de esta cuidad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 5años . 
Una de las necesidades que la  señora  atraviesa hoy en dia es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a ha esto  ha tomado la decisión  de iniciar la obra de mejora. es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, arena, cemento, perlines y pago de mano de obra  .para iniciar  la mejora de la vivienda realizando la construcion de un cuarto de habitación  .por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus familia .
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Señora Yamilet del Socorro works as a secretary for a local business.  She has been doing this work for the last five years.

One of the Señora's current needs is having to improve the conditions of her home.  She has taken the decision to start work on improvements, and it is for this reason that she is coming to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials, such as zinc sheets, sand, cement, roofing beams and to pay for labor.  By starting this home improvement, she will be able to build another room, and by means of this work, she will be able to offer better living conditions for her family.

It is important to highlight that by completing this work, she will be able to provide her family with a decent roof where they live, and one that's in good condition.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang is a 56-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband works as a farmer. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For the past five years, she has run a food stall T. cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan T. buy new furniture, bowls and chopsticks and better quality food and beverages T. provide T. her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her T. improve her living conditions and allow her T. set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks and better quality food and beverages.

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера замужем, у нее есть взрослая замужняя дочь. Она - рыночный предприниматель из Белой Церкви. Вера работает на местном Центральном рынке, продавая трусы, носки, майки и т.д. Этим бизнесом Вера решила заняться еще 15 лет назад и с тех пор каждый день она торгует данным видом товара на рынке. Благодаря своему бизнесу Вера смогла помочь своей дочери тоже начать собственный бизнес и она тоже теперь торгует на местном базаре. 

Кредит в 7 000 гривен Вера планирует использовать для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент нижнего белья на продажу. На данный момент чистая прибыль Веры составляет около 3 000 гривен, но Вера не хотела бы останавливаться на достигнутом и планирует в будущем еще открыть киоск в собственном дворе, где она смогла бы продавать продукты питания.

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Vera is married and has a grown daughter.  She is a market entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov.  Vera works at the local Central market, selling underpants, socks, tank tops and etc.  Vera decided to start this business 15 years ago and, since then, has been selling this merchandise every day at the market.  Thanks to her business, Vera was able to help her daughter to start her own business too, and she now sells at the local market.  Vera plans to use the 7,000 hryvnia loan to expand the assortment of undergarments for sale.  Her current net profit is about 3,000 hryvnia, but Vera does not want to stop with what she has achieved and in the future plans to open another kiosk in her own yard, where she could sell food products.

loans.use: to expand assortment of undergarments for sale

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Ana Maria provides karaoke services for which customers pay 5 pesos per song. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity of the service.

Ana Maria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ana Maria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for her karaoke service.

loans.name: Gbenondou Agla Group

texts.fr: GBENONDOU AGLA est un groupement constitué de vingt cinq personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Valérie. La plupart des membres du groupement résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Valérie est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Damien. Le couple a  deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Valérie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il  y a huit ans environs,  Valérie  vend des oignons et du charbon de bois à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer sans grande difficulté les charges de ses enfants. Valérie achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Valérie et aux autres membres du  groupe GBENONDOU AGLA, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
GBENONDOU AGLA is a group made up of 25 people, whose representative is named Valérie (with hand raised in the photo).  Most members of the group live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  With the goal of increasing their operating capital, the group is requesting its first loan through ALIDé.

Valérie is 33 years old and married to a mechanic named Damien.  The couple has two children, both in school and under their care.  Valérie did not attend school.  For the last eight years or so, she has been selling onions and charcoal out of her home; this helps her pay her children's expenses without much difficulty.  Valérie buys her products in a city in Benin.  This first loan will allow her and the other members of the GBENONDOU AGLA group to increase their business activities and grow their customer base and income.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and onion.

loans.name: Unisa

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Unisa. He is married to a trader and has four children ages 10, 7, 5 and 2. Three of them are school-going children. In 2006, Unisa established his bread business. He began his business because when his father died, he did not have a sponsor to see him through higher education, so he started doing petty trading. 

In 1994, he joined his landlord who owns a bakery for baking bread. Gradually he improved until 2006, when he started his own business. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to purchase flour, sugar and yeast.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL.

In the future, Unisa plans to build a house and get a modern bakery. This business helps him a lot as he is able to solve his domestic problems and improve his business. Unisa wants his children to have a good education. The rise in the cost of materials - including flour and sugar and manual labor - are his major business challenges. 

He serves retailers and consumers in the outskirts and in the city center. He has four laborers who do the mixing of the flour. He buys his raw materials in Makeni and sometimes in Freetown. He usually buys his materials twice a month through his supplier's delivery van. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and yeast for his bakery.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica, de 37 años es una mujer empeñosa. Vive en compañía de Celestino, sui esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Deysi, Nelson y Kenyi, a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Acocra. Junto a su esposo comparten los gastos del hogar. Pues todos los días se dirigen a sus cultivos de papa de toda variedad, los cuales siembran en terrenos arrendados. Cuenta que entre las variedades de papa están “yungay, muruhuallyo, peruanita” y demás depende al precio de temporada en el mercado. Por otra parte, tienen 8 ovejas y 7 vacas, que le brindan un ingreso adicional a sus ganancias, pues las enseba para luego venderlas a un mayor precio. Además comparte la leche que produce para el alimento de sus hijos. Ahora ellos desean ahorrar lo necesario para los estudios de sus hijos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Jooc sonjolla” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. De recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y 6 kilos de semilla de maíz para sembrar en sus 2 hectáreas de terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Verónica is 37 years old and is a tenacious woman. She lives with Celestino, her husband of 17 years. Together they have 3 children named Deysi, Nelson and Kenyi, and they care for them in their own home located in the small village of Acocra. She and her husband share the household expenses.

Every day they manage the many-varied potato crops which they planted on leased land. Among the variety of potatoes are yungay [a yellowish potato] muruhuallyo, and peruanita [bi-color skin] and others. The pricing depends on the season at the market place. In addition, they have 8 sheep and 7 cows which gives them additional profit towards income, greasing them for later resale at a higher price. 

She also shares the milk from the cows with the children. Now they want to save what is needed to pay for the education of their children. 

She belongs to the solidarity group called Jooc Sonjolla and this is the first loan with MFP, and she is hoping for their assistance in order to carry out her plans. In return she promises to make her payments on time, as with loans in the past. 

She likes being a part of the community bank because all the members are trustworthy and very close-knit. When she receives the loan she will use the money to buy natural fertilizers and 6 kilos of corn seed to plan in her 2 hectares of farmland.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and 6 kilos of corn seed

loans.name: Marcilina

texts.en:
Marcilina is married with four children. Marcilina is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Marcilina is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 Philippines pesos (PHP) to  purchase additional pigs to raise. 

Marcilina has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Marcilina hopes to improve their residential house.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Setou

texts.fr:
Mme SETOU  est mariée  et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé  a 10ans et  le moins âgé a 08ans. Ils vont tous  à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend de pagnes bazins depuis 30ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au Mali. Ses clients sont  les femmes et hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  10 complet de pagnes bazins et 30 complet de pagnes hytarget.

 Mme épargne  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir un magasin  et  assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mme SETOU  is married and the mother of 2 children. The elder is 10 and the younger 8 years old. They both go to school. She has 4 dependents. She has been selling damask 'pagnes' for 30 years. She buys her stock in Mali. Her customers are both men and women. She wants to buy 10 outfits made of damask and 30 outfits made of Hytarget traditional cloth. She retains her profits as savings. Her ambition is to open a shop and to assure her childrens' education.

loans.use: to buy 10 outfits made of damask and 30 outfits made of Hytarget traditional cloth.

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Xai-Xai, Provincia de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos que frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

É negociante ha mais de 4 anos e vende produtos diversos onde tem um rendimento de cerca de 20.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo, amendoim, arroz, peixe, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 12.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.   
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer o seu negocio , para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Xai-Xai, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. She is married and has five children who attend school. She completed 4th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports two nephews who live with her.
She has been a businesswoman for over four years. She sells various products and earns an income of about 20.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 16.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods such as olive oil, peanuts, rice, fish, etc. The first loan was for 12.000mt, for the same purpose.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to expand her business and for that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (olive oil, peanuts, rice, fish, etc.).

loans.name: Lisbed Marinze

texts.es: A sus 25 años, la señora Lisbed se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios en un pequeño local ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Medellín, el cual le ha permitido generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de ella y de su hija de 4 años a quien su padre abandonó cuando era tan solo una bebé, por esta razón, la señora Lisbed es padre y madre al mismo tiempo. Debido a la ola invernal, las ventas aun disminuido considerablemente, por lo que la señora Lisbed desea comprar surtido de licor y cerveza con el ánimo de diversificar su negocio y tratar de recuperar sus ventas y mejorar los ingresos. El sueño de la señora Lisbed es ver crecer a su hija y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lisbed, age 25, sells food products in a small place located in the center of the city of Medellín.  This has allowed her to generate the needed income to support herself and her four year old daughter.  Her daughter’s father abandoned her when she was only a baby.  This is the reason the Lisbed is both father and mother at the same time.

Due to the harsh winter, sales have diminished considerably.  That is why Lisbed wishes to buy liquor and beer for her stock. Her thought is to diversify her business, to try to recuperate her sales, and to improve her income.  

Lisbed’s dream is to see her daughter grow and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of liquor and beer.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity  is 57 years old, involved in agriculture. She has been in rice farming business for over ten years. Within these years, she still enthusiast to work because of poor living that they encounter. She wants to improve their living situation into better. Through their farming business, she knows that she will achieve her dream just provide the needed supplies of her business. In this connection, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 pesos to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes that these supplies would provide better crops in order to feel then a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in tailoring as her main source of income, and with the proceeds, she has been able to earn a living and pay school fees for her children. Apart from that, she also sells second hand clothes to earn extra income. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big known boutique, though she is challenged by inflation and inconsistency in customer turn up.

Annah intends to use the loan to buy more second hand clothes for sell during the festive season.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes for sell during the festive season.

loans.name: Ervin

texts.en: Ervin L. is 27 years old and has three children. He owns a small location where he sells ceviche, a common Ecuadorian dish made with seafood, lime, onions and tomatoes. He is near a very popular market that creates high traffic around his area and helps him sell. He has an assistant who helps him along with the mother of his children. He is in need of a loan in order to buy more seafood so that he can meet the increasing demand he is experiencing. He is also eager to add chairs and tables for his clients in order to create a more inviting dining environment.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for seafood restaurant

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa Dobinada is 35 years old and spends much of her time taking care of her children (three boys and one girl) and all the animals which make up her family farm. Her husband works long days at the village Mayor’s Office and has no time to take care of the animals. Larisa lives on the edge of town and the closest well is downhill from her property, which makes it extremely difficult to bring water for her family and her livestock. Behind her house are her animals and their pens - pigs and piglets, 2 cows for milk production, countless chickens and 2 sheep. All these animals require a tremendous amount of water per day and bringing that water up the hill occupies a good portion of Larisa’s day. In order to be better able to sustain her livestock and possibly increase the number of animals she keeps, Larisa would like a loan to obtain the materials necessary for construction of a well on her property. She knows it will help her animals to have a steadier supply of fresh water and she would also like to purchase some animal feed. Her goal is to have a more manageable homestead with healthy and happy animals!

loans.use: Construction of a well and purchase of animal feed

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Esther is a resident of this town and sells plastic and metal containers from house to house. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $750.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nadjmiya

texts.en: Nadjmiya A. has been in retail for the past 12 years. She started her business with $50. She has 5 children that she has to feed and support. She borrowed from her friends and started by retailing two to three types of fabrics. In 2006 she became a client of Microinvest. She always pays off her loans on time. At this time she needs $475 to expand her stock of fabrics for the new season in order to increase her revenue.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the upcoming season

loans.name: Yevgeniy

texts.en:
Yevgeniy is married and has two daughters. He lives in Uzhgorod in the far western corner of Ukraine. Yevgeniy organizes international tours of an Uzhgorod teen dance group called “Dance Corporation of Friends”. This type of business is unique for Uzhgorod. Yevgeniy is known as a talented show-business producer. He has had much experience working with different dance groups and bands over the last 20 years and has gained a good reputation. Yevgeniy is a very determined, hard-working and energetic entrepreneur. His monthly income is about $600.

The business Yevgeniy is involved in is very interesting. It not only allows him to earn a living, but it also produces a positive social impact on the community. Teenagers in his group enjoy what they are doing as they use their talents and gifts in the dance shows. Yevgeniy would like to use this loan to help his dance group go on a successful tour and offer an entertaining show to all those who are interested in Ukrainian folk and ethnic performances.

loans.use: Organize dance tour

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es un señor de 53 años de edad, su familia está conformada por 4 hijos de 22, 18, 12 y 9 años de edad respectivamente. Los dos hijos mayores actualmente están trabajando al igual que su padre con moto-taxis y los dos menores siguen estudiando en el colegio. Esta familia cuenta con una casa propia y cinco motos, de las cuales tres las utilizan Jose y sus hijos para trabajar y las otras dos las rentan diariamente. Jose aparte de trabajar como moto-taxista durante la semana, se desempeña como albañil los fines de semana, en ambos rubros tiene bastante experiencia ya que trabaja con esto algo más de 20 años. Existe competencia en el transporte de pasajeros (moto-taxi) pero también hay mucha demanda sobre todo en las rutas locales de Montero. Por otra parte algo que ayuda bastante a Jose es su afiliación a una asociación de moto-taxis porque cuenta con paradas y clientela fija, también el ingreso extra que le genera su trabajo como albañil permiten aportar a la economía de la familia. La presente solicitud es para construcción, esta es su tercera solicitud con un excelente cumpimiento de los pagos. Las anteriores solicitudes sirvieron para la adquisición de las motos con las que trabaja ahora.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Jose is 53 years old, and his family includes four children that are 22,18, 12, and 19 years old, respectively. His two oldest children currently work along with their father with moto-taxis and the two younger children are still in school. This family has a home and five motos, three of which are used by Jose and his sons to work and the other two are rented out daily. While Jose works as a moto-taxi driver during the week, he works as a carpernter on the weekends, and in both roles he has sufficient experience and has worked like this for more than 20 years. There is a lot of business for transporting passengers by moto-taxi, but there is also large demand along the local highways. Jose's business is supported by stopping to pick up clients and also a fixed clientele. The extra income he earns as a carpenter allows him to take care of the family's finances. This current loan is for construction, and this is his third loan with an excellent history. His previous loans allowed him to purchase his motorcycles he works with now.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Plamen

texts.en: Plamen B. has worked as a radio and electronic technician in a company in the town of Montana but after the company failed he registered himself as a private agricultural producer. Six years ago he started his farming business. His wife works as a seller in the village store. They have two sons that live independently. Plamen breeds 3 cows and some calves. Now he needs some fodder for the winter. The loan request is for $750.

loans.use: To buy  fodder for his animals for the winter

loans.name: Luchando Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
The committee “Fighting for Progress” was born when a member of another committee decided to form her own group.

The participants work in different activities, like selling fruits, clothes, jewelry, fast food, ice cream; others have stores where they sell groceries like sugar, rice, flour, soft drinks, juices, bread, etc.
