Daisy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Daisy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris Elizabeth N. R., de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive junto a sus padres, un hermano y 4 hijos: Norma, Gabriela, Berenice y Francisco, quienes dependen económicamente de Doris. Ella se dedica desde hace mas de 15 años a la elaboración de tortillas, localizada sobre una de las principales vías de la capital de El Salvador, conocida como Alameda Juan Pablo Segundo, las hace, tanto al mediodía  como también por las tardes. Lo que garantiza atender a más personas y de esta forma contar con más ventas, lo que es de mucha importancia para ella, debido a que es su única fuente de ingresos, como madre soltera. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para poder comprar: maíz y cal para mejorar sus ventas significativamente. Maíz al por mayor, ya que ya empieza a subir de precios y La Cal, que es un componente usado para cocinar el maíz, se coloca al fuego el maíz junto a la Cal; la proporción que se usa dependerá de si el maíz se quiere para masa que usará en las tortillas o para deliciosos tamales típicos. Realmente gracias a la Cal se logra desprender en su cocción la cascara que trae el grano de maíz, lo limpia. Sin el uso de la Cal, Doris obtendría tortillas con mucha granulación producto de no limpiarlo bien, y sus ventas se verían seriamente disminuidas. 
Uno de los deseos mas grandes de Doris es hacer crecer su negocio y esta segura que con este crédito se impulsará hacia dicho objetivo para que su familia pueda vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Doris Elizabeth N. R. is 43 years old and lives in the state of San Salvador, with her parents, brother and four children: Norma, Gabreila, Berenice and Francisco, who are economically dependent on Doris. For more than 15 years she has made tortillas, in an area located above one of the principal streets in the capital of El Salvador, known as Alameda Juan Pablo Segundo. She makes the tortillas both at noon and in the afternoon, which guarantees a lot of customers and high sales. This is very important to her, as it is her only form of income since she is a single mother. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to purchase maize (corn) and lime to significantly improve her sales.  

Maize and lime prices have recently risen. Lime, an ingredient that is used to cook the maize, is put into the fire along with the maize. The proportion that is used depends on if the maize is being used for tortillas or for delicious traditional tamales.  Thanks to the lime, the maize sheds its shell, and is cleaned. Without the use of lime, Doris would have very grainy tortillas, and her sales would be greatly diminished. 

One of Doris's biggest hopes is to help her business to grow and she is sure that with this loan she will be able to make this happen so that her family can live better.

loans.use: to buy maize (corn) and lime

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: pig fattening, a general store and farming. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Rosalia is borrowing PHP 22,000 so that she can purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosalia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elsa; la socia tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de picantería (lugar donde venden chicha de jora ( a base de maíz) también venden cerveza para los clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante, a la vez la socia brinda el servicio de llamadas telefónicas nacionales y locales ella realiza este negocio por el centro de la ciudad ,siendo estas dos actividades que realiza para sacar a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más cerveza y así tener más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "The Leaders". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Elsa. She is 34 years old, married, and she has 1 child. She alternates her daily activities with her pub business (location where chicha de jora is sold, a corn based drink).  She also sells beer to those clients who request it. She is someone who is very happy and who is very eager to succeed. She also provides public telephone services for national calls and local calls. She has her business in the downtown area of the city. She has these two businesses in order to support her family.

She requests a loan to purchase beer and so to have enough products for her business.

She is happy to have the loan and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to purchase beer in order to supply her business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 31 years old and is married. He owns a motorcycle transportation business. This business is open daily from 6am until 10pm. His business is well-organized.
Daniel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy essential materials for his motorcycle. With the profit, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To buy essential material for his motorcycle business

loans.name: C5525 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Alphonse is 56 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 3 and 21 years. Alphonse is the leader of this group, called "Twitezimbere" in the local language, which means in English "let us develop." The group is well known in the business of selling meat. Alphonse`s business is well organized. His business hours are from 7 am until 7 pm every weekday, and he has five years of experience.

Alphonse and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of meat to sell. They really hope that, once this loan is given to them, they will be able to save for the future. If successful, they hope to earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep expanding their businesses until they become financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of meat to sell.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En esta comunidad de Arin conocimos a la señora Aurelia de 36 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Calca, que pertenece al departamento del Cusco. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Aurelia tiene  una pequeña picantería donde elabora la rica chicha de jora. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a elaborar la chicha de jora y ahora ella tiene su propia tienda en las que trabaja junto con su pareja, que con mucho esmero se dedican al trabajo. Ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas.  

El crédito que ha solicitado Aurelia es de 1000 nuevos soles a Asociación Arariwa, será destinado para comprar más maíz de jora y otra parte empleará para comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y otras cosas más.

Aurelia es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca, in Cusco department, there is a place known as Arin community.  It is known for its beautiful landscape, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Here in Arin community we meet 36 year-old Aurelia who has a partner and two children.  She lives with her partner in her own home which has water and electricity and is located in Calca province, in Cusco department.  The main business activities in this area are farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Aurelia has a small restaurant where she makes delicious 'chicha de jora' (a corn-based drink).  Her parents taught her to make chicha de jora at a young age and now she has her own sales location where she works with her partner.  They carry out their work with a lot of care.  Aurelia also raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens.

Aurelia has requested a loan from Asociación Arariwa for 1,000 Peruvian soles.  She will use part of her money to buy more jora corn and the other part to buy animals such as guinea pigs and other products.  Aurelia is a hard-working woman who has always known how to get ahead in order to improve herself and get she wants in life.

loans.use: to buy animals such as guinea pigs and other products

loans.name: Denis De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Denis pequeño comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración de persianas de vidrio y metal, venta de ropa, con más de cinco años, trabajando en su negocio propio. Desde joven aprendió el oficio, lo que trabajaba en una fábrica. Atreves de ahorro y préstamo logra comprar herramientas para comenzar hacer su trabajo propio.
Así como mejora a su vivienda, en donde se le ha hecho posible mediantes estos financiamiento.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: aluminio, vidrio, y otros materiales para hacer ventana y seguir cumpliendo con su demanda,  así como sus compromisos con la familia, y otros gastos.
texts.en:
Denis, a small businessman, makes window blinds from glass and metal, and he sells clothing. He has been working in his own business for more than five years. He learned this trade as a youth, when he worked in a factory. Through his savings and a loan he managed to buy tools to begin doing his own work.

In addition, he is improving his house, which has been made possible through these loans.

With this new loan he will buy aluminum, glass, and other materials to make windows and continue filling his orders. He will also fulfull his obligations to his family and pay for other expenses.

loans.use: to buy glass and aluminum to continue filling his orders for window blinds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of rice

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles sells rubber stamps, signs and prints to all types of customers in his community. He has been running this business for 3 years. Charles intends to use his loan to add more stock to his business. 

Charles hopes to be the leading rubber stamp company in the market. He wants to grow his company and be able to employ people. Charles describes himself as focused and visionary.

loans.use: add more rubber stamps and signs for his business

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam, 41 years old, is married and has 2 sons. He supports his family through the income he earns from making screws. His wife is a worker in a garment factory. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nam intends to take a loan to buy iron pieces, an oven and cutting equipment to make screws to sell. The addiitonal material and equipment will enable him to increase his production of screws. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy iron pieces, oven and cutting equipment to make screws

loans.name: Plinh

texts.en: Plinh is the head of his family, so it is a big responsibility on him to find income to support his family. At present, he is a construction worker in Siem Reap Province. All the people there know that he is very talented and has good creative ideas. He can earn about $4 per day. If we talk about his wife, she isn't a lazy woman. She is a farmer and also a housekeeper. She also earns perhaps $1.50 per day. They would like to borrow $500 to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en: Mrs. Loeung, age 32, is a farmer and is married to Ros, age 36, who is a construction worker. Currently, they have 7 children and all of them are single. Her base income is from planting rice and she usually generates $2.50 each day. Mrs. Loeung is concerned that her land for planting rice is not enough, so she would like to request a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more land. She says that this loan is very useful for her family. She is thankful for your help. Mrs. Loeung is shown with her child.

loans.use: to purchase more land

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 23 years old and single. He has been running a salon for the past six months with a monthly income of KES 5,000 which he uses to pay for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Victor will use the loan to buy a blow dryer, shaving machine and shampoo. 

With the anticipated profit he will expand his business and hire some workers. His hopes and dreams are to have a family and open salon branches in different sites.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer, shaving machine and shampoo.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 45 years old and married. He is from the village Rieti, Gori District, East Georgia. Mamuka lives with his big family, his wife Ketevan, his 11-year-old son, 10-year-old daughter, his retired 70-year-old mother, and his 39-year-old sister. His children go to school. 

Mamuka is the only income provider in the family. He farms the family-owned 1.3 hectare plot of land and grows potatoes and peaches which he sells locally to greengrocers. The family also cultivates a cherry garden with 100 cherry trees. Mamuka sells the harvested fruit locally to retailers during the season. 

Mamuka is requesting a loan to expand the family farming business and purchase onion, beet, and carrot seeds. He plans to plant these vegetables and sell his harvest locally. The income of the family will increase and he will be able to provide better care for his children and improve the family’s overall living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase onion, beet, and carrot seeds

loans.name: Miralam

texts.en:
Miralam is 30 and sells handmade gravestones. This is quite a profitable business and Miralam makes about $350 USD per month. He is following in his family business as his father taught him the best practice and skills. 
Now Miralam has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to purchase special stone for making gravestones and working tools. Miralam also breeds cattle, but his primary financial income comes from selling gravestones.

loans.use: to purchase working tools and special stone for making gravestones.

loans.name: Pouaneoe

texts.fr:
Pouaneoe est une femme  âgé(e) de 34ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 02 enfants en charge.
Pouaneoe travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2005. Elle sert ses clients dans un quartier de la place après achat au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Pouaneoe a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 05 bidons d’huile, 02 sacs de riz, 05 cartons de tomates, 03 cartons de lait et 03 sacs de sucre.
texts.en:
Pouaneoe is a woman of 34. She is married to a retailer and raising two children. 

Pouaneoe has been working selling foodstuffs since 2005. She serves customers in a local neighborhood after buying her supplies at the Grand Marché of  Lomé.

Pouaneoe requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy five jerrycans of oil, two sacks of rice, five cartons of tomatoes, three cartons of milk, and three sacks of sugar.

loans.use: to buy grocery items (rice, sugar, tomatoes, milk) for resale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 41 years old and married to Nelson.  Together they have two children who both attend school. Pauline operates a dressmaking shop. She has been in this business for the last ten years and earns an income of KES 15,000 per month.

Pauline has a good credit history with Kiva partner KADET.  She is applying for a second loan of KES 80,000 that she plans to use to purchase pieces of cloth to make more dresses.  Her efforts will allow her to offer more variety for her clients. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

Pauline hopes to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase pieces of cloth to make more dresses for sale.

loans.name: Julio Williams

texts.es:
Julio de 31 años, es un hombre soltero que siempre quiere salir adelante con la ayuda de Dios. Trabaja en una empresa de alimentos Ecuatorianos (lácteos). 

Su dificultad es la delincuencia ya que al salir de su casa es muy inseguro. Le afecta por las noches al salir de su trabajo ya que la zona donde vive en insegura. El prestamo lo quiere utilizar para construir mejor su casa comprando Cemento, arena, bloques. Su sueño es arreglar su vivienda ya que esta en mal estado.
texts.en:
Julio, 31, is a single man who, with God's help, has always been able to get ahead.  He is a salaried employee who is requesting a loan to carry out home improvements.

He works in an Ecuadorean food company (dairy products).  He has problems with the delinquency that affects him at night when he gets off work.  The loan will be used to buy cement, sand and blocks to improve his house.

His dream is to fix up his house because of it's current state of disrepair.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
Firuz, 26, is a very enthusiastic man. He is a farmer. Since his marriage, he has demonstrated that in spite of his youth, he can support his family with hard work and dedication. Because of this, he is always in the fields, growing potatoes, onions, carrots and pomegranates. 

Firuz leaves early in the morning to water the fields, then fertilizes and fumigates the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables Firuz to purchase goods for his home. His monthly income is 140 AZN. 

Firuz is motivated by his desire to offer his family a better quality of life. He would like to invest in the purchase of supplies to protect his crops, so as to have a better harvest and sell his crops according to the customers' request. For this purpose he applied for 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to protect his crops.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose owns a boutique and cosmetics shop. She lives in the town of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married, and has one child in class one. Her business has been in operation for four years. She also sells clothes, and has rental houses and a bookshop.
 
Rose was invited to Milango by her friends and has repaid other previous loans at Milango. Rose is applying for a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase new stock of clothes and cosmetics.
 
Her future aspiration is to add two to three more boutiques. She has been able to meet the school fee requirement from the sales and she believes the additional income will enable her make more savings for her child’s future education.

loans.use: To purchase new stock of clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 42 years old and lives in Ponong, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married with six children.

Analyn sells food and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase assorted ingredients for food vending. Analyn is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She would like to expand her business and she is hoping that her children will be able to finish studying.

loans.use: to purchase assorted ingredients for food vending.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (uno de 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.		

Henry es un hombre soltero de 27 años que se dedica a trabajar para poder ganar dinero y ayudar a su familia. Él es un hombre trabajador, luchador y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su trabajo básicamente consiste en transportar a personas desde la ciudad de Ica hasta Santiago de Creocorgos.						
Henry empezó su negocio en el año 2009 en el área de transporte. Trabaja diariamente y recibe un promedio de S/. 296 de ganancia en una semana. Este es el primer préstamo de Henry y esta entusiasmado por la ayuda que se le brindará. Con el préstamo de S/.2, 500 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Henry puede comprar una bomba de inyección para su camioneta y también le servirá para poder pagar los trámites que son necesarios para sus familiares. Su crédito permite a Henry pensar en el futuro y sueña con poder tener una empresa de transporte a la cual se dedicaría sólo a administrar, también desea tener su propia familia.
texts.en:
Henry lives and works in Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, about four hours south of Lima, the capital of the country. It is acclaimed by the Peruvians as “La Tierra del Sol” [The Land of the Sun]. It is known in Perú for frequent earthquakes (8.0 in 2007 and 6.9 in 2011), grape, asparagus and olive production and above all perhaps, as the source of the traditional Peruvian drink, Pisco. It is in this hot, dry climate that the client’s home and business are located.

Henry is a 27 year old single man who works to earn money and help his family. He is a hardworking, determined man with a great desire to get ahead. His work basically consists of providing transport for people from the city of Ica to Santiago de Creocorgos.

Henry started his business in 2009 in the transport industry. He works every day and earns an average of S/.296 per week. This is Henry’s first loan and he is excited by the support that is being provided to him. With the loan of S/.2,500 that he will receive thanks to KIVA, Henry can buy an injection pump for his vehicle and it will also allow him to pay for his family’s necessities. Henry’s loan will allow him to think about the future. He dreams of having a transport business which he would solely run. He also wants to have his own family.

loans.use: to buy an injection pump for his vehicle.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel  tiene 25 años es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con la mamá . Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Miguel Ángel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz . Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 25 years old, single, and has one child who lives with the child's mother.  Miguel Ángel lives in the precinct of Aguas Frías de Mocache, which is part of the administrative division of Mocache.  

The organization El Progreso is located in the precinct of Aguas Frías de Mocache, which is part of the administrative division of Mocache.  This organization works in short term agricultural labor and plants corn and rice.

Miguel Ángel works planting corn and rice.  He buys his products in Mocache and sells them in the market of Mocache.

He is asking for credit in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and organic compounds for his fields.  The loan will help him increase his income for family consumption and to invest in planting.  His dream is to buy his own land.

In his free time he very much enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and organic compounds for his fields.

loans.name: Tham's Group

texts.en:
Ms Tham is 38 years old with one child. She is living in Dong Tien village.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and raising chickens and pigs for meat. Her business started many years ago. Participating in Seda’ credit program since 2010, she mostly used loans for her raising her chickens and pigs. She wants to have a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to buy feed for her poultry
  
 Ms Cat is 57 years old. She is a farmer and she is in need of a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 30 years old, married, and a responsible mother of five children. She has been growing rice for over 13 years. Her harvested crops are mostly sells them at the market and using the income to support her family’s needs such as buying  commodities, foods and paying for school fees of her five children.


She wants to prepare the land for a new crop, and is requesting a loan of  15,000 pesos for buying of seeds, fertilizers, fuel and lubricant for tractor, and seedlings. She is looking forward through these inputs her farming business would endow with abundant result.

loans.use: for buying of seeds, fertilizers, fuel and lubricant for tractor, and seedlings

loans.name: Bacary

texts.fr: Bacary âgé de 21 ans habite au Sénégal ,il est célibataire .Il est dans le métier de menuiserie depuis l'age de 10 ans avec son père jusqu'en 2011 l'année que son papa était décédé.Bacary a héritier le métier de son papa,il est devenu le responsable d'un grand atelier de menuiserie.Avec son métier de menuisier,il supporte toutes charge de la famille , les factures d'électricité de l'atelier et de la maison .Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000f pour acheter du bois pour la fabrication des meubles .Bacary a comme projet future achat d'un petit camion pour son travail.

loans.use: ACHAT DE BOIS

loans.name: Ma. Melida

texts.es: Doña Melida se encuentra muy feliz por el apoyo brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los inversionistas en KIVA, ya que gracias a su primer financiamiento solicitado ella pudo cumplir su meta de fortalecer la tierra, comprar semilla de maíz certificada y sembrar asistiendo esta con la compra de abono, fertilizantes, entre otros que ayudaron a ser parte de un gran desarrollo para poder sacar una excelente cosecha. Ella pudo asistir su propiedad de forma completa y muy satisfactoria obteniendo una excelente ganancia al momento de vender la producción con lo que pago su crédito y parte de las ganancias re invertirlas. Hoy solicita un segundo crédito con el fin de preparar la tierra para la nueva época ya que adquirió un pequeño predio en el cual sembrara nueva semilla de maíz, comprara abonos, fertilizantes entre otros por lo cual ella espera que se le sea nuevamente apoyada para poder seguir cultivando y fortaleciendo su negocio.

loans.use: Para compra de semilla de maíz certificada, abonos, fertilizantes para asistir sus cultivos de maiz

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 30 year old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in Coffee buying and cleaning for sale but also carries out crop farming in order to reduce on food expenses. He desires to expand on his business and become rich in a near future but he is challenged by inadequate capital and unfavorable price changes.

He is requesting for a loan to buy more coffee for processing and selling.

loans.use: to buy more coffee for processing and selling.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a good member of Kahumbu Kwirera Mothers and she has been a member since the group started in January 2005. She is married with three children who are still in primary school.

She sells milk and maize to clients in Kirigo tranding centre. The reason why she started selling maize is that; it is the staple food for the Kenyans and therefore at any time you are assured of making a sale. She borrowed a loan of USD.300 from the group and repaid it and it has pushed her to selling over 100 kgs in two days.

loans.use: She wants to buy another dairy cow to increase milk supply which will automatically increase her income.

loans.name: Zoia

texts.en: Zoia G. is 46 years old. She is a lonely mother of two sons and she is taking care of her family and her business alone. Zoia has her business since 2003. Then she rents a hall in the city center and makes it a tailoring workshop. At the beginning she works only for private customers but later she accepts offers by some new built hotels in Sofia and the region. She mainly produces curtains, slip covers, household linen. In March 2006 Zoia has a critic moment in her business. She starts business cooperation with a man who finally cheats her and steels most of her machines but she manages to go through it and now works alone again. Now Zoia has two workshops and has three employees. She needs this $ 1200 loan to buy two more sewing machines to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy two more sewing machines

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna G. supports herself entirely from her little dishware sales business, which she has operated for the last fifteen years. Divorced with one grown son, she lives by herself and works hard to earn enough money to meet her needs. Her monthly income is typically around $300 to $600 dollars.

Anna is new to the idea of using credit to build her business. She has taken one loan from Nadiya Ukraine thus far and has proven to be a very responsible client, making each of her payments on time. The loan she received has had a big impact on her business, and she is excited to be able to use additional funding to increase her sales even further. She has requested a loan for $750 that will enable her to purchase more of the quality crystal and porcelain dishware that she offers. This available capital will give Anna the resources and flexibility to buy inventory in greater volume, allowing her to have more time and energy to focus on expanding her business.

Ганна заробляє на життя продажем посуду, цим бізнесом займається на протязі останніх 15 років. Вона – розлучена, в неї є дорослий син. Ганна живе одна, вона наполегливо працює, щоб забезпечити потреби своєї родини. Її щомісячний дохід складає приблизно 300 - 600 доларів. Ганна лише нещодавно почала користуватися кредитними послугами. Вона отримала одну позику від „Надії України”, але кожну виплату робила вчасно. Фінансова підтримка значно вплинула на розвиток її бізнесу. Ганна сподівається і в майбутньому отримати додаткову фінансову допомогу, яка сприятиме росту обсягів продажу. Вона просить про позику в 750 доларів для того, щоб придбати кришталевий та порцеляновий посуд для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Додаткові кошти забезпечать Ганні можливість придбати більше товару та зосередитися на подальшому розвитку її бізнесу.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Orif

texts.ru:
Orif S. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 3 years. He has been in business for no less than 8 years. He personally acquires and delivers the shoes from his suppliers. He began his business by selling 4-5 shoe styles. By now, Orif S. tripled the assortment of the shoes that he sells. He is married and has 2 school-age children. Orif S. asks for $500 loan to increase the assortment of the goods sold. He plans to use the profits to buy an apartment for his family. Today, Orif S.’s entire family lives in a studio apartment. With the children growing up, the studio is no longer adequate for his family.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипов Ориф является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3-х лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 8 лет. За товаром ездит сам. Начинал свой бизнес с продажи 4-5 видов обуви. На сегодняшний день его ассортимент увеличился втрое. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Дети учатся в школе. Ему необходимо 500$, для увеличения ассортимента товара, а полученную прибыль потратить на закупку квартиры. Он с семьей живет в однокомнатной квартире, так как его дети взрослеют, им необходимо купить квартиру.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
María Francisca Monzón J. is 49 years old, and a fighter. Born in Cajabamba, a province in the department of Cajamarca, she left her community when she married at the age of 14 in search of a better life for herself and her family. She moved to Chimbote for a short time, but soon decided to relocate to the Otuzco Province in the department of "La Libertad" where she still lives to this day.

11 years ago, Maria's husband abandoned her, leaving her in charge of 5 children, including a deaf child. When her husband left, he took with him all of the merchandise the two of them had built up over the years for the business they had together (selling wool sweaters, ponchos, and artesian clothing). Maria was devastated, and so, in order to meet the needs of her children she sold her sewing machines and other goods she owned. A friend of hers from the same community heard about Maria's situation and invited her to participate in the community bank, "Mujeres del Olivo," where Maria used a loan of 300 Peruvian soles to re- purchase goods and start up her businesses once again.

Today, Maria doesn't only sell wool products. With the solicited loan of $125, Maria will purchase fruits and vegetables to expand her business and sell in Otuzco on Sundays, and in other neighboring communities on Saturdays and Mondays to augment her income.

Maria Francisca is proud to have been able to move forward with her children. She plans on continuing to work at her business with the same energy that she had 11 years ago so that one day she will be able to buy a house for her family to live in.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

María Francisca Monzón J., es una mujer luchadora de 49 años. Nació en Cajabamba, una provincia del departamento de Cajamarca, emigró de su pueblo cuando se casó a la edad de 14 años en busca de una mejor vida para ella y su familia; luego de vivir en Chimbote por un corto tiempo decidió radicar en la Provincia de Otuzco Departamento de La Libertad – Perú donde vive actualmente. Hace 11 años su esposo la abandonó quedándose a cargo de 5 niños, incluyendo a un niño sordomudo, el esposo se fue llevando toda la mercadería del negocio que tenían juntos (venta de lanas y ponchos y polleras tejidos en telares artesanales), en ese momento desesperada por satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos vendió sus telares y otros bienes que poseía. Una amiga de su barrio conocedora de su situación la invitó a participar del Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Olivo” y con el primer préstamo que recibió compró mercadería y reinició su negocio (S/ 300.00 soles) Actualmente no solo vende lanas, con los S/. 400.00 soles (US$ 125.00) que recibió amplió su negocio, ahora vende también frutas y verduras, los domingos vende en Otuzco y los sábados y lunes sale a vender en ferias de otros pueblos cercanos (Monchacap y Motil). María Francisca se siente orgullosa por haber sacado adelante a sus hijos. Sigue trabajando en su negocio con la misma energía con la que empezó hace once años porque sueña con comprarse su casa.

loans.use: To grow her business through the purchase of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Juny

texts.es:
Juny has her business located in the Central Market, in space #37, in the center of the city of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martín. She is a part of the Community Bank “Mujeres Virtuosas”. She began her business two years ago, with a small amount of capital, selling only women’s and men’s underwear from a small wooden table. She now sells a variety of undergarments, polo shirts, baseball caps, and sandals and she is always looking for new inventory for the business. She also now has a vitrine where she exhibits her products.

With a credit of S/.1000.00 (approx. $333.00) she recently received from Manuela Ramos, to be paid back in 4 payments, she will buy more clothing for women, men, and children at wholesale prices. She will also buy 100 sandals in a variety of colors and sizes, and bras and underwear for women, also at wholesale price.

Juny is 23 years old and she has always liked to work. She first worked as an employee in a store much like the one she now owns, where she learned how to run that type of business. With her savings she was able to start her own small business. She feels that she is prospering. She is very happy and in the future she would like to convert her small market stall into a general goods store. She is getting ahead, along with her husband and her 4 year-old son. The good service she provides to her clients and her friends helps to improve sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Juny tiene su negocio ubicado en el Mercado central, en el puesto Nº 37, ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Tarapoto, provincia y región San Martín, pertenece al Banco Comunal "Mujeres Virtuosas". Inició su negocio hace dos años, con un pequeño capital, vendiendo sólo ropa interior de damas y caballeros, en una repisa de madera. Actualmente vende ropa interior variada, polos, gorros y sandalias y cada vez está surtiendo mas el negocio, ya tiene vitrina de vidrio donde exhibe su producto. Con el crédito recientemente recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,000.00 (US$ 333 aprox.) pagadero en 4 cuotas, comprará más ropa de vestir para damas, caballeros y niñospor docenas y que están de moda, un ciento sandalias, en variedad de colores y tallas, como también brasier's y trusas interiores para damas, todo esto por docenas. La señora Juny es joven, tiene 23 años y siempre le ha gustado trabajar, primero trabajó como empleada en una tienda como la que ahora tiene, donde aprendió el manejo del mismo y con sus ahorros pudo poner su propio negocio. Siente que está prosperando, está muy contenta y en el futuro desea convertir ese pequeño puesto en un Bazar. Junto con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 4 años sale adelante, el buen trato a sus clientes y sus amistades hacen mejorar la venta.

loans.use: To buy women's, men's, and children's clothing and undergarments. To buy sandals.

loans.name: Omoyemwen

texts.en: Omoyemwen E. is 37 years old, married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and has been in this business since 2006. She needs a loan of US$550 to enable her  buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks for sale

loans.name: Deborah's Group

texts.en:
Deborah A. wants to expand her bar premises by constructing another shelter which will accommodate all of her customers.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand her facilities

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed M., 29,  is married and has 3 children.  Mohamed started tailoring as an apprentice in his uncle’s shop.  After learning, he established his own shop  with one machine.  With loans from SMT, Mohamed purchased three more sewing machines and also got some apprentices to work with him.  He makes African dresses and has many customers. He also trains some interested youth.  Mohamed’s business increased his income, and he has rented a shop for his work in Kabala, Sierra Leone.  Mohamed would like to establish a tailoring training center because many youth in the town would like to learn the skill. But he doesn't have enough sewing machines to meet the demand.  He is requesting a loan of Le.2, 500,000 ($850) to purchase materials and sewing machines.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and fabric

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S., 34, is married with three school-aged children. She is a vendor of grocery products and normally earns about $2 a day. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and earns $2 in profit daily. It is still difficult to make ends meet although they both earn, so they decided to borrow about $700 to expand their business by purchasing more grocery products for sale. (Mrs. Touch S. is unavailable for picture)

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a 56-year-old mother of 8 children. She has operated this general store for 2 1/2 years. Previously, she was selling yams; however, her age made it difficult to do the extensive traveling required to find and purchase the yams. This is her second loan with Sinapi.

In addition to purchasing general provisions with this loan, she hopes to add a refrigerator to her store so that she can carry and sell cold products.

Abena is a member of the trust group Nyame Beye (God Will Do It). The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

Abena is on the left with her Sinapi loan officer, Annastasia.

loans.use: To purchase general provisions, including eggs and peppers, and to begin saving for a refrigerator

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Mr. Jhonny is a responsible and punctual customer. He lives in the Periferica area, and has a photocopying and printing business. His dwelling is under an antichretic loan, one in which his creditor may use his land instead of charging interest. He is in charge of three children, and his photocopying and printing business is their only source of income. He will invest the money in purchasing machinery. Things are going well now, but as he gets more jobs, the machinery he now has won't suffice.

Mr. Jhonny has never been late in his payments, and in addition to being an honest, humble, and responsible man, he is very charismatic with great ambitions of improving himself.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Jhonny es un cliente muy responsable y puntual, vive en una zona Periferica y tienen un negocio de Fotocopias e impresiones, vive en calidad de Anticretico. El esta a cargo de tres niños y su unica fuente de ingresos son su servicio de Fotocopias e Impresiones. Invertira el dinero en la compra de maquinaria ya que ahora le va relativamente bien, pero necesita mas material de Trabajo y Maquinaria ya que la que tiene ahora no le es suficiente. Don Jhonny no tiene atraso alguno en el pago de sus cuotas y ademas de ser una persona muy honesta, humilde y responsable es una persona muy carismatica y con muchos deseos de superacion

loans.use: Invest in purchasing work equipment and machinery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a stock of cereals.

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.en:
Bibirajab S. is 48 years old. She is a widow and the loving mother of three children. Bibirajab has almost never had anyone's assistance in helping her children get ahead, so for 11 years, she has been selling the national bread, “lepeshka,” in the local market. This has been her only income to support and educate her children, and it has not been easy for her to have the entire responsibility for her family. But her love for her children is what drives her forward from day to day. She believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. That is why Bibirajab’s business is rather successful and stable; she has had her bulk buyers for many years already which allows her to have a stable income for her family.

Today Bibirajab is requesting a loan in the amount of 3400 Somoni (US$ 1000) as she is planning to purchase more “lepeshka” in order to enlarge her range of goods. Bibirajab promises to pay the loan in a timely manner over a term of 12 months. The well-being of this brave woman and her children is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing more  “lepeshka”  in order to enlarge her range of goods

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina raises animals, buys and sells fruit, and helps her husband farm. She is requesting this loan to buy food for her cows and purchase fruit, including mangos, strawberries, raspberries, and peaches. Sabina lives in a rural and remote village, but travels to the city of Chimaltenango to sell her fruit at the local market. She has been selling fruit for 20 years, but it was only 7 years ago that she was able to secure a fixed location at the market.

As she also works with her husband in agriculture, Sabina will use part of her loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. Sabina and her husband own their house and also have six little plots of land.

Sabina is 41 years old and has 11 children, who range from 1½ to 23 years old. Of all of her children, only three are in school right now. However, all of the older ones have received some education. Sabina only studied up to the second grade and can read a little but can’t sign her name. She says that she has suffered in life and has had to sacrifice a lot since she has so many children. She hopes that this loan will help her expand her business and increase her income so that she and her family can have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Sabina trabaja en la crianza de animales, la compra y venta de frutas, y le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura. Está pidiendo este préstamo para comprar comida para sus vacas y más frutas, como mangos, fresas, moras, y duraznos. Sabina vive in un cantón rural y retirado, pero viaja a la ciudad de Chimaltenango para vender las frutas en el mercado municipal. Ha trabajado en la venta de frutas por 20 años, pero hace 7 años logró el éxito de tener su propio lugar fijo en el mercado. Como también trabaja con su esposo en la agricultura, también quiere usar parte del préstamo para comprar cosas como abono y semillas para que puedan cultivar más. La casa de Sabina y su esposo es propia y tienen seis cuerdas de terreno. Sabina tiene 41 años y tiene once hijos de un año y media hasta 23 años. De todos sus hijos, solamente tres están en la escuela ahora, pero todos de los más grandes han recibido algo de educación. Sabina solamente estudió hasta el segundo grado y dice que puede leer un poco pero no puede firmar su nombre. Ella dice que ha sufrido en su vida, y hay que sacrificar mucho para tantos hijos. Tiene esperanza que este préstamo la ayudará a crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias para que tengan una vida mejor.

loans.use: to buy food for her cows, fruit to sell, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Agé de 56 ans, S. Kokou est un enseignant admis à la retraite domicilié à Aklakou. Sa maigre pension de retraite qui lui est versé irrégulièrement ne lui permet pas de subvenir aux besoins de se femmes et  des vingt personnes qu’il a à sa charge. 

Pour cela, il s’est acheté un moulin à grain qui constitue pour lui une source de revenus additionnels. Dans la perspective de tirer un maximum de profit de l’exploitation du moulin, il envisage de faire le stockage de gasoil en temps d’abondance pour en faire usage en période de soudure. 

C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un crédit pour constituer le stock de gasoil.
texts.en:
At 56 years of age, Kokou S. is a retired teacher living in Aklakou. The small retirement pension which he receives irregularly does not allow him to meet the needs of his wives and his 20 dependents.

In response to this, he bought a grain mill, which serves to supplement his income. In order to generate the most possible profit from the mill, he would like to stock up on gas oil fuel [to operate the mill] during periods of surplus, so that he can use it in times of shortage.

He is requesting a loan to establish his stock of gasoil.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock of gas oil fuel

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: Dame D. Agnès est née le 17/12/1957 à Abomey, l'une des villes historiques du Bénin à Sota dans l'Arrondissement de Sinhoué. Elle est veuve et mère d'un enfant nommé Crédo KOUCHIKO.  Elle habite le quartier de Djidjè à Cotonou  dans la maison de son feu mari KOUCHIKO depuis 14 ans et exerce comme activité la vente des boissons de la SOBEBRA et autres boissons. Son enfant est scolarisé et commerce la première année d'université pour la rentrée académique prochaine. C'est pour subvenir aux besoins de son enfant  qu'elle s'est lancé dans cette activité. Elle vient solliciter son cinquième prêt à ALIDé pour élargir son activité et satisfaire au mieux ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agnès D. was born on December 17, 1957 in Abomey, one of the historic towns of Bénin at Sota in the Arondissement of Sinhoué. She is a widow and the mother of a child named Crédo Kouchiko. She has been living in the Djidjè neighborhood in Cotonou in the home of her late husband Kouchiko for 14 years and works at selling Sobebra and other drinks.

Her child is enrolled in school and beginning his first year in university this fall. It is to support her child that she began this business. She has just requested her 5th loan from Alidé to expand her business and better satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10  cases of SOBEBRA drinks and  2 jerry cans of 50 liters each of liquor made from palm wine, etc.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeun L., 37, is married and has one child. She is a rice farmer growing rice and other crops on her rice paddy, which is about 100 meters from her house. She makes very little in revenue because what she grow is primarily just to feed her household, and she does not have much of her crop left for sale. Her husband, Phai Kang, is a construction foreman. The people in her community normally contact him directly whenever they need him to construct their houses or other buildings. In order to complete his construction projects on time, Kang has to hire three or four other construction workers to help him, and he has to pay them every week. Recently this couple has faced a financial problem and they do not have enough money to pay their workers. (In reality, he could receive his wage fee from the building owner whenever his building is completed). So in order to handle this problem, Mrs. Yoeun L. and her husband would like to take a loan from KIVA via CREDIT MFI to help them pay their workers and then use the remaining money to buy more seed to expand their crops.

loans.use: To buy more seed for her crops

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata D., 46 ans, mariée, 08 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Baghagha depuis 6 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce de crevettes. Elle achète et conditionne le produit à Baghagha pour revendre à Dakar. Ses revenus lui permettent d’aider à améliorer l’entretien de sa famille et la scolarisation des enfants. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatoumata D., age 46, is married, and has eight children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Baghagha for six years. She wants a loan to boost her commerce in shrimp. She buys the product and packages it in Baghagha for resale in Dakar. Her income enables her to help improve the care of her family and the children's schooling. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell shrimp

loans.name: Jesús Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Manuel L. es padre de familia, tiene dos hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Con dos créditos anteriores de FVP ha construido dos cuartos pero le falta colocarles el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
El está solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagar con sus ingresos de chofer de camión de carga.
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Jesús Manuel L. is the father of two teenage children who are currently in school. With previous loans from FVP, he has built two rooms which still need a roof. He has as a construction project the building of a concrete slab so the home will be more sturdy and durable. He is requesting a loan for this construction, and he plans to make his payments using his income from driving a truck. His wish is for his children to have their own room and a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a concrete slab in two rooms.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 37 años,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Se dedica a su tienda desde hace 5 años, satisfacer los requerimientos de sus vecinos es lo más importante, ya que una bodega brinda  productos de suma utilidad para los hogares, sobre todo para cubrir las necesidades primarias. Además dentro de su zona hay escasas tiendas, lo que favorece a Luzmila quien trata de   ampliar su negocio con diversos productos, a pesar de que esto signifique hacer grande inversiones. Luzmila está en su 7mo crédito con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tuvo problemas de pago, siendo una de mejores dentro del grupo. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en mercadería para su tienda para cubrir las expectativas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their children. She’s been running her shop for five years. Meeting the needs of her neighbours is very important; she provides a warehouse of useful home products, with an emphasis on basic necessities. There are a number of shops nearby, which is great for Luzmila, who helps them offer more variety, even if it means big investments on her part. Luzmila is on her seventh loan with MFP, and so far, she’s had no problems with repayment. In fact, she’s one of the best in the group. With the money she’s requested, she will invest in merchandise for her warehouse, which will help her satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the merchandise in her warehouse

loans.name: San

texts.en: T. was born 1975 and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is married with four children; all of them are single. Three of her children are employed selling souvenirs for tourists, while her husband, Mr. Ry, 37, is a motorcycle taxi driver. Lately he has not been able to attract as many clients as before because his motorbike often has problems. Ry talked with his wife and they have decided to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to replace an old one problem

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia inició el negocio por el deseo de progresar y ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar y además le gusta mucho el comercio ya que en sus trabajos anteriores siempre estuvo relacionada con las ventas y fue lo que la animó a poner su propio negocio. Comenzó el negocio en Enero de 2007

Inicio el negocio con el dinero que le dieron cuando la liquidaron en su trabajo  invirtio una parte para comprar ropa y con la ayuda de su familia pudo venderla en poco tiempo y  obtener ganancias.
 
Su negocio ha ido progresando ya que cada vez puede comprar más mercancía y de mejor calidad la cual a veces ya le resulta insuficiente para el número de clientes que tiene además de que acaba de implementar también la venta de edredones, cobertores y toallas.


Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5300 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar maercancia y asi  contar con un buen surtido de ropa para estas fechas del día de San Valentín y para la temporada de primavera que está próxima a comenzar.
texts.en:
Natalia began her business from a desire to progress and help pay for the household expenses and also because she really enjoys working in sales. Her previous jobs were always related to sales and they inspired her to start her own business. She began her business in January of 2007. She started the business with the money they gave her when she was laid off from her job. She invested part of the money in clothing and with the help of her family she was able to sell it in a short amount of time and earn money. Her business has been progressing and each time she is able to buy more merchandise and higher quality merchandise and she sometimes does not have enough for the number of customers she has. She has also begun to sell quilts, blankets, and towels. She needs a loan of $5300 MXN ($375 USD) that will be repaid in 10 installments (4 months) to buy merchandise and be able to count on having a good clothing selection for Valentine's Day and for the spring season that will soon begin.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La socia Cornelio, es natural del distrito de saylla, este distrito está ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco en carro.

La socia tiene 36 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 13 años; ella alterna sus actividades domésticas con la agricultura (cultivos maíz, cebada) y la crianza de animales menores (cuyes, cerdos). La socia utilizará el préstamo, para alquilar terrenos y así poder cultivar mas productos.

La socia está muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y valora el apoyo dado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Cornelia is from the Saylla district which is located 45 minutes from the city of Cuzco by car. She is 36 years of age, lives with her partner, and has two children who are 17 and 13. She alternates her domestic activities with agriculture (farming corn and barley) and raising small animals (guinea pigs and pigs). She will use the loan to rent land and be able to grow more produce. She is very thankful to have her loan approved and values the support given and is committed to making the payments in the predetermined period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent land, buy and sell animals

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty R. started her fish sales fifteen years ago in Elmina in the central region of Ghana. Gifty prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish, and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and smokes them. She has a high customer base and customers travel from the other part of the region to buy her fish. She has also added the sale of sachet water to her business.

Gifty is now 40 years old and a married mother of five children. Her husband is a producer of salt. Currently her firstborn is at the polytechnic and two other children are in senior high school.

She wants to use this loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children's education and the growth of her business. She belongs to a village bank called Truth. She hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.en:
"Ni Ketut G. - (DNR.M-0635) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Dsn Pangkung Liplip, Ds Kaliakah. She is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Ni Ketut G. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Ni Ketut G. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years.

In 2007, Ni Ketut G. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut G. has successfully repaid a previous loan from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Ni Ketut G. is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Ketut G. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


*********************************************************

Ni Ketut G. - (DNR.M-0635) merupakan 50 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Dsn Pangkung Liplip , Ds Kaliakah. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 4 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut G. memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak sapi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut G. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.

Dalam 2007, Ni Ketut G. bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut G. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5000000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut G. berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира удачно без проблем заканчивает свой очередной займ .Она хочет получить повторно сумму чуть поменьше, для расширения своего бизнеса. Она торгует на рынке города Худжанда , в центре рынка.Мунира продаёт шампуни Российского пр-ва, различные чистящие средства для дома.Муж Муниры умер 12лет назад, по болезни почек.Поэтому ей трудно в жизни, хотя ей помогает её сын. Микроивест рад помочь Мунире в расширении её бизнеса.
texts.en:
Munira, successfully, without problems is finishing up her loan. She would like to take out another sum that is a little bit smaller in order to grow her business. She sells at the Khujand market at the center of the market. Munira sells shampoos made in Russia and various cleaning products for the home. Munira’s husband died 12 years ago from a kidney disease. This is why she has a difficult life, even though her son helps her. MicroInvest is happy to help Munira expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of shampoo and cleaning supplies

loans.name: Fabiola Rosaura

texts.es: Fabiola es soltera, de 31 años de edad, trabajadora de la Corte Superema de Justicia como juez local civil  en el municipio de Acoyapa, con 7 años de servicio, por el momento habita en casa de sus padres, pero esta solicitando credito para la construccion de 200 mts de sanjeo para una tapia, con la intencion de dar mayor seguridad a su vivienda que esta ubicada en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan. Plantea que tiene un salario bueno y que ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su papá quien es ganadero, por eso quiere aprovechar para realizar el trabajo ahora, para que cuando en un futuro tenga su propia familia tenga comodidad. Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a vierntes de 8:00am. a 1:00p.m.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 31 years old and single. She has worked at the Acoyapa Supreme Court of Justice as a local civil judge for 7 years.
She currently lives in her parents’ home, but is requesting a loan to construct a 200m ditch for a wall that will make her home, located in the Bosques de Juigalpan residential area, more secure. She mentions that she has a good salary and has the support of her father, a cattle farmer. As such, she would like to seize the opportunity to get the work done now, so that when she eventually has a family of her own, they can live in comfort.
She works Mondays to Fridays from 8:00am to 1:00pm.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wall

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es: Ángel tiene 33 años, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en la casa de sus padres, pues aún no logran comprar un terreno donde construir su casa propia. Su familia se dedicaba a la venta de productos agrícolas en el mercado central de la ciudad, donde él trabajaba para ayudar a sus padres; actualmente, se asoció con ellos para iniciar su propio negocio, ya que ahora tiene la responsabilidad de velar por su nueva familia. Desde entonces, hace 2 años, vende choclo en el mismo mercado, actividad que le demanda muchas horas de sacrificio; puesto que desde las 3 de la madrugada sale de casa rumbo a su puesto para vender sus productos hasta el medio día. Asimismo, Ángel se mantiene en contacto con sus proveedores, quienes son agricultores de otras provincias que le brindan los productos a menor precio; pero si quiere conseguir aún menores costos viaja hasta esos lugares para adquirir productos en grandes cantidades y de mejor calidad. Para un futuro cercano, Ángel quiere tener un depósito donde mantener seguros sus productos. Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde su compromiso está ligado a su crecimiento económico, con una base de responsabilidad y trabajo. Con los 3000 soles que solicita viajará a una provincia del interior del país para comprar, al por mayor, los productos que necesita.
texts.en:
Ángel is 33 years old and he lives together with his wife and his son in the house of his parents, because they still haven't managed to buy a plot on which to build their own house. His family used to sell agricultural products in the central town market, where he used to work helping his parents. Now, he has clubbed together with them in order to start-up his own business, as he now has responsibility to watch over his new family. As a result, for the last two years he has sold corn in the same market, an activity which requires many hours of sacrifice. At 3 in the morning he leaves the house and heads to his stall to sell his produce until midday. In this way, Ángel maintains contact with his providers who are farmers from other provinces who provide the produce at a low price. However, if he wants to obtain even lower costs he travels to these places to acquire better-quality produce in larger quantities. In the short-term, Ángel wants to have a store where he can keep his goods securely. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, where his commitment is attached to his economic growth, based upon responsibility and hard-work. With the 3000 soles which he is asking for he will travel to a province in the interior of the country in order to buy, wholesale, the produce he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey L. is from the town of Plaridel. He is 40 years old. Rey is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Rey owns and operates a service business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services to members of the local community.  Rey has been engaged in his business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Rey joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Rey is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Rey from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Yanet es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Yanet vende frutas peladas como piña en rodajas,  sandia en rodajas, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado 12 de abril de manera ambulatoria.
Yanet necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de un terreno.
Los sueños de Yanet son tener casa propia, tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Manantial Community Bank. Yanet is 25, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Yanet sells fruit that needs to be peeled like pineapple slices and watermelon slices. She is a street vendor in the 12 de abril market. Yanet needs a loan for 1,050 PEN as part of a payment for a piece of land. Yanet’s dreams are to have her own house and a stable store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part of a payment for a piece of land

loans.name: Zahanati Group

texts.en:
Rhoda is a member of the Zahanati borrower group in Kola Morogoro. She is 33 years old and separated from her husband. She is the mother of two children, ages three and 10.

Rhoda started her own tailoring business 10 years ago. She works six hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rhoda's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more material for her business.

With the profit she expects to gain from the use of this loan, Rhoda hopes to save money and expand her business.

Magreth and Neema are the other members of the same borrower group. Like Rhoda, they have requested loans from BRAC Tanzania in order to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring material

loans.name: Elsira Dorliza

texts.es: La señora Elsira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de Guadalupe II”,  Distrito de Bagua Grande, Provincia Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es separada, tiene 55 años tiene 03 hijos, ya todos mayores de edad e independientes.El espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee le ayudó a decidir a seguir en el negocio por que siente que le mantiene en actividad y en contacto con la gente, ella inicia con un capital de S/. 50.00 comenzó vendiendo poco, hasta conocer más gente, ahora cuenta con buenos clientes que le hacen pedidos del manjar blanco y en ocasiones queso de Pomacochas. Ella sola es quien decide y maneja su negocio  Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará manjares y queso de Ponmacochas, así como en los envases de plástico descartable para dar buena presentación a sus productos y así atender los pedidos que ya tiene de sus clientes, quiere tener surtido su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. Elsira, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
La señora Elsira belongs to the cooperative bank "Virgen de Guadalupe II," Bagua Grande district, Utcubamba Province, Amazonas Department. She is separated, 55 years old, and has three children, who are all older and independent. Her spirit and enterprising energy encouraged her to continue in business, and she feels that the business keeps her active and in touch with people. She started with $18 in capital. She began to sell a little and to know more people. Now she has good customers who request her caramel spread and on occasions Ponmacochas cheese. She alone manages the business. With this loan of $275, she will buy delicacies and Ponmacochas cheese and sell them in disposable plastic containers in order to give an attractive presentation of her products and respond to the requests of her customers. She wishes to have a well-stocked business and give good service to her customers because that is her nature. She feels the strength of spirit to continue working and persevering day to day. She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving women such as her opportunites to develop themselves in their field of work.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will purchase delicacies and cheeses

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn and her family live in the village of Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 30 years old and finished her secondary level of education. She is married to Guillermo and they have three children who they want to become successful in their chosen fields. For this reason, the couple strives hard in order to support their children's educational needs.

Jovelyn is in the vending business while her husband works as a farmer. Jovelyn sells vegetables, fish and frozen foods around their village. She wants to develop her business and in line with this, she wants to borrow a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva lenders. Most of her income is being budgeted for the basic needs of their family and school allowance of their children. She aims to strengthen her vending business to earn a higher income and able to have a better quality of living with her family.  She is hopeful that Kiva lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Furu

texts.en: Furu D. is currently in the business of selling fruits such as: mangoes, oranges etc and is requesting a loan to purchase green vegetables to sell.  Furu is 40 years old and is Married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nuevo Porvenir Group

texts.es:
Carmen Laura A., de 27 años cuenta que hace 3 años trabaja con Pro Mujer por invitación de su madre que ya pertenecía al grupo Nuevo Porvenir, del Centro Focal Panamericana,  tiene el negocio de elaboración de estampados en diferentes prendas, como llaveros, vasos, ropa y otros, requiere  el préstamo para comprar insumos como lona, tela, pintura ya que en cualquier momento le hacen pedidos grandes. Ella trabaja con su esposo quien elabora los productos y ella los vende o consigue los pedidos, tiene su tienda en la ciudad de La Paz en la Calle Murillo, a Carmen también le gusta el ahorro dice al respecto “se ahorra sin sentir y puedes usar ese ahorro para emergencias”.
