Al igual que Carmen las demás integrantes del grupo también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de manoplas, sombreros, alimentos secos, colchas y comida. Todas necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercadería e insumos.
texts.en:
Carmen Laura A. is 27. She has worked with Pro Mujer for three years. Her mother, who already belonged to the Nuevo Porvenir Group of the Panamericana Community Center, invited her to join. She has a business making patterns on different items like key chains, glasses, clothes, and others. She needs a loan to buy supplies like canvas, fabric, and paint. At any given moment she receives large orders. She works with her husband who makes the products. She sells them or gets the orders. Her store is in the city of La Paz on the Calle Murillo. Carmen also likes the savings. She says, “You save without feeling it, and you can uses these savings for emergencies”. The rest of the group members, like Carmen, have their own businesses like selling mittens, hats, dried food, quilts, and food. They all need the loan to buy merchandise and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Fati works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. She is a petty trader. She sells a local vegetable called ‘dawadawa’. It is used to prepare soup. She procures the vegetables from nearby communities and sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers.

Fati has been in business for over sixteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia R. is currently in the business of selling sandals and shoes and is requesting a loan to stock more shoes to sell. Sadia is 39 years old and is married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her settlement.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more shoes to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: 42-year-old Elena tills her farm with patience. She prepares her land for rice crops. As a basic necessity for Filipinos, she wants her rice to be of quality. She feels her service is good when she sells the best rice. In need of financial assistance for her farm, she applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of PHP7,000. This loan will be used for farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. Receiving this loan will be truly helpful in achieving Elena’s goal.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies like seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella no estudió, se dedica a la compra y venta de golosinas.

Lorenza nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar           galletas, chocolates, panetones, yogures, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es seguir trabajando para así progresar y capitalizarme. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana
texts.en:
Sra. Lorenza became a member of the Generation 2000 Communal Bank three months ago. She lives in the District of Santa Rosa, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. Lorenza is 56 years old, married, and has two children. She did not attend school, but she makes a living buying and selling sweets.

Lorenza tells us that that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was for 500 soles and was used to increase her capital. She will request a new loan of 2000 soles so that she can buy cookies, chocolates, panettone, yogurt, and other products. Her dream for the future is to continue working so that she can improve and build capital. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the savings account that earns interest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cookies, chocolates, panettone, yogurt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: Née en 1962 à Avrankou dans le département de l’Ouémé, D. Rosalie vit depuis une quinzaine d’année dans la zone des Ambassades à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à SALAKO Houdjinou un chauffeur, Rosalie est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple vit avec leurs trois enfants et participe ensemble aux diverses charges de la famille. Rosalie n’a jamais fréquenté mais exerce comme activité la vente de haricot préparé et du pain. Rosalie possède à son actif, 4 années d’expériences dans l’exercice de cette activité. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Rosalie se ravitaille. Rosalie vend ses produits dans son quartier. Rosalie a bénéficié par le passé de cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Faute de moyen financiers pour diversifier et renforcer ses activités, Rosalie souhaite bénéficier d’un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1962 at Avrankou in the Oueme district, D. Rosalie has been living in the embassies area in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about 15 years. Married to Salako Houdjinou, a driver, Rosalie is the mother of three children, all in school. The couple live with their three children and contribute together to the various expenses of the family. Rosalie has never been to school, but sells ready made ( canned) beans and bread as a business. Rosalie has in her advantage 4 years of experience in the operation of this business. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She sells her products in her neighborhood. Rosalie benefitted from 5 loans from ALIDe in the past and repaid all loans. For lack of funds to diversify and strengthen her business, Rosalie hopes to benefit from a sixth loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beans, bread, peanut oil, and gari

loans.name: Blanca Nuriz

texts.es:
la sra. Blanca Nuriz H. vive en la comunidad del Trinfo en el departamento de Choluteca, tiene 30 años de edad.
Blanca se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballero y niños, vende camisas, camisetas, calsontas, calsetines, faldas, blusas, ropa interior etc.
ahorita necesita el credito para comprar ropa para la epoca de verano, en el Triunfo la temperatura es muy alta, hace mucho calor, las personas prefieren andar con ropa comoda para este tipo de temperaturas.
dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su negocio cada dia va creciendo poco a poco, esto le esta dando buenas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para el sustento de su familia.
Blanca necesita el credito para salir adelante con su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca Nuriz H. lives in the Triunfo community in the Choluteca department. She is 30 years old. Blanca sells new clothes for women, men and children - she sells shirts, vests, knee and ankle socks, dresses, blouses, underwear etc. Right now she needs a loan to buy clothes for the summer season. In Triunfo the temperature is very high, it is really hot and people prefer to wear clothes suitable for the type of temperature. She says she feels very happy since her business is growing little by little every day, it is making her a good profit, which she needs to look after her family. Blanca needs the loan to get ahead in her business and to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for women, men and children

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina C. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is fifty-nine years old. Segundina is married and has two grown children. To make a living, Segundina owns and operates a specialized retail store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling plants and flowers in the local community. Segundina has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Segundina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Segundina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional working capital. This loan will be Segundina's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional working capital.

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Adijat, her husband, and their three children reside in Lagos where she bakes and sells bread and also owns a shop selling food items. She has been in these businesses for some years.

Adijat is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more baking items including flour and baking powder. This will enable her to bake more bread and meet the needs of her numerous customers, her dream being to expand the operation into a large business and improve her family's standard of living. Adijat says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support..

loans.use: To purchase more baking items.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina C. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Rosalina is widowed and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalina sells scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Marvin De Jesús

texts.es: Este cliente es originaria del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para compra de materiales para construir su casita tales como: puertas, laminas de zinc, bolsas de cemento, ya que por falta de financiamiento no ha podido reforzarlo. Agradece ya que con la ayuda su familia va a tener una casita donde vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Este cliente es originaria del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para compra de materiales para construir su casita tales como: puertas, laminas de zinc, bolsas de cemento, ya que por falta de financiamiento no ha podido reforzarlo. Agradece ya que con la ayuda su familia va a tener una casita donde vivir dignamente.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de materialez

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: To make a living in Ibadan, A. sells medicines. She hopes to grow her business. She is 33 years old, married with 2 children. Her husband is a carpenter and he also supports their home. She is a LAPO client. (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa. She is requesting for a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha V. L. was born in 1976. She is married with two children (a daughter and a son) who are still very young. She is a tailor for a garment export company. Besides that, she breeds pigs. Her husband is a bricklayer. He has a monthly income of about $167 and hers is about $100. Mrs Ha has  participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to repair her house.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Katiereton Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KATIERETON III sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 8 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Nimprodioula un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, (3ème région  administrative du Mali). 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées par ce groupe d’homme  sont généralement  le maïs  par NAMAKORO D.. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter des intrants ( engrais et herbicide) et les petits matériels agricoles. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de Sikasso après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Namakoro  compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000 FCFA par campagne et souhaite entretenir  sa collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Son ambition est d’acheter un vélo  pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the group KATIERETON III are married men averaging 49 years of age and eight children living for the most part in polygamous families in Nimprodioula, one of the villages of the community of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farm work during the winter. They are on their second collaboration with the institution. The past loan has been repaid. The plantings cultivated by this group of men are generally corn, per NAMAKORO D.. With this new loan, he plans on buying some supplies (manure and herbicide) and sundry items for farming. The produce is sold in the village and at the Sikasso market after the harvests. His customer base is composed of women and men. Namakoro plans on making an average profit of 90,000 francs CFA per planting. He wishes to maintain his collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. His ambition is to buy a bicycle for his children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying manure and hebicides

loans.name: El Fortin (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Deilery tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo desde hace 8 años,  el señor Simón Altunar Ríos,  su familia se conforma de cuatro hijos, José Francisco quien estudia el segundo grado de secundaria, Rubiel Alejandro de quinto grado de primaria, Viridiana y Jonathan de ocho años, Deliry nos dice: “Me siento muy feliz por el hogar que tiene y los hijos que “Dios” le ha dado”
Ella junto con otras personas se enteraron que Fundación Realidad brindaba créditos a las personas que tuvieran un negocio, así que decidieron formar un grupo y lo llamaron El Fortín, la razón por la cual le dieron ese nombre fue porque el camino que lleva a su comunidad se llama así. Sus compañeras que hoy forman parte del grupo son: Rossana Isabel P., Maria Aroly Z. S. en la que cada una tiene una actividad diferente.
 La señora Deilery cuenta con su negocio de: venta de tamales, sandwich, refrescos, papas fritas, entre otros, ella lleva un año con éste negocio y vende en una escuela primaria llamada “Justo Sierra”.
Ella solicita el crédito a Fundación Realidad A.C. Es para comprar mercancía y tener surtida su tienda así como también Doña Rossana en su negocio de antojitos y Maria Aroly  la venta de traste. Ella comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que le ha ayudado a solventar los gastos de la casa obteniendo ganancias para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, ya que el señor Simón (su esposo) trabaja de ayudante de albañil, él se siente contento y satisfecho con el apoyo que le da a su esposa, pues cree en la igualdad de género.
“Mi sueño es construir un local y con las ganancias de mi negocio seguir apoyando a mis hijos en sus estudios de manera  que tenga más oportunidades de seguir estudiando y tener mejor futuro”
texts.en:
Deilery is 32 years old, and lives with her common-law husband of 8 years, Símon. Her family consists of four children, José Francisco who is in the second grade of secondary school, Rubiel Alejandro who is in the fifth grade of elementary school, and Viridiana and Jonathon who are 8 years old. Delilery tells us: "I feel very happy on account of the home that I have and the four children that God has given me." She, along with other people, found out that Fundación Realidad offered loans to people who have businesses, and so they decided to form a group that they called El Fortín. The reason that they gave themselves this name is that the road that goes to their community is called that. Her friends who make up the rest of the group are: Rossana Isabel and María Aroly, and each has a different business. Deilery runs a business that sells tamales, sandwiches, sodas, fries, and other things. She has been running the business for one year and sells her goods in the Justo Sierra elementary school. She is requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad A.C. to buy stocks for her store, as is Rossana for her snack store, and María Aroly who sells cooking utensils. She comments that her business is going very well, and it has helped her to make a profit and to help her husband with the household expenses. Simón (her husband) works as a mason's assistant, he feels happy and satisfied with the support he gives his wife because he believes in gender equality. "My dream is to build my own place and, with the profits from my business, to support my children in their studies so that they have more opportunities to study and will have a better future."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients to make tamales, sandwiches, pies. Also to buy sodas, fries, and other goods.

loans.name: Jumabu's Group

texts.ru:
Человек порой, подобен листку, упавшему в речку, и теперь плывущему вниз по течению жизни в направлении неизвестности и неопределённости. Однако, разум и трезвое суждение, смекалка и чуточку везения уже делают этот лист твёрдым, способным самостоятельно преодолевать барьеры на пути и самому решать для себя, где же ему следует остановиться. 
Джумабу Дыйканбаева – лидер данной группы. Судьба уже испытала твёрдость характера Джумабу, когда погиб её муж. В свои преклонные годы, люди её возраста обычно уже перестают бороться за жизнь и предпочитают просто плыть по течению. Джумабу вполне заслужила такой отдых и отречение от всех обязанностей. Ведь она не только прожила последние годы, неустанно трудясь, а ещё вырастила и воспитала четверых детей. Ей удалось привить своим детям те самые качества, которые бы помогли детям не только достичь успеха в своих делах, но и благодаря которым Джумабу бы не пришлось за них краснеть, а наоборот только гордилась бы ими. Дети Джумабу выросли трудолюбивыми людьми, почитающими своих детей. Сейчас все дети работают и сами устраивают свои жизни. Единственная дочь замужем и живёт отдельно. При этом Джумабу всегда была для своих детей, прежде всего заботливой матерью, а не каким – нибудь начальником, или служащим. Чтобы не сидеть на шее своих детей, Джумабу на сегодня продолжает трудиться и зарабатывать себе на жизнь. Она занимается своим любимым и привычным делом – разведением скота. Благодаря этому занятию они даже построили дом. Сейчас тот самый трезвое суждение подсказывает ей не ждать своих средств, а обратиться за помощью. Джумабу надеется, что получив этот кредит, она сможет купить жеребёнка. 
Партнёры Джумабу по группе:
Султанбек Бабаев – отец троих детей. Ему пятьдесят один год. Чтобы прокормить свою семью Султанбек разводит скот, а его жена продаёт молоко. Султанбек обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить дойную корову для содержания.
Марие Ногоевой сорок шесть лет. Мария – мать пятерых детей. Старшему сыну двадцать пять, а младшей дочери тринадцать лет. Мария занимается скотоводством, и дети ей помогают. На кредит она хочет купить телёнка. 
Алымкан Байышовой сорок шесть лет. Алымкан воспитывает троих детей. Старшие сын и дочь учатся в ВУЗах и параллельно работают. Сама Алымкан занимается разведением скота и продажей молока. Алымкан, если получит кредит, хочет купить бычка, для откорма и дальнейшей перепродажи.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
A human being can sometimes be compared to a leaf that had fallen into a river and is now being carried by the current of life in an unknown and uncertain direction. However, reason, solid judgment, quick wit and a bit of good luck strengthen that leaf, enabling it to clear hurdles and decide independently where to stop. Jumabu D. is this group’s leader. Fate has already tested Jumabu’s character when her husband perished. People of that advanced age usually stop fighting for a better life and prefer simply to swim with the current. Jumabu would fully deserve getting such a rest and renouncing all responsibilities. After all she has not simply been working incessantly for years, but also managed to bring up four children. She has been able to inculcate in her children the qualities which would allow them to be successful, so that they would not embarrass Jumabu, but, on the contrary, would make Jumabu proud of them. They have grown up hard-working and respectful of their [parents]. Now all her children work and are responsible for their own lives. Her only daughter is married and lives separately. With that, Jumabu has always been for her children a caring mother, first of all, and not some kind of boss or bureaucrat. In order to avoid being a burden on her children, Jumabu still continues to work and support herself. She does the kind of work she knows and loves—raising livestock. Thanks to this work they have even been able to build a house. Now Jumabu’s sense of judgment tells her not to wait until she has the means but to turn for help. She is hoping to obtain this loan and to buy a foal. Jumabu’s partners in the group: Sultanbek B. is the father of three children. He is 51 years old. In order to support his family, he raises cattle, and his wife sells milk. Sultanbek requested a loan in order to buy a dairy cow. Mariya N. is 46 years old. She is the mother of five children. Her oldest son is 25 years old, and her youngest daughter is 13. Mariya raises livestock, and her children help her. She wants to use her loan to buy a calf. Alymkan B. is 46 years old. She is taking her three children. The older children, a son and a daughter, go to college and also work. Alymkan raises cattle and sells milk. If she obtains her loan, she would like to buy a calf for fattening and later resale.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a foal for breeding

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Olga Isabel B. es socia del banco comunal Rosas Rojas, vive en la comunidad de La Estancia que es perteneciente al cantón Paute que se caracteriza por ser la mayor productora de flores, su gente en su mayor parte viven del la agricultura y ganadería.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 13, 9, 2 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo está en el colegio y el segundo en la escuela, su esposo trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada, gracias a el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Olga Isabel se dedica a la cría de pollos, los vende pelados en el mercado de Paute, realiza esta labor hace 2 años; para mejorar la economía de su hogar hace 8 meses se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado de su cantón los días miércoles y domingos,  vende principalmente ropa de damas.

Es nuestra socia hace 7 ciclos y los créditos le han permitido seguir creciendo en el negocio de pollos,  el nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería. Su meta es que sus hijos lleguen a ser  buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Olga Isabel B. is a member of the “Rosas Rojas” (Red Roses) Communal Bank. She lives in the La Estancia community, which belongs to the Paute canton. It is characterized as being the greatest flower producer. Most of its people live from farming and livestock. Our member is 35 years old and married. She has four children; 13, 9, 2, and 1 years old. Her first child is in high school, and the second one is in elementary school. Her husband works as a heavy machine operator. Thanks to the couple’s work they have built their own house. Olga Isabel raises chickens. She sells the plucked chickens at the Paute market. She has been doing this work for two years in order to improve the household finances. For eight months she has been selling clothes in the market in her canton. She does that on Wednesdays and Sundays. She mostly sells clothes for women. She has been a member for seven cycles. The loans have allowed her to keep growing in the chicken business. The new loan is to buy clothes to stock her merchandise. Her goal is for her children to become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blouses, skirts, pants, and dresses

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian P. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, dried fish and onions at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and dried fish to sell.  

Lilian is 27 years old and married to a soldier. She has two children, one of whom goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a salon shop.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel B. is 60 years old, married, and supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:  general store, arucera (rice mill), and buy and sell. She lives in Sitio Buragwak, Brgy. Manghanoy, La Castellana, Negros Occidental.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, arucera (rice mill), and buy and sell businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,500.

Rachel is now borrowing PHP 49,500 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 40,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rachel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
la sra. Teodosia M. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia desde hace 10 años, en estos momentos teodosia cuenta con poca mercadería.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
en su pulperia vende productos básicas de consumo diario como ser: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, leche, papel higiénico, pan, refrescos y otros.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodosia M. engages in selling products to the general public: she has been running a small corner shop for 10 years, but right now Teodosia is low on supplies. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products and supply her shop. In her corner shop she sells everyday products such as rice, beans, sugar, eggs, milk, toilet paper, bread, drinks and so on. She needs the income to pay for her family’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to supply her shop.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 24 years old and still single.  Marie Louise is commonly known for selling cosmetic goods and this is her eighth successful year in this business.

Although Marie Louise has been in this business for a long time, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Marie Louise will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres G. is from the town of Plaridel. He is 68 years old. Andres is separated and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Andres owns & operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Andres has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Andres joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Andres has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Andres is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Andres from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A.  is currently in the business of making and selling tea alongside the road and is requesting a loan to stock more coffee, sugar, etc for making hot drinks to sell.  Mary is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has  four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more coffee, sugar, etc. for making tea to sell

loans.name: Ignacio Ramon

texts.es: Ignacio Ramón tiene 26 años, su actividad económica es la venta de teléfonos celulares. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y además disfruta de su bello trabajo, por lo que cada día disfruta de su actividad económica y de relacionarse con cada uno de sus clientes, que son sus mismos vecinos por lo que siempre esta interactuando con ellos. Por lo que está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de muy buenos teléfonos ya que tiene ciertos pedidos pendientes,  y así satisfacer a su clientela. El desea construir cuartos suficientes en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ignacio Ramón is 26 years old.  He has been selling cell phones for a living for more than 2 years now.  He is a very responsible man and enjoys his job immensely.  He enjoys what he does as well as the interactions he has with his each one of his customers, who also happen to be his neighbors.  

He is requesting a loan to buy high quality telephones to fulfill outstanding orders and satisfy his customers .  

He would also like to add more rooms on to his house.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones

loans.name: Anaciata

texts.en:
Anaciata is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a poultry business for the past two years, selling to her neighbours, passersby and restaurant operators. Anaciata cites the outbreak of diseases for the chicks, and the high cost of transportation as her major challenges in the business. She hopes to buy more chicks and supply the hotels in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks, chicken feed and chicken medicine. She decided to join Yehu because it does not require much collateral.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, chicken feed and chicken medicine.

loans.name: Quimey Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Quimey” se conforma por 20 emprendedores, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Villarrica. 
María Cristina es la secretaria de este grupo y en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, en 3º lugar de izquierda a derecha. Ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y carteras, a domicilio y en su casa, desde hace 2 meses. Antes de este negocio trabajaba como cajera en una empresa de buses. 
Con este préstamo comprará perfumes. Su meta es aumentar sus ingresos al doble, para ir creciendo en su negocio. Vive con su marido y su única hija de 8 años. 
A María Cristina le ha servido mucho este préstamo de Fondo Esperanza, para continuar con su negocio. Además se ha sentido muy bien con los temas de confianza y solidaridad que han compartido durante las reuniones de grupo junto a su asesora.
Villarrica es una  ciudad al sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de La Araucanía. Es una ciudad pequeña, pero cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y turísticos, siendo uno de los principales centros de servicios D. área cordillerana y principal centro turístico de la región, junto con Pucón. Durante los meses de verano se realizan numerosas actividades y eventos culturales, artísticos y deportivos, Además de las innumerables alternativas de Ecoturismo, Turismo Aventura y Etnoturismo.
texts.en:
The “Quimey” community bank has 20 members who live in the city of Villarrica.

María Cristina is the group's secretary.  In the photo she is in the back row, third from the left.  She sells perfumes and purses both door-to-door and from her home.  She has been doing this for 2 months.  Before she started her business, she worked as a cashier in a bus company.

María Cristina will use this loan to buy perfume.  Her goal is to double her income so that she can grow in her business.  She lives with her husband and her only child, an 8 year-old daughter.

María Cristina has found this loan from Fondo Esperanza to be very useful in helping her continue with her business.  She is also happy with the trust and solidarity which the group members have shared during their group meetings together with their advisor.

Villarrica is a city in southern Chile which is located in La Araucanía region.  It is a small city but has every basic service and tourist service as it is one of the main service centers of the Andean region and the main tourist center of the region, together with Pucón.  During the summer months, there are many cultural, artistic and sporting activities and events.  There is also a lot of ecotourism, adventure tourism and ethnotourism.

loans.use: To buy perfume

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes D. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Lourdes is married and has one grown child. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a specialized retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green and sweet bananas. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This loan will be the first loan Lourdes has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Iris Alicia

texts.es:
Iris tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en casa de su madre, ubicada en el distrito de Túcume, una zona agrícola y comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque. 

Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo ropa a pedidos y algunas veces de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de Túcume, esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años y debido a ello conoce muy bien el rubro en el que se desempeña y cuenta con una clientela bastante estable. Con los ingresos que obtiene de esta actividades ella se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia. 

Iris desea adquirir prendas de vestir de verano para poder satisfacer la demanda que suele presentarse durante esta temporada y con los  ingresos que obtiene seguir ayudando a su familia a progresar, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Iris is 44 years old and a single mother.  She lives in her mother's house in the district of Túcume, an agricultural and commercial area in the province of Lambayeque.  

She sells clothing by order and sometimes in an itinerant manner in the Túcume market.  She has been doing this for several years now and knows the area she serves very well and has a stable customer base.  With her income from these activities she is able to provide for her family.  

Iris is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase summer clothing to satisfy the demands of her customers during this season.  With the income from her sales she will continue supporting her family.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothing to satisfy the demands of her customers during the summer months

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana E. R. tiene la edad de 50 años, estudio hasta segundo grado de primaria y es madre soltera de dos hijo de los cuales uno es hombre de nombre Joel de nueve años de edad que asiste a la primaria y una mujer de 37 años de nombre Eva, doña Juana y su familia viven en la comunidad de Aserradero a 10 minutos del municipio de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca.

Doña Juana nos platica que desde hace años   trabaja en la cría de borregos, nos dice que inicio con 2 borregos y  poco a poco a comprado mas borregos con las ganancias que a obtenido, Doña Juana tienen un pequeño corral en la parte de atrás de su casa y alimenta a sus borregos con alimento y todos los días los saca a pastorear para que también coman un poco de hierbas. Ella decidió iniciar  con su propio negocio ya que es madre soltera y necesitaba sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella nos dice que otro de los motivos por los cuales inicio con la cría de borregos es porque se gana mas dinero con la venta de sus animales que trabajando de dependienta en una tienda y puede dedicarle mas tiempo al pequeño Joel, doña Juana también vende barbacoa y consome de borrego los domingos, ella vende la barbacoa desde su casa, levanta pedidos y cuando termina de preparar su barbacoa entrega sus pedidos, también nos dice que como ya sus clientes saben que vende sin necesidad de ofrecer llegan a buscar la barbacoa a su casa. Doña Juana espera que en un futuro su negocio siga creciendo y tener mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenten y poder construir un pequeño local el cual lo acondicionara para que sus clientes vallan a comer su barbacoa. 

Doña Juana se encuentra agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad que le esta dando para que su negocio cresca al otorgarle este préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana E. R. is 50 years old and studied up to the second year of elementary school.  She is a single mother and has two children: a 9 year-old son Joel, who is in elementary school, and a 37 year-old daughter called Eva.  Juana and her family live in Aserradero neighborhood, 10 minutes from the town of Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, in the State of Oaxaca.

Juana tells us that she has been raising lambs for years.  She tells us that she started out with 2 lambs and has gradually been buying more with the profits that she has made.  Juana has a small pen behind her home where she feeds her lambs.  She also takes them out to graze every day so that they get to eat a bit of grass.  Juana decided to set up her own business since she is a single mother and she needed to get her children ahead in life.  She tells us that a further motive for starting out in her lamb-raising business was that there was more money to be earned in selling her animals than there was in her job as a sales assistant in a store.  This work also means she is able to spend more time with her young son Joel.

In addition to raising her lambs, Juana also sells barbecued lamb and lamb consommé on Sundays.  She sells the barbecued meat from her home.  She prepares orders which she then delivers.  She also tells us that her customers come to her home.  Juana hopes that, in the future, her business will continue to grow and that she will attract more customers so that her profits rise and she will be able to build a small business premises which she will adapt so that her customers can stay and eat her barbecued meat.

Juana is grateful to the foundation for providing this loan as it will give her the opportunity to help her business grow.

loans.use: To raise and sell lamb and to sell barbecued meat

loans.name: Raquel's Group

texts.en:
Raquel B. is from the village of Mabantad, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 22 years old. Raquel is the group leader of a 5-member group that borrows from ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or if they default. Raquel is single. To make a living, she raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the income for the business comes primarily from raising and fattening pigs for sale. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP every four months for these activities.

In 2011, Raquel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Raquel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine S. is from the village of Serran, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Geraldine is married and has 2 small children. To make a living, Geraldine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety)  shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, biscuits & breads in the local community. Geraldine has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Geraldine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods.  This is the first loan taken out with HSPFI.  She hopes the loan will help to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods & canned goods

loans.name: Marife Pacho's Group

texts.en:
Mariefe P. is from the village of Sun Life, Naguillian, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Mariefe is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mariefe is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mariefe owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector managing a handicrafts business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling handicrafts home products to tourists and local community members. Mariefe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mariefe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariefe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. Mariefe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mariefe from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed to make handicrafts for sale

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in Kamoki which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan and is famous for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 4 room brick house with her family in the area of Bilal park for past 25 years. 

She is a housewife, prefers to stay at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very caring person and takes care of her family very well. 
Her husband M. S. operates a spare parts shop through which he sells motorbike and auto vehicle spare parts and earns income for the family. 

Nasreen is the mother of 3 sons. All of them are involved in different works. Her eldest son works with his father’s spare parts shop. The 2nd son works in a factory for a low income and the youngest one is a private employee. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for buying spare parts for the expansion of her husband’s spare parts business. She is hopeful that the loan support will enable him to increase his sales and earn larger profits. 

Nasreen is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. She has proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time in previous loan years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen

loans.use: to buy spare parts for sale

loans.name: Raimunda

texts.es: Doña Raimunda P. X. de 63 años de edad,ella tiene su venta de tortillas y también crianza de animales.  Ella ha recibido de FAPE varios créditos y ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable y trabajadora,  con su negocio ha podido apoyar a sus hijos que siguieran estudiando y tener una carrera, como ella comenta actualmente ha encarecido todo, especialmente el maíz que ella necesita para su tortillería por lo que sus planes son comprar varios quintales de maíz y leña, ya que por las fuertes lluvias del año pasado la cosecha de maíz no fue buena y esto ha ocasionado que el maíz haya subido de precio por lo que el crédito le ayuda a poder comprar por mayor y tener una pequeña reserva de maíz,  por otra parte ella siempre tiene su crianza de animales, cerdos y gallinas que mientras van creciendo y llega el tiempo de venderlos ella se ayuda con su tortillería, de esa manera puede seguir apoyando a sostener su familia, ella cuenta que se siente muy contenta de tener la oportunidad de recibir un capital para seguir invirtiendo.
texts.en:
Raimunda P. X., age 63, sells tortillas and raises animals.  She has received various loans from FAPE, and she has shown herself to be a responsible and hard-working woman.  Through her business she has been able to support her children so that they continue their studies and will have careers.

Now that everything has gone up in price, especially the corn she needs for her tortilla business, she plans to buy several “quintales” (1 quintal = 46kg) of corn and firewood.  Due to the strong rains last year, the corn harvest was not good.  This has caused corn prices to rise.  

The loan will help her to be able to buy wholesale and have a small reserve of corn.  On the other hand, she always has her animals to raise as the pigs and chickens are growing.  When the time comes to sell them, she helps with her tortilla business.  This way she is able to keep helping and supporting her family.

She says that she is very happy to have the opportunity to receive the capital to continue investing in her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and firewood to make tortillas

loans.name: Evaliste

texts.fr: Evaliste N. est salarié, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il a 53 ans, il est marié, né au Rwanda, et il a 4 enfants entre 6 an et 18 ans.  4 de ses enfants va à l’école, et Evariste a fini 3 ans d’école poste-primaire.  Ce crédit est son 10 eme cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de cultiver les mais en augmentant l’espace de cultiver.  Il voudrait s’autofinancer, et aussi éduquer ses enfants jusqu’à un niveau universitaire.
texts.en: Evaliste N. is a salaried employee and has been a client of ACB (one of Kiva's field partners) since 2007. He is 53 years old, married, was born in Rwanda, and has four children, who are between 6 and 18 years old. Four of his children attend school, and Evaliste completed 3 years of post-primary school. This loan is his 10th cycle with ACB, and he is going to use it to pay for his children's school fees. His strategy to raise his business is to cultivate maize and increase his farming land. He would like to be self-financing, and also to educate his children through the university level.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a young man from Hebron. He is married and a father of one son. Ammar got married recently and couldn't furnish all the house, and as he has a baby now, he needs to prepare a room for him.

Ammar, who is photographed here, took out a loan from FATEN to purchase furniture for the baby's room, Ammar is employed and will be able to repay on a monthly basis rather than paying the cost of  a room full of furniture all at once.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his baby's room.

loans.name: Dulia Justina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En esta comunidad de Arin conocimos a la señora Dulia Justina de 36 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Calca, que pertenece al departamento del Cusco. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Dulia Justina tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde cosecha y siembre dependiendo a la época diferentes productos como por ejemplo maíz, papa y otras cosas más.  En algunas oportunidades Dulia Justina vende a los pobladores y provee sus productos en diferentes mercados de las diferentes ciudades como Calca, Urubamba y Cusco. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran vegetales y hortalizas. Desde hace 15 años que trabaja en la agricultura y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

El crédito que ha solicitado Dulia Justina es de 700 nuevos soles a Asociación Arariwa, será destinado para comprar más semillas. Dulia Justina es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
The community of Arin is located in the city of Calca in the department of Cusco. This community is known for its beautiful landscapes, for its food, and for the quality of its people.

Mrs. Dulia Justina, who lives in Arin, is 36 years old. He lives with his partner and two children in his own house, which has water and light. He lives in the province of Calca, which is in the department of Cusco. The primary activities in this area include agriculture, livestock raising, and tourism.

Dulia Justina has many pieces of land, where she grows and harvests different products, including corn, potatoes, etc., depending on the season. Dulia Justina sells her products to the people and in different markets in various cities, including Calca, Urubamba, and Cusco. Since she was young, her parents taught her this work, and now she has her own land, where she works with her partner. They carefully grow vegetables. For 15 years, she has worked in agriculture and it has gone well thanks to the determination she puts into her work.

Dulia Justina is requesting a loan for 700 nuevos soles from Asociación, which she will use to buy more seeds. Dulia Justina is a hard-working and enterprising woman, and has gone forward to improve her life so that she can have what she wants.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy, 45, is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Sophy, 41, stays at home and does house work. They have been married since 1989 and have five children: one son and four daughters. Three are garment factory workers and the other two are in school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Savy hopes to change his business from motor taxi to tuk tuk, because a tuk tuk's passenger cab can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. That’s why he decided to request a loan of $700 to buy a tuk tuk.

Photo: Savy and his wife.

loans.use: To buy a tuk tuk.

loans.name: Madefamati

texts.fr: Mariée à un enseignant, et mère de 02 enfant, Madefamati  réside à TOKOIN FOREVER lieu où elle exerce son activité (vente de riz, huile végétale, sucre, lait). Elle achète depuis 2006 au Grand Marché. Ce montant lui permettra d’acheter des produits pour  aider la famille.
texts.en: Married to a teacher, and mother of two children, Madefamati lives in Tokoin Forever where she runs her business selling rice, vegetable oil, sugar, milk. Since 2006 she gets her supplies from the Grand Market. This loan amount will enable her to buy products to help her family.

loans.use: To buy staples (tomatoes, rice, vegetable oil)

loans.name: Neomida Pelagia

texts.es:
Neomida es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos (2 independientes). Tiene educación secundaria.
La señora es una socia reingresarte del Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de San José, del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo anterior fue de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de artículos artesanales.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/.  500.00 nuevo soles invertirá en la compra de diez kilos de lanas de diferentes colores para su producción de  prendas como chalinas, chompas y chalecos.  Dice que trabaja con un grupo de personas  para exportar sus productos a Estados Unidos.  Su esposo trabaja en el magisterio.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorar sus ingresos para que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, la unión y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Neomida is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de San José” which is located in the District of Mañazo, Province and Department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children (two of whom are independent). Neomida has a high school education.

She rejoined the “Santa Rosa de San José” Communal Bank and Manuela Ramos. Her previous loan in the amount of 500 PEN was invested in her business of selling handcrafted items.

With this new loan of 500 PEN, Neomida will invest in the purchase of 10 kilos of wool in different colors for producing garments such as scarves, sweaters, and vests. She says that she works with a group of people that exports their products to the United States. Her husband works in the teaching profession.

Her dreams are to continue working and improve her income so that her children can become professionals. What she enjoys about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan, the unity, and the responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase 10 kilos of wool in different colors.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien, 50 years old, is married and has two daughters. Hien and his family live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hien supports his family through the income he earns from silk-screen printing. Hien has worked as a silk-screen printer for 21 years. His wife also helps him to run the business. 

He intends to take a loan to buy better quality printing ink, frames and glue for fabric. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality printing ink, frames and glue

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Mr. Ek, age 49, is a farmer. His wife, age 46, is a grocery seller in the village. Mr. Ek is the head of a family of five children. He and his wife earn about $6 daily to support the family, which is not enough, so some of the children help provide additional monthly income. 

In order to offer his family greater prosperity in the future and to better support his family at present, Mr. Ek would like to request a loan in the amount of $1,100 in order to purchase land.

loans.use: to purchase land .

loans.name: Rachid Abed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married, and has six children. 

A. has owned a store since 1995, selling all kinds of fish, both fresh and grilled. He has good experience,  a deep understanding of local consumers, and a good reputation. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent for his store. He aims to make more money which will offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Msisiri Group

texts.en:
Maulidi, who is in his early 40s, is married with one child who goes to school. He has been selling fruit and vegetables for 10 years now.  He works from 3am to 11 am (works in the mornings only) daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania; he wants to use it to buy more sacks of vegetables. He collects his vegetable from the farmers who bring them from upcountry at wholesale prices and has to be at the marketplace at 3am in order to get good quality and a lot of sacks of vegetables.  He then sells at retail price.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group  "Msisiri" which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of vegetables.

loans.name: Luz Georgina

texts.es:
Luz D. 51 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Ella  cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio desD. hace 5 años. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos D. consumo diario entre ellos productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes, actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada.  Con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta D. sus productos  trata D. cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad D. productos comestibles para comercializar en su negocio, con el único ideal D. que su negocio sea cada vez más granD. y tenga productos surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Luz es una persona responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles lo mejor a su familia y ayudarlos alcanzar sus metas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz is 51 years old, lives with her husband and son in a house they own, the house doesn't count with basic services and is located in the rural district of TambogranD. that belongs to the department of Piura, characterized for farming and craft activites.

Five years ago Luz started selling basic needs products (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc) and beverages, her business is located at home for convenience and security, with the profits she covers the family expenses and tries to improve her family's quality of life.

To stock her business she has requested a loan to Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 new soles to buy merchandise with the wish that her business grows and has a variety of products for her clients.  Luz is a responsible and hardworking person that cares to proviD. for her family and help her children achieve their goals.

loans.use: Compra de mayor cantidad de productos comestibles para comercializar en su bodega.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is a 39-year-old beautician, who lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. 
Trang runs a beauty shop from her house. She began working in this profession two years ago.
Trang is requesting a loan to buy some hairdriers, steamers and stretching machines and other basic supplies for her beauty shop. She hopes that this will enable her to better serve her existing customers and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy some hairdriers, steamers and stretching machines and other necessary supplies for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Kourbinal Group

texts.fr:
Mme Oumou est la représentante du groupe KOURBINAL. Elle est mariée et mère de 01 enfant. Il a 20ans.01 va à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Elle vend  des broderies, couscous, soumbala et de la farine depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne au yaar de pissy en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 1 sac de grains de néré pour la préparation du soumbala, 10 sacs de maïs et un rouleau de tissu pour broderie.

Mme épargne ses économies pour agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et construire un grand magasin de stockage.
texts.en: Oumou is the "Kourbinal" group´s representative. She is married and the mother of one child who is 20 and goes to school. She has 6 dependents in total. For the past 20 years she has been selling divers products including embroideries and foodstuffs like, couscous, soumbala (a traditional spice) and flour. She gets her supplies in the town of Pissy and she will use the loan to buy nereid seeds (needed to make soumbala), 10 sacs of corn and a roll of fabric to embroider. Oumou is building up her savings so that she can pay for her children´s educational expenses, expand her business and build a large warehouse.

loans.use: to buy nereid seeds (needed to make soumbala), 10 sacs of corn and a roll of fabric to embroider.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина умная, самостоятельная . Ей 25 лет. Она не замужем. Зарина уже 5 лет  занимается продажей тканей. Она одна в бизнесе, никто из членов семьи ей не помогает. У Зарины есть торговая точка на рынке. Она решительная и смелая и старается всегда идти вперед. У  Зарины много клиентов, потому что ее товар качественный и  имеет спрос. Она хочет получить кредит для покупки товаров, чтобы развить бизнес и пополнить капитал.
texts.en: Zarina is smart and independent.  She is 25 years old and single.  Zarina has been involved in selling fabrics for five years.  She is alone in this business, and none of her family members help her.  Zarina has a retail outlet at the market.  She is decisive and smart and tries to always move ahead.  Zarina has many customers because her merchandise is of high quality and is in demand.  She wants to obtain a loan to buy merchandise in order to develop her business and refill the capital.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in order to develop business and refill capital

loans.name: Luz Del Mundo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz del Mundo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras las cuales han tenido 7 créditos con Adim en los cuales se han perfilados como clientas AA. Una de ellas es Concepción de María quien vende pescado y productos Avon. Ella tiene cuatro hijos pero solo los menores están con ella de 13 y 11 años. 

Las otras integrantes son Quira Pastora 26 años quien vende marisco desde hace 15 años y Lucia de 41 años vende de todo un poco de acuerdo a la temporada pero su negocio principal y en el que invertirá el credito ahorita es ern el reciclaje y venta de marisco.
texts.en:
The group Luz del Mundo [Light of the World] is made up of three enterprising and hard-working women who have had seven cycles with ADIM and who have been selected as AA (approved for supplemental loans). One of them is Concepción de María who sells fish and Avon products. She has four children but only the younger ones are dependent on her—the 13 and 11 year olds.

The other members are Quira, 26 years old, who has been selling seafood for 15 years and Lucia who is 41 years old and works doing a little of everything according to the season but her principal business and what she'll invest in right now is in recycling and seafood sales.

loans.use: to buy fish and Avon products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 48 años es una mujer calmada. Vive en compañía de Oscar, su esposo desde hace 22 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. Gracias a su buen carácter ella, logró afrontar muchos problemas con optimismo. Aún cuenta con terrenos arrendados, eso hace que trabaje con más empeño, ya que tiene que pagar lo arriendos anuales. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, maíz, alverja y habas, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación ya que depende de ello su ingreso económico. Pero consiente que las cosecha solo son una vez al año. También se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas y ovejas, las cuales enseba para comercializarlos a buen precio. Asimismo tiene una vaca y un becerro, lo que produce leche, que comercializa a 2 nuevos soles por litro de esa manera obtiene un ingreso adicional. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Hualahoyo al progreso” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes semilla para su nuevo sembrío de papa “yungay”.
texts.en: María, 48, is a very calm person.  She lives with her husband of 22 years, Oscar.  They have six children but only four of them live at home in the town of Hualahoyo.  Because of her good disposition, she has been able to face her problems with much optimism.  She rents farmland which means she has to work even harder to pay the yearly rent.  Her main crops are potatoes, corn, peas and lima beans and she cares for them with much dedication since her income depends on this.  But since she is conscious of the fact that harvest only occurs once a year she also raises small animals such as hens and sheep which she sells for a good price.  And she has a dairy cow and calf and sells milk for 2 PEN a liter which adds to her income.  She belongs to the communal bank "Hualahoyo al progreso" and this is her first loan through MFP which she counts on for support in carrying out her plans.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She enjoys being a part of the association because all the members are responsible and very supportive.  María plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her new "Yungay" potato crop.

loans.use: To buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children.  Marilou has a pigpen that sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.  Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Ruben tiene 39 años de edad,  vive en la aldea de Nuevos Colorados, ahi vive con sus dos hijos, Ruben se dedica a prestar los servicios de transporte, tiene un taxi, el tiene clientes ya fijos que los transporta de su casa a sus trabajos y viceversa todos los dias. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para el taxi, desea repararlo para dar un mejor servicio, este taxi es su unica fuente de ingresos y Ruben trabaja muy duro para salir adelante con sus dos hijos, es  honrado y responsable, desea tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ruben is 39 years old.  He lives in the small village of Nuevos Colorados together with his two children.  Ruben provides a transport service.  He has a taxi and regular customers who he transports from their homes to their places of work and back every day.  He will use his loan to buy spare parts for his taxi.  He would like to repair his taxi so that he can provide a better service.  The taxi is his only source of income and Ruben works very hard in order to get ahead in life together with his two children.  He is an honest and responsible man who would like to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires, oil and spare parts

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh, 47 years old, is married and has a son. He supports his family through the income he earns from his food stall that occupies the front of his house. He sells meals such as rice with grilled pork and noodles for people in his community. His wife also helps him to manage his food stall. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Binh intends to take a loan to repair his house to provide a better site for his business. He hopes that the repairs will enable him to serve a larger number of customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and helps him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his house to create a better place for his business

loans.name: Luz Natividad

texts.es:
Luz Natividad tiene 48 años Unión Libre, vive con su Esposo  y sus  hijos de 22,25,24,18,12.años de edad  Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz hace 25 años.
Luz Natividad  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa y un terreno.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres descanso.
texts.en:
Luz Natividad is 48. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her husband and children, ages 12, 18, 22, 24 and 25. They live in the district of Aguas Frías de Mocache, in the Mocache Canton.
The El Progreso Communal Bank is located in the Aguas Frías de Mocache district. The members of this group have worked in short-cycle agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for 25 years.
Luz Natividad works in agriculture sowing corn and rice. She buys in Mocache and sells in the Mocache market.
She requested this loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer and manure for her crops. This loan will help her to increase her family's income and invest in her crops. Her dream is to buy a home and a plot of land.
She quite enjoys relaxing during her free time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime es costurero. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima, especialmente telas, forros hilos y cierres para su negocio. Jaime  es soltero y tiene un  hijo. Vive en casa de su hermana ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a kiva y también la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en: Jaime is a tailor.  He needs the loan to buy raw materials, especially fabric, lining and zippers for his business.  Jaime is single and has a son.  He lives in his sister’s house located in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.  This is the first time he’s worked with Kiva and also the first time he’s requested a loan from Impro.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.
